lines.gurmukhi: hvwie bMdgI Awvurd dr vjUd mrw
lines.transliteration_english: havaae bandhagee aavuradh dhar vajoodh maraa

Shabad OS N.translation: The attraction of meditation and religious devotion brought me into this world,

lines.gurmukhi: vgrnw zoik cunIN n bUd mrw ]1]1]
lines.transliteration_english: vagaranaa zok chunee n boodh maraa | 1 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Otherwise, I had no urge to come. (1) (1)

lines.transliteration_english: khush asath oumar kih dhar yaadh biguzaradh varanaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Only that part of my life is useful and happy that is spent in remembering the Akaalpurakh

lines.transliteration_english: ch haasal asath azeen gunbadh kaboodh maraa | 1 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Otherwise what is the benefit to me from this blue sky or the world. (1) (2)

lines.transliteration_english: dharaa zamaa k niaaee ba-yaadh mee-marama

Shabad OS N.translation: For any moment that you are out of my remembrance, I feel that I am dying,

lines.gurmukhi: bZYr Xwid qU zIN zIsqn ich sUd mrw ]1]3]
lines.transliteration_english: baghair yaadh thoo zee zeesathan chih soodh maraa | 1 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: What is the purpose of my life (it became worthless) without your reminiscence.(1) (3)

lines.transliteration_english: fidhaasath jaano dhil man ba-khaak maradham paaka

Shabad OS N.translation: I can sacrifice my heart and soul uninhibitedly for (the dust of the feet of) this holy person

lines.gurmukhi: hr AwN ksy ikh bU-sUie qU rih nmUd mrw ]1]4]
lines.transliteration_english: har aa kasae kih boo-sooe thoo rehi namoodh maraa | 1 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who has shown me the way to You, the Akaalpurakh. (1) (4)

lines.transliteration_english: naboodh heech nishaan haa zi-aasamaano zamee

Shabad OS N.translation: There was no sign-posts on the Pilgrim's way through earth or sky at that time,

lines.gurmukhi: ik SOik rUie qU Awvurd dr sjUd mrw ]1]5]
lines.transliteration_english: k shaauak rooe thoo aavuradh dhar sajoodh maraa | 1 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When my longing for Your glimpse made me prostrate in Your honor. (1) (5)

lines.transliteration_english: baghair yaadh thoo goyaa namee thavaanam zeesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: O Goya! I cannot live without Your remembrance, If pining for you ceases, then an end to life is the only thing coveted;

lines.gurmukhi: bsUie dosq rhweI idhMd zUd mrw ]1]6]
lines.transliteration_english: basooe dhosath rehaaee dhihandh zoodh maraa | 1 | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I will be free then to move in the direction of my Beloved. (1) (6)

lines.gurmukhi: dIno dunIAw dr kmMid AwN prI ru^swir mw
lines.transliteration_english: dheeno dhuneeaa dhar kamandh aa paree rukhasaar maa

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the religion and the actions of the world are in the grip of my beloved, handsome and fairy-faced friend.

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm kImiq X?k qwir mUie Xwir mw ]2]1]
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam keemath yak thaar mooe yaar maa | 2 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the worlds, this and the next, are (not) equal to or match the price (weight) of just one hair of my friend-mentor, Guru Gobind Singh Ji. (2) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: mw nmI Awrym qwib Zmzwie imzgwin aU
lines.transliteration_english: maa namee aaraem thaab ghamazaae mizagaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: I don't have the strength to bear the intensity of even one of his skewed looks,

lines.gurmukhi: X?k ingwih jwN-iPzwieS bs bvd drkwir mw ]2]2]
lines.transliteration_english: yak nigaahi jaa-fizaaeish bas bavadh dharakaar maa | 2 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Just one of his (blessed) looks, that prolongs life instantly, is enough for me. (2) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: gwhy sUPI gwhy zwihd gih klMdr mI Svd
lines.transliteration_english: gaahae soofee gaahae zaahidh gehi kalandhar mee shavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Sometimes, he acts like a mystic, sometimes like a meditator, and other times like a carefree recluse;

lines.gurmukhi: rMghwie mu^qilP dwrd buiq AXwr mw ]2]3]
lines.transliteration_english: rangehaae mukhathalif dhaaradh buth ayaar maa | 2 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He is our pilot steering our way; he operates in numerous different postures. (2) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: kdir lwAil aU bjuz AwiSk nwN dwnd hIc ks
lines.transliteration_english: kadhar laaal oo bajuz aashik naa dhaanadh heech kasa

Shabad OS N.translation: Who other than his true devotee-lover can evaluate his pearl-like lips?

lines.gurmukhi: kImiq XwkUq dwnd cSim gOhr bwir mw ]2]4]
lines.transliteration_english: keemath yaakooth dhaanadh chasham gaauehar baar maa | 2 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The value of this gem is only appreciated by a diamond-rearing-vision. (2) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: hr nPs goXw b-Xwd nrgis m^mUir aU
lines.transliteration_english: har nafas goyaa ba-yaadh naragas makhamoor oo

Shabad OS N.translation: During every moment of Goyaa's life, my alert heart and soul are relishing

lines.gurmukhi: bwdwhwie SOk mI-noSd idil huiSAwir mw ]2]5]
lines.transliteration_english: baadhaahaae shaauak mee-noshadh dhil hushiaar maa | 2 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: the memory of intoxication of his Narcissus-like-imbued eyes. (2) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: bidh swkI mrw X?k jwm zwN rMgInIie idlhw
lines.transliteration_english: badhih saakee maraa yak jaam zaa rangeeneee dhilehaa

Shabad OS N.translation: O bartender! Kindly spare a heart-warming-shot out of your enjoyable intoxication for me also,

lines.gurmukhi: bcSim pwk-bIx Awswx kunm eI jumlw muSikl hw ]3]1]
lines.transliteration_english: bachasham paaka-been aasaan kunam ee jumalaa mushakil haa | 3 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: so that with my eyes of recognizing the God-sent prophet, I can solve all my riddles. (3) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: mrw dr mMizl jwnwN hmw AYSo hmw SwdI
lines.transliteration_english: maraa dhar manzil jaanaa hamaa aisho hamaa shaadhee

Shabad OS N.translation: When moving towards the destination, my Beloved, I am ever in blissful elation.

lines.gurmukhi: jrs byhUdw mI-nwld kujw bMdym mihml hw ]3]2]
lines.transliteration_english: jaras baehoodhaa mee-naaladh kujaa bandhaem mehimal haa | 3 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The bell in the neck of a female camel is peeling for nothing. It cannot stop me from proceeding to my goal. (3) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: ^udw hwizr bvd dwiem bbIN dIdwir pwikS rw
lines.transliteration_english: khudhaa haazir bavadh dhaaeim babee dheedhaar paakish raa

Shabad OS N.translation: The Akaalpurakh is Omnipresent. Our strive to seek his glimpses should be spontaneous

lines.gurmukhi: nw igrdwby drU hwiel nw dirAwE nw swihl hw ]3]3]
lines.transliteration_english: naa giradhaabae dharoo haaeil naa dhariaaou naa saahil haa | 3 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Without any obstacle of the whirlpool, the torrent or the bank of the river. (3) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: icrw byhUdw mIgrdI b-sihrw E b-dsq AY idl
lines.transliteration_english: chiraa baehoodhaa meegaradhee ba-sehiraa ou ba-dhasath ai dhila

Shabad OS N.translation: Why are we wandering (aimlessly) in jungles and wildernesses,

lines.gurmukhi: cUM AwN sulqwin KUbwN krdw AMdr dIdw mMizl hw ]3]4]
lines.transliteration_english: choon aa sulathaan khoobaa karadhaa andhar dheedhaa manzil haa | 3 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When He, The Master of Beauty, has made his abode in our own eyes? (3) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM ZYr Az jwiq-pwikS nIsq dr hr jw ik mI-bInm
lines.transliteration_english: choon ghair az jaathi-paakish neesath dhar har jaa k mee-beenama

Shabad OS N.translation: When I look around without the Akaalpurakh, I see only a big void;

lines.gurmukhi: bgo goXw kujw ibguzwrm eIN duinAw E AYhil hw ]3]5]
lines.transliteration_english: bago goyaa kujaa biguzaaram ee dhuniaa ou aihal haa | 3 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then Goyaa, you tell me, with whom can I entrust this world and my family and household affairs? (3) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: ibAw AY swkIey rMgIn iz mY pur kun A?XwZ eINjw
lines.transliteration_english: biaa ai saakeeeae rangeen z mai pur kun ayaagh eejaa

Shabad OS N.translation: O bartender! Please fill up my glass with a colored alcohol, cup of love,

lines.gurmukhi: nSwie lwAl mY-gUnq iz h?k b^Sd surwg eIxjw ]4]1]
lines.transliteration_english: nashaae laaal mai-goonath z hak bakhashadh suraag eenajaa | 4 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because ruby-colored alcohol will give me clues towards my Master. (4) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: Anl-h?k Az lib mnsUr gr cUM SISw kulkul krd
lines.transliteration_english: anala-hak az lab manasoor gar choon sheeshaa kulakul karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: If the long-necked decanter, like the word, 'Analhaqq', coming out of Mansoor's lips, were to create the ripple sound,

lines.gurmukhi: ikh Awrd qwib eIN shbw kujw jwim idmwg eINjw ]4]2]
lines.transliteration_english: kih aaradh thaab ee sehabaa kujaa jaam dhimaag eejaa | 4 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, who will endure the strength of such a wee-hour alcohol? And where would there be a brain-cup (to receive such a powerful drink)? (4) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: jhwx qwrIk Sud jwnwx br A&rUz eIx k?id rwAnw
lines.transliteration_english: jehaan thaareek shudh jaanaan bar afarooz een kadh raaanaa

Shabad OS N.translation: There is darkness in the world. O beloved! Enhance your beauty by increased burnishing, and your moon-face be a candle to the way-farer.

lines.gurmukhi: numw ru^swrwie qwbwx ik mI-bwied crwZ eIx jw ]4]3]
lines.transliteration_english: numaa rukhasaaraae thaabaan k mee-baaeidh charaagh een jaa | 4 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And make your face conspicuously identifiable, because there is a need of a light (lamp) in this world. (4) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: b?eIx X?k-dm ik Xwd Awied qvwN aumry bsr burdn
lines.transliteration_english: baeen yaka-dham k yaadh aaeidh thavaa oumarae basar buradhana

Shabad OS N.translation: The whole life becomes worth living if we can grab a moment (ecstacy) in our Master's remembrance,

lines.gurmukhi: Agr Xkdm ksy bwied bSOik h?k &rwg eINjw ]4]4]
lines.transliteration_english: agar yakadham kasae baaeidh bashaauak hak faraag eejaa | 4 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Provided, one happens to have such a trice of eagerness, keenness and zest for Akaalpurakh's love. (4) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: do cSim mn ik drXwie AzImu?Swx bvd goXw
lines.transliteration_english: dho chasham man k dharayaae azeemushaan bavadh goyaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, Both of my eyes are like a long and large stream,

lines.gurmukhi: iz hr ASkm bvd SwdwbIie sd bwZ bwZ eIxjw ]4]5]
lines.transliteration_english: z har ashakam bavadh shaadhaabeee sadh baagh baagh eenajaa | 4 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And every tear coming out of them can bring greenery to hundreds of smiling gardens (because of my faith). (4) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: rih-rswin rwih h?k Awmd Adb
lines.transliteration_english: rehi-rasaan raahi hak aamadh adhaba

Shabad OS N.translation: It is essential for the travellers on the path towards the Creator to have His remembrance in their hearts,

lines.gurmukhi: hm bidl Xwid ^udw v hm blb ]5]1]
lines.transliteration_english: ham badhil yaadh khudhaa v ham balab | 5 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And additionally, should have meditation of His Naam on their lips. (5) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: hr kujw dIdym Anvwir ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: har kujaa dheedhaem anavaar khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: At every place, I observe the radiance and manifestation of the Providence

lines.gurmukhi: bsik Az suhbiq bzurgwx Sud jzb ]5]2]
lines.transliteration_english: basak az suhabath bazuragaan shudh jazab | 5 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When I get absorbed in the company of noble souls (which confers on me the blessing of realization). (5) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: cSim-mw ZYr Az jmwlS vw nw Sud
lines.transliteration_english: chashami-maa ghair az jamaalash vaa naa shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: Our (inside) eyes cannot be really opened without Akaalpurakh's elegance,

lines.gurmukhi: zwx ik jumlw ^lk rw dIdym r?b ]5]3]
lines.transliteration_english: zaan k jumalaa khalak raa dheedhaem rab | 5 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because we perceive His presence in the entire humanity. (5) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wik kdmS rOSnIie ijl kund
lines.transliteration_english: khaak kadhamash raauashaneee jil kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The dust of their feet (humility) can enlighten our hearts, provided,

lines.gurmukhi: Zr qurwbw swilkwN bwSd nsb ]5]4]
lines.transliteration_english: ghar thuraabaa saalikaa baashadh nasab | 5 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: we can establish a sound relationship with those noble souls who are treading this path (of deep devotion for the Master). (5) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: kIsq goXw ku mrwid idl n Xw&q
lines.transliteration_english: keesath goyaa k maraadh dhil n yaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Bhai Sahib (Goyaa) is posing the question: Who is that person

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy bw nPis ^ud krdw jzb ]5]5]
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae baa nafas khudh karadhaa jazab | 5 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: whose inner desires have not been fulfilled after he can get over his ego? (5) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: idl AZr dwnw bvd AMdr iknwrS Xwr hsq
lines.transliteration_english: dhil aghar dhaanaa bavadh andhar kinaarash yaar hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: If our mind and heart were intelligent, then the Beloved is in their embrace, and,

lines.gurmukhi: cSm gr bInw bvd dr hr qr& dIdwr hsq ]6]1]
lines.transliteration_english: chasham gar beenaa bavadh dhar har tharaf dheedhaar hasath | 6 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: if our eyes were able to appreciate all that they see, then, they will see glimpses and glimpses (of the Beloved) all over. (6) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: hr qrP dIdwr A?mw dIdwie bInw kujw hsq
lines.transliteration_english: har tharaf dheedhaar amaa dheedhaae beenaa kujaa hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: There are glimpses and glimpses (of the Beloved) all over, but where is the eye to appreciate them?

lines.gurmukhi: hr qrP qUr Asq hr sU SoAlwey Anvwr hsq ]6]2]
lines.transliteration_english: har tharaf thoor asath har soo shoalaaeae anavaar hasath | 6 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: There is the Mount Sinai all over, and there are leaping flames of His glow and refulgence. (6) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: sr Agr dwrI ibrO sr rw ibinh br pwie aU
lines.transliteration_english: sar agar dhaaree biraau sar raa binih bar paae oo

Shabad OS N.translation: If you have a head on your body, you should go to Him and place it on His lotus feet;

lines.gurmukhi: jwx Agr dwrI inswirS kun Agr drkwr hsq ]6]3]
lines.transliteration_english: jaan agar dhaaree nisaarish kun agar dharakaar hasath | 6 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, if you have life in you which you value very much, then sacrifice it for Him. (6) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: dsq Agr dwrI ibrO dwmwin jwnwx rw bgIr
lines.transliteration_english: dhasath agar dhaaree biraau dhaamaan jaanaan raa bageera

Shabad OS N.translation: If you have a hand, then grab and hold tight the corner of His robe.

lines.gurmukhi: sUey aUo mI rO Agr pw rw sir rPqwr hsq ]6]4]
lines.transliteration_english: sooeae ooo mee raau agar paa raa sar rafathaar hasath | 6 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: If your feet are anxious (or have the strength) to walk, then start walking fast towards Him. (6) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: ZoS Agr Sunvw bvd jz nwim h?k ky ibSnvd
lines.transliteration_english: ghosh agar shunavaa bavadh jaz naam hak kae bishanavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: If we have ears that have perfect hearing then they should not hear anything other than the Naam of Akaalpurakh.

lines.gurmukhi: vr zubwx goXw bvd dr hr s^un Asrwr hsq ]6]5]
lines.transliteration_english: var zubaan goyaa bavadh dhar har sakhun asaraar hasath | 6 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: If our tongue has the power to speak, then it should utter mystic expressions. (6) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: by-Adb pw rw minh mnsUr vS dr rwih ieSk
lines.transliteration_english: bae-adhab paa raa manih manasoor vash dhar raahi eishaka

Shabad OS N.translation: A Brahmin is a devotee of his idol and a Muslim of his shrine;

lines.gurmukhi: rwh riv eIx rwh rw Av?l kdm br dwr hsq ]6]6]
lines.transliteration_english: raah rav een raah raa aval kadham bar dhaar hasath | 6 | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I am enamored wherever I find an adorer-connoisseur of 'devotion'. (6) (6)

lines.gurmukhi: bRhmn muSqwik bu?q zwihd i&dwie ^wnkwh
lines.transliteration_english: brehaman mushathaak buth zaahidh fidhaae khaanakaaha

Shabad OS N.translation: Like Mansorr, do not step on the path of devotion with arrogance,

lines.gurmukhi: hr kujw jwim muh?bq dIdwAm srSwr hsq ]6]7]
lines.transliteration_english: har kujaa jaam muhabath dheedhaaam sarashaar hasath | 6 | 7 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Otherwise, it is a path where there is a crucifix at the very first step.(6) (7)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ic dwrI dr bjwiq ^ud inswir Xwr kun
lines.transliteration_english: har ch dhaaree dhar bajaath khudh nisaar yaar kuna

Shabad OS N.translation: Goya says, If your disposition is similar to mine of getting mollified by diamonds,

lines.gurmukhi: gr qurw mwinMid goXw, qbwAwie gohr bwr hsq ]6]8]
lines.transliteration_english: gar thuraa maanindh goyaa, thabaaaae gohar baar hasath | 6 | 8 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Even then, you should willingly sacrifice all your assets for your Beloved. (6) (8)

lines.gurmukhi: gdwie kUie qurw mYil bwdSwhI nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: gadhaae kooe thuraa mail baadhashaahee neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa, the beggar and mendicant in your street, has absolutely no desire for an imperial kingdom,

lines.gurmukhi: hvwie slqnqo zoik kjkulwhI nIsq ]7]1]
lines.transliteration_english: havaae salathanatho zok kajakulaahee neesath | 7 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He does have a desire for a realm but not only for the sake of a royal tilted cap of power (which brings in ego). (7) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: hr Awx ik mmlkiq idl igRPq sulqwx Sud
lines.transliteration_english: har aan k mamalakath dhil grifath sulathaan shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever has won over the realm of 'mind', he is considered as the all-powerful monarch,

lines.gurmukhi: ksy ik Xw&q qurw hmcU E ispwhI nIsq ]7]2]
lines.transliteration_english: kasae k yaafath thuraa hamachoo ou sipaahee neesath | 7 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, whosoever has discovered You does not have a rival as a soldier. (7) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: gdwie kUie qurw bwdSwih hr do srw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: gadhaae kooe thuraa baadhashaahi har dho saraa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: (Addressing Dasam Guru) An established beggar in your street is the emperor of both the worlds,

lines.gurmukhi: AsIir ^iq qurw hwjiq gvwhI nIsq ]7]3]
lines.transliteration_english: aseer khath thuraa haajath gavaahee neesath | 7 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The captive of the ecstasy of the love of your burgeoning hair is not just looking for resurrection. (7) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: kudwm dIdw ik dr vY svwid nUir qU nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: kudhaam dheedhaa k dhar vai savaadh noor thoo neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Which is that eye that does not have the glow of Your glory?

lines.gurmukhi: kudwm sInw ik aU m^zin ielwhI nIsq ]7]4]
lines.transliteration_english: kudhaam seenaa k oo makhazan eilaahee neesath | 7 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Which is that body (chest) that doesn't have godly treasures in it? (7) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: i&dwie aU SO v aujry mKwh AY goXw
lines.transliteration_english: fidhaae oo shaau v oujarae makhaah ai goyaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, Do not hesitate or make excuses but sacrifice yourself for Him,

lines.gurmukhi: ik dr qrIkiq-mwjwie auzr ^whI nIsq ]7]5]
lines.transliteration_english: k dhar thareekathi-maajaae ouzar khaahee neesath | 7 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because in the vocabulary of lovers (of true devotees), there is no word like 'excuse'. (7) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: Az pyiS cSm AwN buiq nwN-imhrbwN guzSq
lines.transliteration_english: az paesh chasham aa buth naa-miharabaa guzashatha

Shabad OS N.translation: A non-compassionate cruel beloved passed through before my eyes;

lines.gurmukhi: jwnwN guzSq qw ic rhy dIdw jwN guzSq ]8]1]
lines.transliteration_english: jaanaa guzashath thaa ch rehae dheedhaa jaa guzashath | 8 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: As the beloved went through, it was as if my life (heart and soul) passed away through my eyes. (8) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: rogS kbUd v idlS pur Srwrw sw^q
lines.transliteration_english: rogash kaboodh v dhilash pur sharaaraa saakhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The smoke from my continued sighs rose high and deep through the sky,

lines.gurmukhi: Az bsik dUid Awih mn Az AwsmwN guzSq ]8]2]
lines.transliteration_english: az basak dhoodh aahi man az aasamaa guzashath | 8 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That they changed its very complexion into teal-blue color and charred its heart. (8) (2)

lines.transliteration_english: az nizaae kufaro dheen dhil bareham asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: I would look for anyone who would save me at the door of the abode of Akaalpurakh.(Would someone save me when I have brought a plea at the door of the Creator.)' (15) (3)

Shabad OS N.translation: Playful, sportive and arrogant so called lovers have looted and conned the world.

Shabad OS N.translation: I am crying for mercy that I, too, have been exploited by them and are begging so that someone would please save me. (15) (4)

lines.transliteration_english: k z dhasath khanjar mizaghaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: How can Goyaa keep quiet from the dagger-like eyelids of the Master Guru;

lines.transliteration_english: mee shavadh khaamosh goyaa alaghiaas | 15 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I am still yelling for help. Someone would kindly save me. (15) (5)

Shabad OS N.translation: Just as a drunk is only looking for and is concerned with a wine glass with ruby-colored drink (wine or alcohol),

lines.transliteration_english: thishanaa raa ba-aab seereen eihathiaaj | 16 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Similarly, a thirsty person needs a glass of cold sweet water to quench his thirst, a glass of wine is not relevant. (16) (1)

lines.transliteration_english: suhabath maradhaani-hak bas anavar asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The company of the devotees of Akaalpurakh is saturated with radiance;

lines.transliteration_english: thaalibaan raa hasath chadheen eihathiaaj | 16 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This is all the association that the seekers of Waaheguru really need. (16) (2)

lines.transliteration_english: az thabasum karadhaaee gulashan jehaa

Shabad OS N.translation: One can make this world a beautiful garden with one's smile,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik dIdS kY b-gulcIN iehiqAwj ]16]3]
lines.transliteration_english: har k dheedhash kai ba-gulachee eihathiaaj | 16 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Why would one need a gardener, after he had a glimpse of heavenly Him?(16) (3)

lines.transliteration_english: yak nigaahi luthaf thoo dhil mee-buradha

Shabad OS N.translation: One of your loving and affectionate glances is enough to take away my breath,

lines.transliteration_english: baaz mee-dhaaram azaan een eihathiaaj | 16 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But, still, I plead before Him for mercy and this is what I need the most. (16) (4)

lines.transliteration_english: neesath goyaa ghar thoo dhar dho jehaana

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa is addressing the Guru: I have no one else but you in both the worlds.

lines.transliteration_english: baa thoo dhaaram az dhilo dheen eihathiaaj | 16 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, I need my heart and soul (faith) (want to live) only for you.(16) (5)

lines.transliteration_english: ai zulaf anbareen thoo goyaa nakaab subehaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Your firmament like lock of hair is just like a camouflage for the morning,

lines.transliteration_english: pinehaan choo zaer abar siaah aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Like a morning sun having been eclipsed under the black clouds. (17) (1)

Shabad OS N.translation: When my moon, while waking up from his day-sleep, came out,

lines.transliteration_english: sadh thaaanaa mee-zanadh b rukh aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When you, the Guru, emerged with your sleepy eyes from your Bed of love,

lines.transliteration_english: sharamindhaa gashath az rukh thoo aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The morning sun was chagrined and abashed to compare itself with the radiance of your face. (17) (3)

lines.transliteration_english: az makadham shareef jehaan raa dhihadh farogha

Shabad OS N.translation: When the slumbering morning sun takes off his veil from its face,

lines.transliteration_english: choon bara-kashadh nakaab z rukh aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With its fortunate arrival, it brings (day)light to the whole world. (17) (4)

lines.transliteration_english: baedhaaree asath zindhageee saahibaan shaauaka

Shabad OS N.translation: The whole life of worldly people is an unending night-long vigil and is an ever lasting amnesia,

lines.transliteration_english: goyaa haraam karadham az aaeindhaa khaab subehaa | 17 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, However, for me, sleeping during the wee hours of the morning will be forbidden, sinful and morally wrong from now on. (17) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: mI-burd dIno idlm eIx cSim So^
lines.transliteration_english: mee-buradh dheeno dhilam een chasham shokha

Shabad OS N.translation: This playful eye attracts and takes away my breath, heart and faith,

lines.transliteration_english: mee-kashadh az chaahi gham een chasham shokh | 18 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And it is the same lively eye that brings me out of my worries and sorrowful times. (18) (1)

lines.transliteration_english: kaakal o fithanaa zan aalam asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: One of his locks of hair can create a calamity and disaster in the world,

lines.transliteration_english: raauanak afazaae jehaan een chasham shokh | 18 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And just one of his eyes can bless the whole world with prosperity. (18) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wik pwie dosqIey idl buvd
lines.transliteration_english: khaak paae dhosatheeeae dhil buvadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa is praying, Wish my heart becomes the dust of the feet of my beloved (Guru) - humility,

lines.transliteration_english: haadheeeae raahi khudhaa een chasham shokh | 18 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And my sportive eye steers my way towards the Akaalpurakh. (18) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: kY kund aU sUie guil nrgs ingwh
lines.transliteration_english: kai kunadh oo sooe gul naragas nigaaha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who has tasted the savor of that mirthful eye (of the Guru),

lines.transliteration_english: har k dheedhaa lazath aan chasham shokh | 18 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Will never care to look at the Narcissus flower again. (18) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik rw goXw Zubwir idl inSsq
lines.transliteration_english: har k raa goyaa ghubaar dhil nishasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, Anyone who has had a glimpse of that sprightly eye (of the Guru) even once,

lines.transliteration_english: aan k dheedhaa yak nigaah aan chasham shokh | 18 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: would have all his suspicions and illusions completely dispelled.? (18) (5)

lines.transliteration_english: behosh baash k hangaam naauabehaar aamadha

lines.transliteration_english: behaar aamadh vaa yaar vaa karaar aamadh | 19 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The spring is here, my beloved, the Guru, has arrived, and now my heart is serene and at peace.? (19) (1)

lines.transliteration_english: dharoon maradhum chasham z bas k jalavaa garasatha

lines.transliteration_english: behar tharaf k nazar karadh rooe yaar aamadh | 19 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That wherever and in whichever direction, it may look, it sees only the loving face of my beloved, the Guru. (19) (2)

lines.transliteration_english: dhareen mukadhamaa maa raa chih akhathiaar aamadh | 19 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: yelling that he was the Lord, was seen proceeding towards the scaffold tonight. (19) (4)

Shabad OS N.translation: Inform all the flowers to begin blossoming, because

lines.transliteration_english: hadhees shok tho az bas k bae-shumaar aamadh | 19 | 6 |

lines.transliteration_english: mukaam amano khush goshaa yaar saraa ch kunadh | 20 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is as if it is making a strange chain link for my insane mind. (21) (1)

Shabad OS N.translation: That, the Lord created this body for His own abode. (21) (2)

lines.transliteration_english: k sharaah ksiaae majanoon maraa dheevaanaa mee saazadh | 21 | 5 |

lines.transliteration_english: sadh jaan fidhaae yak sar moee thoo meekunandh | 22 | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, they sacrifice hundreds of lives just for one lock of your hair. (22) (6)

lines.transliteration_english: dhar paradhaae jamaal thoo roshan shavadh jehaana

Shabad OS N.translation: When people talk of the notoriety and fame of your face,

lines.transliteration_english: dhar har tharaf k zikar zaradhee rooe thoo mee kunandh | 22 | 7 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, in the garb of your refulgence, the whole world gets illuminated and fragrance floats around. (22) (7)

Shabad OS N.translation: Like Goyaa, those with wounds of your love and captivated by your devotion,

lines.transliteration_english: aavaaz khusha-kalaam z booe thoo meekunandh | 22 | 8 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Always tune up their voices into melodies with your fragrance. (22) (8)

lines.gurmukhi: AY grdiS cSim qU ik A?Xwm n dwrd

Shabad OS N.translation: To capture the heart of the beloved hunter of the death,

lines.transliteration_english: choon chalakaae zulaf thoo dhigar dhaam nadhaaradh | 23 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: There is no better snare like the noose of your ravishing lock of hair. (23) (2)

lines.transliteration_english: een oumar giraan maayaae ghaneemath shumar aakhira

Shabad OS N.translation: This priceless life that we have been bestowed with should be considered as blessed,

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, we have not yet seen a morning (youth) that did not have an evening (old age). (23) (3)

lines.transliteration_english: een chasham gohar baar k dhariaa shudhaa goyaa

lines.transliteration_english: bae-rooe dhilaaram thoo aaraam na-dhaaradh | 23 | 5 |

lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil maa bandhageeath faramaaeidhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: My perfect Guru directs everyone to meditate the kaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy kwl mubwirk ik kund swihib hwl ]52]6]
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae kaal mubaarik k kunadh saahib haal | 52 | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Wonderful! How blessed is that word or expression that makes us His ardent adherent and leads to vanquishing the self. (52) (6)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik: goied qO ic: bwSI, v ic: goied juiz qo,
lines.transliteration_english: har ki: goeidh thaau chi: baashee, v chi: goeidh juz tho,a

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, Every body is asking me, who are you? And what can I call you!

lines.gurmukhi: gSq hYrW hmw Awlm hmw dr AYin jmwl ]52]7]
lines.transliteration_english: gashath hairaa(n) hamaa aalam hamaa dhar ain jamaal | 52 | 7 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The world is in the grip of perceptive eddy and everyone is searching for your majesty.? (52) (7)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM ^udw hwizr Asq dr hmw hwl
lines.transliteration_english: choon khudhaa haazir asath dhar hamaa haal

Shabad OS N.translation: When Waaheguru is Omnipresent to shield us in all predicaments,

lines.gurmukhi: qU icrw mI znI idgr pro bwl ]53]1]
lines.transliteration_english: thoo chiraa mee zanee dhigar paro baal | 53 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Why are you then wasting your time in making other (useless) efforts? (53) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: hmid h?k go idgr mgo AY jwx
lines.transliteration_english: hamadh hak go dhigar mago ai jaana

Shabad OS N.translation: You should praise the Lord, O my heart and soul! Do not utter any other word,

lines.gurmukhi: swihib kwl bwS v bMdwie hwl ]53]2]
lines.transliteration_english: saahib kaal baash v bandhaae haal | 53 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You should become a meditator of His Naam, and should become a true devotee of  the Master. (53) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr Xwid ^udw dmy ik guzSq
lines.transliteration_english: ghair yaadh khudhaa dhamae k guzashatha

Shabad OS N.translation: A moment spent in an  activity except in the remembrance of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx zvwl Asq pyiS Aihil kmwl ]53]3]
lines.transliteration_english: een zavaal asath paesh ahil kamaal | 53 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In the eyes of noble souls, that is a complete waste and downfall. (53) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: mw isvw nIsq hr kujw bInI
lines.transliteration_english: maa sivaa neesath har kujaa beenee

Shabad OS N.translation: Wherever you see, there is nothing but Him,

lines.gurmukhi: qU icrw Zw&lI dr AYin vswl ]53]4]
lines.transliteration_english: thoo chiraa ghaafalee dhar ain vasaal | 53 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, why are you so negligent (in remembering Him) when the meeting with Him is so obvious and clear? (53) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr hri& ^udw mgo goXw
lines.transliteration_english: ghair haraf khudhaa mago goyaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa! You should not utter any other word except the Naam of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: ik idgr pUc hsq kIlo kwl ]53]5]
lines.transliteration_english: k dhigar pooch hasath keelo kaal | 53 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, every other discourse is absolutely frivolous, hollow and baseless. (53) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: mw ik ^ud hr bMdwie h?k rw ^udw &ihmIdw eym
lines.transliteration_english: maa k khudh har bandhaae hak raa khudhaa fehimeedhaa eaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I have recognized every human being created by God as God Himself,

lines.gurmukhi: ^oSIqn rw bMdwie eIx bMdwhw &ihmIdw eym ]54]1]
lines.transliteration_english: khosheethan raa bandhaae een bandhaahaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, I consider myself a slave (servant) of all these slaves of Truth. (54) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: mrdumwin cSim mw rw eyhiqAwij surmw nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: maradhumaan chasham maa raa eaehathiaaj suramaa neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: My eyelids do not need any type of collyrium for existence,

lines.gurmukhi: bsik ^wik rwih mrdum qUqIAw &ihmIdw eym ]54]2]
lines.transliteration_english: basak khaak raahi maradhum thootheeaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, I have always considered the dust of the path traversed by God's men as the apt collyrium.? (54) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: hr n&s sr br zmIx dwrym Az bihry sjUd
lines.transliteration_english: har nafas sar bar zameen dhaaraem az behirae sajoodha

Shabad OS N.translation: We prostrate our head on the ground in prayers every moment and breath,

lines.gurmukhi: zwx ik rUie Xwir ^ud nUir ^udw &ihmIdw eym ]54]3]
lines.transliteration_english: zaan k rooe yaar khudh noor khudhaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, we have considered the face of our beloved reflecting the refulgence of Almighty. (54) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: bwdSwhwx rw &kIrwx bwdSwhI dwdw AMd
lines.transliteration_english: baadhashaahaan raa fakeeraan baadhashaahee dhaadhaa andha

Shabad OS N.translation: God's holy men, the saints, have bestowed the kingdoms to the worldly kings,

lines.gurmukhi: zwx gdwie kUie aU rw bwdSwh &ihmIdw eym ]54]4]
lines.transliteration_english: zaan gadhaae kooe oo raa baadhashaah fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is why I consider the noble souls (even lowly mendicants) in the street (abode) of my Beloved (Guru) as the kings (54) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: mw nmI ^whym mulko mwl rw goXw Azwx
lines.transliteration_english: maa namee khaahaem mulako maal raa goyaa azaana

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I have absolutely no desire or value for wealth and property, O Guru!

lines.gurmukhi: swieAwie zuli& qurw bwil humw &ihmIdw eym ]54]5]
lines.transliteration_english: saaeiaae zulaf thuraa baal humaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, I have considered a shadow of a lock of your hair as the feather of Humaa, the Phoenix, the mythical bird whose shadow is supposed to bring luck. (54) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: drUM mrdmuik dIdw idlrubw dIdm
lines.transliteration_english: dharoon maradhamuk dheedhaa dhilarubaa dheedhama

Shabad OS N.translation: I have perceived the heart-abductor in the eyelids of the man of vision,

lines.gurmukhi: bhr qr& ik nzr krdm AwSnw dIdm ]55]1]
lines.transliteration_english: behar tharaf k nazar karadham aashanaa dheedham | 55 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, wherever I cast a glance, I could only see my beloved Guru. (55) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: b-igrid kwbw E buq^wnw, hr do grdIdm,
lines.transliteration_english: ba-giradh kaabaa ou buthakhaanaa, har dho garadheedhama,a

Shabad OS N.translation: I have circumambulated both the places, the Kaabaa and the temple,

lines.gurmukhi: idZr n-Xw&qm AW jw, hmIN qurw dIdm ]55]2]
lines.transliteration_english: dhighar na-yaafatham aaa(n) jaa, hamee thuraa dheedham | 55 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I have not seen any one other than You anywhere. (55) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: b-hr kujw ik nzr krdm Az rih qhkIk
lines.transliteration_english: ba-har kujaa k nazar karadham az rehi thehakeeka

Shabad OS N.translation: Wherever and whenever I saw with eyes of search and concentration,

lines.gurmukhi: vly, b-^wnw-ie idl, ^wnN-ie ^udw dIdm ]55]3]
lines.transliteration_english: valae, ba-khaanaa-e dhila, khaanaa-e khudhaa dheedham | 55 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I have always found the abode of Akaalpurakh within my heart. (55) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: gdweI krdin kUie qU ibh iz sulqwnIsq
lines.transliteration_english: gadhaaee karadhan kooe thoo bih z sulathaaneesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: (The elation of) Begging in Your street, O Guru, is far better than any kingdom,

lines.gurmukhi: i^lw&iq do jhwx qrik mudAw dIdm ]55]4]
lines.transliteration_english: khilaafath dho jehaan tharak mudhaaa dheedham | 55 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The enjoyment I got after I gave up my vanity and self-pride, was that of being the chief of two worlds. (55) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: mrw iz rUiz Azl Awmd eIx indw goXw
lines.transliteration_english: maraa z rooz azal aamadh een nidhaa goyaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I heard the monition in my ears the very first day,

lines.gurmukhi: ik ieMqhwie jhwx rw dr iebqdw dIdm ]55]5]
lines.transliteration_english: k einthehaae jehaan raa dhar eibathadhaa dheedham | 55 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That I have seen the end of the world in its beginning. (55) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: Az dosq ZYir dosq qm?nw nmI kunym
lines.transliteration_english: az dhosath ghair dhosath thamanaa namee kunaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goya says, I have no unfriendly expectations or desires from my friend and beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: mw drid sir ^ueyS mdwvw nmI kunym ]56]1]
lines.transliteration_english: maa dharadh sar khueaesh madhaavaa namee kunaem | 56 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I am not seeking any cure even for the anguish of my mind. (56) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: bImwr nrgsym ik nrgs Zulwim aU sq
lines.transliteration_english: beemaar naragasaem k naragas ghulaam oo satha

Shabad OS N.translation: I am sick because of the Narcissus friend who has complete control on Narcissus itself as a slave,

lines.gurmukhi: mw AwrzUie i^zro msIhw nmI kunym ]56]2]
lines.transliteration_english: maa aarazooe khizaro maseehaa namee kunaem | 56 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I do not hanker either for Khizar or Messiah who could play their part as healers of this illness. (56) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: hr jw ik dIdw eym jmwil qU dIdw eym
lines.transliteration_english: har jaa k dheedhaa eaem jamaal thoo dheedhaa eaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Wherever I see, I see only the splendor of Your beauty,

lines.gurmukhi: mw juz jmwil dUsq qmwSw nmI kunym ]56]3]
lines.transliteration_english: maa juz jamaal dhoosath thamaashaa namee kunaem | 56 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, I do not look for any other show except the glow of my Beloved. (56) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: bw Xwr hmdmym n bInym ZYr aU
lines.transliteration_english: baa yaar hamadhamaem n beenaem ghair oo

Shabad OS N.translation: When I  am in the company of my beloved, I do not look at anyone else,

lines.gurmukhi: mw cSim ^ud brUie ksy vw nmI kunym ]56]4]
lines.transliteration_english: maa chasham khudh barooe kasae vaa namee kunaem | 56 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, I do not even open my eyes in front of anyone else. (56) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: prvwnw-vwr iZrid rui^ SmAw jwx idhym
lines.transliteration_english: paravaanaa-vaar ghiradh rukh shamaaa jaan dhihaem

Shabad OS N.translation: I sacrifice my life like a moth while fluttering around the oil-lamp,

lines.gurmukhi: cU AMdlIb byhudw ZoZw nmI kunym ]56]5]
lines.transliteration_english: choo andhaleeb baehudhaa ghoghaa namee kunaem | 56 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But, I do not make any useless wails, screams and shrieks like a nightingale. (56) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: goXw ^moS bwS ik sOdwie ieSik Xwr
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa khamosh baash k saauadhaae eishak yaara

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says to himself, Just keep quiet, do not utter even a word! The deal of my love for my Beloved is with my head,

lines.gurmukhi: qwx eIx srsq Az sir-^ud vw nmI kunym ]56]6]
lines.transliteration_english: thaan een sarasath az sari-khudh vaa namee kunaem | 56 | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: As long as this head is there, this deal will not be annulled. (56) (6)

lines.gurmukhi: mw bw-Xwid h?k hmySw izMdw-eym
lines.transliteration_english: maa baa-yaadh hak hamaeshaa zindhaa-eaema

Shabad OS N.translation: ?I always spend my life's time in His remembrance; this life is meaningful only so long as we love the Truth,

lines.gurmukhi: dwiem Az iehswin aU SrmiMdw-eym ]57]1]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaeim az eihasaan oo sharamanidhaa-eaem | 57 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, I am chagrined but eternally grateful of the enormous obligations and kindnesses bestowed on me by my Master.? (57) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: ^ud-nmw rw bMdgI mnzUr nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: khudha-namaa raa bandhagee manazoor neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: A self centered egoist does not accept nor believe in meditation,

lines.gurmukhi: aU hmySwx swihbo mw bMdw-eym ]57]2]
lines.transliteration_english: oo hamaeshaan saahibo maa bandhaa-eaem | 57 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, Akaalpurakh is always the Master and we, the worldly earthlings, His slaves for ever. (57) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: dr vjUid ^wkIAwx pwkI Azosq
lines.transliteration_english: dhar vajoodh khaakeeaan paakee azosatha

Shabad OS N.translation: These earthen dolls, human beings, have been made sacred only because of Him, since His own image abides in all of them,

lines.gurmukhi: mw ^udwie pwk rw bIinMdw-eym ]57]3]
lines.transliteration_english: maa khudhaae paak raa beenindhaa-eaem | 57 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, I have perceived the All-Protective Lord, and remain imbued in His remembrance. (57) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: mw bpwie Swh sr A&gMdw-eym
lines.transliteration_english: maa bapaae shaah sar afagandhaa-eaema

Shabad OS N.translation: I have placed my head at the lotus feet of my great King Master,

lines.gurmukhi: Az do Awlm dsq rw A&Swxdw-eym ]57]4]
lines.transliteration_english: az dho aalam dhasath raa afashaanadhaa-eaem | 57 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, I have washed my hands off from both the worlds, this and the next. (57) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: nIsq dr hr cSm ZYr Az nUir aU
lines.transliteration_english: neesath dhar har chasham ghair az noor oo

Shabad OS N.translation: There is nothing else except his refulgence in everyone's eye,

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdwin h?k joieMdw-eym ]57]5]
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath maradhaan hak joeindhaa-eaem | 57 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is why, I have always sought the company of saintly persons. (57) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: mw cU z?rwie ^wik pwie aU Sudym
lines.transliteration_english: maa choo zaraae khaak paae oo shudhaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I have become a particle of the dust under His feet,

lines.gurmukhi: qw bdwmn dsiq ^ud A&gMdw eym ]57]6]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa badhaaman dhasath khudh afagandhaa eaem | 57 | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Since I have got hold of the strings of His robe surrendered myself and sought and got His shield. (57) (6)

lines.gurmukhi: kIsq goXw zwkir nwim ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: keesath goyaa zaakar naam khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa asks, Who is Goyaa?  meditator of the Naam of kaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: hmcU ^urSId jhwx r^SMdw eym ]57]7]
lines.transliteration_english: hamachoo khurasheedh jehaan rakhashandhaa eaem | 57 | 7 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is the reason that he is shining in this world like the sun. (57) (7)

lines.gurmukhi: mw bMdwie ieSkym ^udw rw nw-Snwsym
lines.transliteration_english: maa bandhaae eishakaem khudhaa raa naa-shanaasaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I am a man of love and devotion; I do not recognize God;

lines.gurmukhi: duSnwm n dwnym duAw rw nw-Snwsym ]58]1]
lines.transliteration_english: dhushanaam n dhaanaem dhuaa raa naa-shanaasaem  | 58 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I do not know blatant vulgar abuses and do not perceive blessings. (58) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: AwSu&qwie Awnym ik AwSu&qwie mw hsq
lines.transliteration_english: aashufathaae aanaem k aashufathaae maa hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I am madly in love with my Beloved who is also captivated by me,

lines.gurmukhi: mw Swh n dwnym E gdw rw nw-Snwsym ]58]2]
lines.transliteration_english: maa shaah n dhaanaem ou gadhaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I do not give any credence to a king nor do I recognize a beggar. (58) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM gYir qU ks nIsq bqihkIk drIxzw
lines.transliteration_english: choon gair thoo kas neesath bathehikeek dhareenazaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, The fact is that, in reality, after seeking and denouncing, there is no one else except You everywhere;

lines.gurmukhi: eIx q?&rkwie mw E Sumw rw nw-Snwsym ]58]3]
lines.transliteration_english: een thafarakaae maa ou shumaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore I do not recognize any barriers between you and me. (58) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: sr pw Sud pw sr Sudw dr rwih muh?bq
lines.transliteration_english: sar paa shudh paa sar shudhaa dhar raahi muhabatha

Shabad OS N.translation: In the self-annhilating path of love, one gets so enamored that the head becomes the feet and the feet the head in oneness;

lines.gurmukhi: goiem v lykn sro pw rw n-Snwsym ]58]4]
lines.transliteration_english: goeim v laekan saro paa raa na-shanaasaem | 58 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This cliche is often repeated; However, we do not distinguish the difference between the roles of head and feet. (58) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: mw nIz cU goXw iz Azl msq eIsqm
lines.transliteration_english: maa neez choo goyaa z azal masath eesathama

Shabad OS N.translation: Drunk with ecstacy, we too, like Goyaa, have been derelict since the beginning of time,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx kwiedwie zuhdo irAw rw nw-Snwsym ]58]5]
lines.transliteration_english: een kaaeidhaae zuhadho riaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: We have been completely oblivious to the modus operandi of meditation or fakery. (58) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: hr gwh nzr bjwinib idldwr mI kunym
lines.transliteration_english: har gaah nazar bajaanib dhiladhaar mee kunaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Whenever we open our eyes to look towards our Beloved Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: dirAwie hr do cSm guhr-bwr mI kunym ]59]1]
lines.transliteration_english: dhariaae har dho chasham guhara-baar mee kunaem | 59 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then the pearl-showering river-like eyes start streaming down with tears. (59) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: hr jw ik dIdweym rui^ Xwr dIdweym
lines.transliteration_english: har jaa k dheedhaaeaem rukh yaar dheedhaaeaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, Wherever I have looked, I see only the face of my Beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: mw kY nzr bjwinib AZXwr mI kunym ]59]2]
lines.transliteration_english: maa kai nazar bajaanib aghayaar mee kunaem | 59 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When did I ever have looked at a stranger, someone other than the Akaalpurakh Himself? (59) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: zwihd mrw iz dIdwin ^Ubwx mnAw mkun
lines.transliteration_english: zaahidh maraa z dheedhaan khoobaan manaaa makuna

Shabad OS N.translation: O meditating saint! Please do not forbid me from looking at beautiful objects;

lines.gurmukhi: mw ^ud nzr bsUie rui^ Xwr mI kunym ]59]3]
lines.transliteration_english: maa khudh nazar basooe rukh yaar mee kunaem | 59 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, I do not dare look at anyone else other than my true and loving Friend. (59) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: mw juz hdIis rUie qU kUqy nw ^urdweym
lines.transliteration_english: maa juz hadhees rooe thoo koothae naa khuradhaaeaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I have never taken any other food stimulent  except the discourse about Your lovely face,

lines.gurmukhi: dr rwih ieSk eIx hmw qkrwr mI kunym ]59]4]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar raahi eishak een hamaa thakaraar mee kunaem | 59 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: While treading the path of love and affection, this has been enough, and I have been persistently asserting this. (59) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: goXw iz cSim Xwr ik m^mUr gSqweym
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa z chasham yaar k makhamoor gashathaaeaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I am inebriated with the intoxicating looks of my Beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: kY ^whiS Srwib pur Asrwr mI kunym ]59]5]
lines.transliteration_english: kai khaahash sharaab pur asaraar mee kunaem | 59 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, why should I ever long for a sip of mysterious alcoholic drink? (59) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: nmI gujMd bcSmm ZYir Swih ^ud-psMid mn
lines.transliteration_english: namee gujandh bachashamam ghair shaahi khudha-pasandh mana

Shabad OS N.translation: Nothing permeates into my eyes except the king of my own choice;

lines.gurmukhi: bcSmm ^uS inSsq Awx kwmiq b^iq bulMid mn ]60]1]
lines.transliteration_english: bachashamam khush nishasath aan kaamath bakhath bulandh man | 60 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: His tall and well-built God-given stature has become comely to my eyes. (60) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: qmwmI murdwhw rw Az qb?sum izMdw mI swzd
lines.transliteration_english: thamaamee muradhaahaa raa az thabasum zindhaa mee saazadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, He, the Guru, revives dead bodies into life with his smile,

lines.gurmukhi: cU ryzd Awb hYvwx Az dhwin guMcw-^Mid-mn ]60]2]
lines.transliteration_english: choo raezadh aab haivaan az dhehaan gunchaa-khandhi-man | 60 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When he showers elixir-like expressions from his blossoming close-lipped bud-like mouth. (60) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: brwie dIdin qU dIdwAm Sud cSmwie kOSr
lines.transliteration_english: baraae dheedhan thoo dheedhaaam shudh chashamaae kaauashara

Shabad OS N.translation: My eyes have become a source of an eternal fountain longing to have your glimpse;

lines.gurmukhi: ibAw jwnwx ik kurbwin qU jwin drd-mMd mn ]60]3]
lines.transliteration_english: biaa jaanaan k kurabaan thoo jaan dharadha-mandh man | 60 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Come my Beloved! My pitiable suffering sad life is willing to sacrifice itself for you. (60) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: Agr bInI drUin mn bZYr Az ^ud kujw XwbI
lines.transliteration_english: agar beenee dharoon man baghair az khudh kujaa yaabee

Shabad OS N.translation: If you, my Guru, would ever care to look deep into my heart, you will not find anything other than you there;

lines.gurmukhi: ik ZYr Az izkir qUM nbUd drUin bMd bMid mn ]60]4]
lines.transliteration_english: k ghair az zikar thoon naboodh dharoon bandh bandh man | 60 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, there is not even a mention of anyone except you in each and every limb of my body and every drop of my blood. (60) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: mnm X?k muSiq igl goXw drUnm nUir E lwmA
lines.transliteration_english: manam yak mushath gil goyaa dharoonam noor ou laamaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Gayaa says, I am a just a fistful of dust, but my inner self is bright and satiated with the glow of eternal light of his rays,

lines.gurmukhi: bZridS dwiemw grdd idil pur hoSmMid mn ]60]5]
lines.transliteration_english: bagharadhish dhaaeimaa garadhadh dhil pur hoshamandh man | 60 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, my alert and sane mind always echoes that message. (60) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: byv&w nIsq ksy gr qU v&wdwr SvI
lines.transliteration_english: baevafaa neesath kasae gar thoo vafaadhaar shavee

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, If you become faithful, then no one would betray you,

lines.gurmukhi: vkq Awnsq ik br vkq ^brdwr SvI ]61]1]
lines.transliteration_english: vakath aanasath k bar vakath khabaradhaar shavee | 61 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The time has come that you should be alert of this truth on time. (61) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: jwx Agr hsq isir kdim jwnwx kun
lines.transliteration_english: jaan agar hasath sir kadham jaanaan kuna

Shabad OS N.translation: If you are alive, then offer your heart as a sacrifice for His lotus feet,

lines.gurmukhi: idl b-idldwr ibidh zwik qU idldwr SvI ]61]2]
lines.transliteration_english: dhil ba-dhiladhaar bidhih zaak thoo dhiladhaar shavee | 61 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Present your heart and mind to your Beloved, so that you, yourself, would become a beloved. (61) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: mMizil ieSk drwz Asq b-pw nqvwx r&q
lines.transliteration_english: manzil eishak dharaaz asath ba-paa nathavaan rafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The journey of love and devotion is extremely long and arduous; it cannot be traversed by walking on foot,

lines.gurmukhi: sr kdm swz ik qw dr rih Awx Xwr SvI ]61]3]
lines.transliteration_english: sar kadham saaz k thaa dhar rehi aan yaar shavee | 61 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: We should walk making our head as our feet, so that we can travel on the path towards our Beloved and the trek can be completed. (61) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: gu&qgUie hmw ks dr ^oir iedrwik ^ud Asq
lines.transliteration_english: gufathagooe hamaa kas dhar khor eidharaak khudh asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The conversation of each one of us is based upon our perception and knowledge,

lines.gurmukhi: lB &robMd ik qw mihrim Asrwr SvI ]61]4]
lines.transliteration_english: labh farobandh k thaa mehiram asaraar shavee | 61 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But you should keep your lips sealed so that you can realize and appreciate the truth about His mysteries. (61) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: mI &roSd idil dIvwnwie ^ud rw goXw
lines.transliteration_english: mee faroshadh dhil dheevaanaae khudh raa goyaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I am presenting my infatuated mind for sale on the hope that

lines.gurmukhi: b-aumIid krim Awx ik ^rIdwr SvI ]61]5]
lines.transliteration_english: ba-oumeedh karam aan k khareedhaar shavee | 61 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You, the Guru, with your benevolence, might become its purchaser. (61) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: swkI mrw qo ju?rw-ie jW iesiqAwk dyh
lines.transliteration_english: saakee maraa tho juraa-e jaa(n) eisathiaak dhaeha

Shabad OS N.translation: O bartender! Kindly put my beloved in the cup of life; the urge to survive,

lines.gurmukhi: qw rUey qy bInm, dUrI &rwk dyh ]62]1]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa rooeae thae beenama, dhooree faraak dhaeh | 62 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that I may live to see my beloved's face when I am free from separation.  (62) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: dr hr qr& bInm, cUM rui^ qurw mudwm
lines.transliteration_english: dhar har tharaf beenama, choon rukh thuraa mudhaama

Shabad OS N.translation: I look for your glimpse in every direction, but in vain

lines.gurmukhi: bw idl mrw ^lwsI, Az A&qrwk dyh ]62]2]
lines.transliteration_english: baa dhil maraa khalaasee, az afatharaak dhaeh | 62 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: O heart! Kindly release me from life so that I can surrender before separation sets in. (62) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM by qo hyc nysq cUM bInym b-hr kujwsq
lines.transliteration_english: choon bae tho haech naesath choon beenaem ba-har kujaasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Everything is futile and every place is void without you, this is so everywhere,

lines.gurmukhi: qw dIdh E idil mrw, qo ieMq&wk dyh ]62]3]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa dheedheh ou dhil maraa, tho einthafaak dhaeh | 62 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Grant me the unity for my worldly heart and eyes that I can see you. (62) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM sw& gSq AweInw-ie idl Az svwid Zm
lines.transliteration_english: choon saaf gashath aaeenaa-e dhil az savaadh ghama

Shabad OS N.translation: Scrape off the dross of sorrow from the mirror of my heart,

lines.gurmukhi: bw vsl ^ud-nmweI, irhweI iz bWk dyh ]62]4]
lines.transliteration_english: baa vasal khudha-namaaee, rihaaee z baa(n)k dhaeh | 62 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that I see only your reflection in it and with it, the terror of separation is ended (62) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: goieAw b-hr kujw ik b-bInm jmwil qo
lines.transliteration_english: goeiaa ba-har kujaa k ba-beenam jamaal tho

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I should be able to see only you and your splendid colors,

lines.gurmukhi: qw idil mrw ^lwsIey, Az drdnwk dyh ]62]5]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa dhil maraa khalaaseeeae, az dharadhanaak dhaeh | 62 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I seek release from tis bondage and the pain of separation. (62 ) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: byv&w nysq ksy, gr qU v&wdwr SvI
lines.transliteration_english: baevafaa naesath kasae, gar thoo vafaadhaar shavee

Shabad OS N.translation: If you believe in yourself, then no one shall be a non-believer or faithless,

lines.gurmukhi: vkq AWsU ik: br vkq, ^brdwr SvI ]63]1]
lines.transliteration_english: vakath aaa(n)soo ki: bar vakatha, khabaradhaar shavee | 63 | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Times are such that they will demand alertness every moment. (63) (1)

lines.gurmukhi: zW Agr hsq, nswir kdim jwnW kun
lines.transliteration_english: zaa(n) agar hasatha, nasaar kadham jaanaa(n) kuna

Shabad OS N.translation: If you have life in you, you should sacrifice it at the feet of the beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: idl b-idldwr bidh, zW ik: idldwr SvI ]63]2]
lines.transliteration_english: dhil ba-dhiladhaar badhiha, zaa(n) ki: dhiladhaar shavee | 63 | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: O heart! You should offer yourself uninhibitingly to your beloved so that you would also be loved. (63) (2)

lines.gurmukhi: mMzil ieSk drwz Asq bw-pw n-qqvW r&q
lines.transliteration_english: manzal eishak dharaaz asath baa-paa na-thathavaa(n) rafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Destination of love is too far and long; it cannot be reached using the feet,

lines.gurmukhi: sr kdm swz, ik: qw dr rwih AW Xwr SvI ]63]3]
lines.transliteration_english: sar kadham saaza, ki: thaa dhar raahi aaa(n) yaar shavee | 63 | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Sacrifice your head, make it your feet before you embark on the road to your beloved. (63) (3)

lines.gurmukhi: gu&qgUey hmw ks dr iedrwik ^ud Asq
lines.transliteration_english: gufathagooeae hamaa kas dhar eidharaak khudh asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Everyone indulges into conversation according to his wits,

lines.gurmukhi: lb i&robMd ik: qw mhrim iesrwr SvI ]63]4]
lines.transliteration_english: lab firobandh ki: thaa meharam eisaraar shavee | 63 | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, you should keep your lips tightly closed if you are anxious to share the secrets of the beloved. (63) (4)

lines.gurmukhi: my &roSd idil dIvwnw-ie ^ud rw, goieAw
lines.transliteration_english: mae faroshadh dhil dheevaanaa-e khudh raa, goeiaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I want to sell myself and my insane heart to my beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: bw aumIid krim AW, ik: ^rIdwr SvI ]63]5]
lines.transliteration_english: baa oumeedh karam aaa(n), ki: khareedhaar shavee | 63 | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With my faith in his grace and mercy, I am sure he will find it worthy of buying. (63) (5)

lines.gurmukhi: rubweIAwx
lines.transliteration_english: rubaaeeaana

Shabad OS N.translation: 4-Line Verses

lines.gurmukhi: hr ks iz SOik qU kdm Az sr sw^q
lines.transliteration_english: har kas z shaauak thoo kadham az sar saakhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Everyone, with his zeal for you, started to walk on his head,

lines.gurmukhi: br nhu qbk cri^ Alm sr A&rw^q
lines.transliteration_english: bar nahu thabak charakh alam sar afaraakhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: And, he was able to pitch his flag over the nine skies,

lines.gurmukhi: Sud AwmdnS mubwirk r&qn hm
lines.transliteration_english: shudh aamadhanash mubaarik rafathan hama

Shabad OS N.translation: Blessed is his coming to this world, and equally blessed is his departure,

lines.gurmukhi: goXw Awx ks ik rwih h?k rw ibSnw^q ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa aan kas k raahi hak raa bishanaakhath | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, The one who has perceived the Lord. (1)

lines.gurmukhi: kUr Asq hr Awx dIdw ik h?k rw nBSnw^q
lines.transliteration_english: koor asath har aan dheedhaa k hak raa nabhashanaakhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Every such eye that did not recognize (the existence) of Akaalpurakh, can be considered as blind,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx aumir igrwx mwXw b-Z&lq drbw^q
lines.transliteration_english: een oumar giraan maayaa ba-ghafalath dharabaakhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: He wasted this precious life in negligence and carelessness,

lines.gurmukhi: aU igrIAwx kunwx Awmd b-hsrq murd
lines.transliteration_english: oo gireeaan kunaan aamadh ba-hasarath muradha

Shabad OS N.translation: He came (to this world) crying and passed away taking all his yearnings and unfulfilled hopes with him,

lines.transliteration_english: afasos dhareen aamadh shudh kaarae nabhasaakhath | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Alas! He was unable to better his disposition in this cycle of birth and death. (2)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx cSim qU ^wnw dwir jwnwnsq
lines.transliteration_english: een chasham thoo khaanaa dhaar jaanaanasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This eye of yours is the abode of the Beloved virtuous friend,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx q^iq vjUid msnid sulqwnsq
lines.transliteration_english: een thakhath vajoodh masanadh sulathaanasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Your personality is the seat of His royal throne,

lines.gurmukhi: hr bUAlhvsy bsUie aU rwh n burd
lines.transliteration_english: har booalehavasae basooe oo raah n buradha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone immersed in greed and lust cannot reach the powerful Almighty,

lines.transliteration_english: k een raah thaalak manzal maradhaanasath | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because this path is meant for the brave and the valiant devotees of Waaheguru. (3)

lines.transliteration_english: har dhil k baraahi raasath jaanaan shudhaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Every such heart and mind that spontaneously (by acquiring the virtues of) became the divine Beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: qihkIk ibdwx ik AYin jwnwx Sudw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: thehikeek bidhaan k ain jaanaan shudhaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Rest assured! That he became the embodiment of Akaalpurakh Himself,

lines.gurmukhi: X?k z?rw iz &Yiz rihmqS ^wlI nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: yak zaraa z faiz rehimathash khaalee neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Not even a particle of dust is then without his benevolence and blessing,

lines.gurmukhi: n?kws drUin nkS ipnhwx Sudw Asq ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: nakaas dharoon nakash pinehaan shudhaa asath | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the Sculptor-Painter is camouflaging Himself behind His colors. (4)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx Awmdo r&q juz dmy byS nbUd
lines.transliteration_english: een aamadho rafath juz dhamae baesh naboodh

Shabad OS N.translation: This coming and departing in this world is no more than a moment,

lines.gurmukhi: hr jw ik nzr kunym juz ^yS nbUd
lines.transliteration_english: har jaa k nazar kunaem juz khaesh naboodha

Shabad OS N.translation: Wherever we run our vision and see around, we see only our own images,

lines.transliteration_english: maan jaanib ghair choon anigaah bikunaema

Shabad OS N.translation: How can we ever dare to look towards anyone else?

lines.gurmukhi: cUM ZYr qU hIc ksy pso pyS nbUd ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: choon ghair thoo heech kasae paso paesh naboodh | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, there is no one else (except Waaheguru) in the front or rear who is supporting us. (5)

lines.gurmukhi: hr bMdw kU qwilib mOlw bwSd
lines.transliteration_english: har bandhaa koo thaalib maaualaa baashadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Every such person who is a seeker of the Divinity,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hr do jhwx ruqbw-AMS aUlw bwSd
lines.transliteration_english: dhar har dho jehaan ruthabaa-ansh oolaa baashadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Has a highest rank and status in both the worlds;

lines.gurmukhi: goXw do jhwx rw b-jOey ib-sqwnMd
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa dho jehaan raa ba-jaaueae bi-sathaanandha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, They can acquire both the worlds in exchange for just a grain of barley,

lines.gurmukhi: mjnUMin qU kY AwSik lYlw bwSd ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: majanoonn thoo kai aashak lailaa baashadh | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When and how would I, Your beloved (like Majnoo was) become Your lover (like Lailaa)? (6)

lines.transliteration_english: dhar dhehir k maradhaan khudhaa aamadhaa andha

Shabad OS N.translation: When men of God manifest themselves in this world,

lines.transliteration_english: bar ghuma-shudhagaan rehinumaa aamadhaa andha

Shabad OS N.translation: They come as leaders to put the strayed people on to the right path;

lines.gurmukhi: goXw Agr eIN cSim qU muSqwik ^udw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa agar ee chasham thoo mushathaak khudhaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, If your eye is desirous of the Almighty,

lines.transliteration_english: maradhaan khudhaa khudhaa-numaa aamadhaa andh | 7 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then realize that the noble souls of God come to this earth only to reveal Him. (7)

lines.gurmukhi: dr mzhib mw ZYr-prsqI n kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: dhar mazehab maa ghaira-parasathee n kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: People of our faith do not worship anyone else (other than Akaalpurakh),

lines.gurmukhi: sr qw bkdm bhoS E msqI n kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: sar thaa bakadham behosh ou masathee n kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They are always mindful and alert and never act or behave wantonly,

lines.gurmukhi: Zw&il nSvMd Xk dm Az Xwid ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: ghaafal nashavandh yak dham az yaadh khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: They are not negligent of the remembrance of Waaheguru even for one moment/breath,

lines.gurmukhi: dIgr su^n Az bulMdo psqI n kunMd ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: dheegar sukhan az bulandho pasathee n kunandh | 8 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Additionally, they do not get involved in topics relating to higher or lower classes of the society. (8)

lines.gurmukhi: X?k z?rw Agr SOik ielwhI bwSd
lines.transliteration_english: yak zaraa agar shaauak eilaahee baashadha

Shabad OS N.translation: If one has even the slightest inkling of fondness for the Lord,

lines.gurmukhi: ibhqr ik hzwr bwdSwhI bwSd
lines.transliteration_english: bihathar k hazaar baadhashaahee baashadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, that is far superior to thousands of kingdoms,

lines.gurmukhi: goXw-sq Zulwim murSid ^yS
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa-sath ghulaam murashadh khaesha

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I am the slave of my true Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx ^q n muhqwij gvwhI bwSd ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: een khath n muhathaaj gavaahee baashadh | 9 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And this written assertion does not need any witnesses. (9)

lines.transliteration_english: har kas ba-jehaa nashavo numaa mee khaahadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Every human being in this world likes to progressively prosper and professionally advance,

lines.gurmukhi: Aspo Suqro &Ilo iqlw mI ^whd
lines.transliteration_english: asapo shutharo feelo thilaa mee khaahadha

Shabad OS N.translation: He/She has strong desire to acquire horses, camels, elephants and gold;

lines.transliteration_english: har kas z baraae khaesh cheezae mee khaahadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Every one always longs to have something or the other for himself;

lines.gurmukhi: goXw iz ^udw Xwid ^udw mI ^whd ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa z khudhaa yaadh khudhaa mee khaahadh | 10 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, Goyaa says, I always supplicate to the Lord to bless me only with His remembrance. (10)

lines.gurmukhi: pur gSqw iz sr qw b-kdm nUr-aul-nUr
lines.transliteration_english: pur gashathaa z sar thaa ba-kadham noora-oula-noora

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says that His Guru is satiated with radiance and splendor from head to feet;

lines.gurmukhi: AweInw ik dr vYn bvd hIc ksUr
lines.transliteration_english: aaeenaa k dhar vain bavadh heech kasoora

Shabad OS N.translation: He is a mirror that has no cracks;

lines.gurmukhi: qihkIk ibdwx iz Zwi&lwx dUr bvd
lines.transliteration_english: thehikeek bidhaan z ghaafilaan dhoor bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Rest assured: That he shuns away from the careless and the negligent;

lines.gurmukhi: aU dr idil Awir& krdw zhUr ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: oo dhar dhil aarif karadhaa zehoor | 11 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And he manifests only in the hearts of holy and pious persons. (11)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx aumir igrwx-mwXw ik brbwd Svd
lines.transliteration_english: een oumar giraana-maayaa k barabaadh shavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: This priceless life that is wasted for nothing,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx ^wnwie vIrwx b-ich Awbwd Svd
lines.transliteration_english: een khaanaae veeraan ba-chih aabaadh shavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: And how can this desolate home be rehabilitated and settled?

lines.gurmukhi: qw murSid kwiml nidhd dsq bRhm
lines.transliteration_english: thaa murashadh kaamil nadhihadh dhasath brehama

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, (This can happen) Only when a complete Guru stands by your side and helps; And this may be the only way that

lines.gurmukhi: goXw idil ZmgIn qU cUM Swd bvd ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa dhil ghamageen thoo choon shaadh bavadh | 12 |

Shabad OS N.translation: My heart filled with worries and griefs can be elevated to elation? (12)

lines.gurmukhi: idil zwlim b-ksid kuSqin mw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: dhil zaalam ba-kasadh kushathan maa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The fiendish has the intention to destroy us,

lines.gurmukhi: idil mzlUim mn bsUie ^udw sq
lines.transliteration_english: dhil mazaloom man basooe khudhaa satha

Shabad OS N.translation: On the other hand, my vulnerable mind is expecting help and relief  from the Almighty;

lines.gurmukhi: aU drIx i&kr qwx bmw ich kund
lines.transliteration_english: oo dhareen fikar thaan bamaa chih kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The brute is concerned as to what should He do with him?

lines.gurmukhi: mw drIx i&kr qw ^udw ich kund ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: maa dhareen fikar thaa khudhaa chih kunadh | 13 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, we are concerned as to how does the Almighty respond to our plea? (13)

lines.gurmukhi: dr hwisil aumr Awx ich mw Xw&qw eym
lines.transliteration_english: dhar haasil oumar aan chih maa yaafathaa eaema

Shabad OS N.translation: What did we gain from this priceless life?

lines.gurmukhi: dr hr do-jhwx Xwid ^udw Xw&qw eym
lines.transliteration_english: dhar har dho-jehaan yaadh khudhaa yaafathaa eaema

Shabad OS N.translation: We were able to achieve the remembrance of the Omnipotent in both the worlds;

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hsqIey ^ySqn blw bUd AzIm
lines.transliteration_english: een hasatheeeae khaeshathan balaa boodh azeema

Shabad OS N.translation: This personality of ours was a huge monster,

lines.gurmukhi: Az ^yS guzSqym ^udw Xw&qw eym ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: az khaesh guzashathaem khudhaa yaafathaa eaem | 14 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When we gave up our ego and vanity, we attained the Ultimate, the Lord. (14)

lines.gurmukhi: Az ^wik dir qU qUqIAw Xw&qweym
lines.transliteration_english: az khaak dhar thoo thootheeaa yaafathaaeaema

Shabad OS N.translation: We obtained collyrium from the dust of Your door;

lines.gurmukhi: kz dOliq Awx nSvo numw Xw&qweym
lines.transliteration_english: kaz dhaaualath aan nashavo numaa yaafathaaeaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Because of which we gained the prosperity and progress;

lines.gurmukhi: mw isjdw br rUie ZYr dIgr nBkunym
lines.transliteration_english: maa sijadhaa bar rooe ghair dheegar nabhakunaema

Shabad OS N.translation: We have never bowed before anyone other than You,

lines.gurmukhi: dr ^wnwie idl nkiS ^udw Xw&qweym ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar khaanaae dhil nakash khudhaa yaafathaaeaem | 15 |

Shabad OS N.translation: We have discovered the symptoms of the Omnipresent within the abode of our heart. (15)

lines.gurmukhi: goXw ^br Az Xwid ^udw Xw&qweym
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa khabar az yaadh khudhaa yaafathaaeaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I have been able to get the inkling about the kaalpurakh from His remembrance,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx jwim lbw-lb Az kujw Xw&qweym
lines.transliteration_english: een jaam labaa-lab az kujaa yaafathaaeaema

Shabad OS N.translation: Otherwise, how could I have obtained this full-to-the-brim cup of devotion and affection?

lines.gurmukhi: juz qwilib h?k nsIib hr ks n bvd
lines.transliteration_english: juz thaalib hak naseeb har kas n bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Except the seeker of Lord, no one else is destined to have

lines.gurmukhi: eIx dOliq nwXwb ik mw Xw&qweym ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: een dhaaualath naayaab k maa yaafathaaeaem | 16 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This valuable treasure that I have had the good fortunate to obtain. (16)

lines.gurmukhi: goXw qw kY drIx srwey mwdUAm
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa thaa kai dhareen saraaeae maadhooama

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, How long are you going to stay in this perishable world,

lines.gurmukhi: gwhy lwzm Svd v gwhy mlzUm
lines.transliteration_english: gaahae laazam shavadh v gaahae malazooma

Shabad OS N.translation: That sometimes becomes so essential and other times so assigned?

lines.gurmukhi: qw kY cU sgwx br ausq^wx jMg kunym
lines.transliteration_english: thaa kai choo sagaan bar ousathakhaan jang kunaema

Shabad OS N.translation: How long are we going to fight over bones like dogs ?

lines.gurmukhi: duinAw mwlUAm Aihil duinAw mwlUAm ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: dhuniaa maalooam ahil dhuniaa maalooam | 17 |

Shabad OS N.translation: We all know about this world and these worldly people, (how selfish and merciless they are). (17)

lines.gurmukhi: goXw Agr Awx jmwl dIdn dwrI
lines.transliteration_english: goyaa agar aan jamaal dheedhan dhaaree

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, If you desire to see the splendor and glory of Waaheguru?

lines.gurmukhi: Az ^ud hvs mYil rmIdn dwrI
lines.transliteration_english: az khudh havas mail rameedhan dhaaree

Shabad OS N.translation: If you are trying to shun away from the sin of your greed and lust and have the stomach for meidtation?

lines.gurmukhi: zIx dIdw mbIx ik hzwb sq qurw
lines.transliteration_english: zeen dheedhaa mabeen k hazaab sath thuraa

Shabad OS N.translation: Then you should not see with these overt and ostensible eyes, because they are the obstacle for you;

lines.gurmukhi: by-dIdw ibbIx hr Awx ich dIdn dwrI ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: bae-dheedhaa bibeen har aan chih dheedhan dhaaree | 18 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, you should try to introspect without your eyes whatever you want to see. (And you would be successful) (18)

lines.gurmukhi: mOjUd ^udwsq qU ikrw mI joeI
lines.transliteration_english: maauajoodh khudhaasath thoo kiraa mee joee

Shabad OS N.translation: Akaalpurakh is Omnipresent. Then whom are you searching for?

lines.gurmukhi: mksUd ^udwsq qU kujw mI poeI
lines.transliteration_english: makasoodh khudhaasath thoo kujaa mee poee

Shabad OS N.translation: A meeting with the Benevolent is the aim of our life; where are you straying?

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hr do jhwx inSwin dOliq qusq
lines.transliteration_english: een har dho jehaan nishaan dhaaualath thusatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Both these worlds are the symbols of your mastery and control;

lines.gurmukhi: XwAnI su^n Az zbwin h?k mI goeI ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: yaaanee sukhan az zabaan hak mee goee | 19 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is, you are speaking the word of God through your own tongue. (19)

lines.gurmukhi: mbr AY bwd ^wkm Az dir dUsq
lines.transliteration_english: mabar ai baadh khaakam az dhar dhoosatha

Shabad OS N.translation: O wind! Do not blow away my dust from the door of my Beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: duSmnm srznS kund ik hr jweIsq ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: dhushamanam sarazanash kunadh k har jaaeesath | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Otherwise, the adversary will slander (the claim) that He happens to be everywhere. (1)

lines.gurmukhi: nIsq ZYr Az Awx snm dr prdwie dYro hrm
lines.transliteration_english: neesath ghair az aan sanam dhar paradhaae dhairo harama

Shabad OS N.translation: There is no one else other than the Waaheguru inside Kaabaa or the temple;

lines.gurmukhi: kY bvd AwiqiS do rMg Az ie^qlwi& sMg hw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: kai bavadh aathish dho rang az eikhathalaaf sang haa | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: How can the fire assume two different colors due to differences in the basic structure and make-up of stones? (2)

lines.gurmukhi: Awsmwx isjdw kund pyiS zmIx ik br aU
lines.transliteration_english: aasamaan sijadhaa kunadh paesh zameen k bar oo

Shabad OS N.translation: The sky is bowing before the earth,

lines.gurmukhi: X?k do n&s Az pYey izkir ^udw ibnSInMd ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: yak dho nafas az paieae zikar khudhaa binasheenandh | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because of the fact, devotees of Akaalpurakh squat here for a moment or two in His meditation. (3)

lines.gurmukhi: bzyir swieAwie qUbw murwd hw XwbI
lines.transliteration_english: bazaer saaeiaae thoobaa muraadh haa yaabee

Shabad OS N.translation: Under the shade of Kalap tree, one can have all his wishes fulfilled,

lines.gurmukhi: bzyr swieAw mrdwin h?k ^udw XwbI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: bazaer saaeiaa maradhaan hak khudhaa yaabee | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, under the shade (protection) of men of God, the saintly persons, one can attain God Himself. (4)

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI nwmw
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee naamaa

Shabad OS N.translation: ZINDAGEE NAAMAA

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ^udwvMid zmIno Awsmwx
lines.transliteration_english: aan khudhaavandh zameeno aasamaana

Shabad OS N.translation: The Akaalpurakh is the Master of the earth and the skies,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI b^iS vjUid ienso jwx ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee bakhash vajoodh einaso jaan | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He is the one who bestows life to human beings and other living beings. (1)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wik rwhS qUqIXwie cSim mwsq
lines.transliteration_english: khaak raahash thootheeyaae chasham maasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The dust on the path of Waaheguru serves like a collyrium to our eyes.

lines.gurmukhi: AwbrU A&zwie hr Swho gdw sq ]2]
