lines.transliteration_english: aabaroo afazaae har shaaho gadhaa sath | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, He is the one who elevates the honor and esteem of every king and every saintly soul. (2)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ikh bwSd dwXmw dr Xwid aU
lines.transliteration_english: har kih baashadh dhaayamaa dhar yaadh oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who lives his life under a constant remembrance of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k hr dm bvd ierSwid aU ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak har dham bavadh eirashaadh oo | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Will always prompt and motivate others for the meditation of the Almighty. (3)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qU dr Xwid ^udw bwSI mudwm
lines.transliteration_english: gar thoo dhar yaadh khudhaa baashee mudhaam

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can constantly and always stay imbued in Akaalpurakh's meditation,

lines.gurmukhi: mI SvI AY jwin mn mrid qmwm ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: mee shavee ai jaan man maradh thamaam | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, O my heart and soul! You can become a complete and perfect person. (4)

lines.gurmukhi: AwPqwib hsq ipnhwx zyir Abr
lines.transliteration_english: aafathaab hasath pinehaan zaer abara

Shabad OS N.translation: He, the Akaalpurakh, like the sun, is hidden behind the clouds of the material world,

lines.gurmukhi: ibguzr Az Abro numw ruiK hmcU bdr ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: biguzar az abaro numaa rukh hamachoo badhar | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, Kindly come out of the clouds and show me Your full-moon-like face. (5)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx qnq Abrysq dr vY AwPqwb
lines.transliteration_english: een thanath abaraesath dhar vai aafathaaba

Shabad OS N.translation: This body of yours is like a cloud under which is hidden the Sun (God),

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k mIdwx hmIx bwSd svwb ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak meedhaan hameen baashadh savaab | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Remember to engage yourself in the divine devotion because this is the only purpose (fruit) of this life. (6)

lines.gurmukhi: hrik vwik& Sud Az Asrwir ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: harak vaakif shudh az asaraar khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever has become cognizant of the mysteries of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: hr n&s juz h?k n dwrd mudAw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: har nafas juz hak n dhaaradh mudhaaa | 7 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He has no other purpose except to remember Him every moment of his life. (7)

lines.gurmukhi: kh ich bwSd Xwid Awx Xzdwin pwk
lines.transliteration_english: keh chih baashadh yaadh aan yazadhaan paaka

Shabad OS N.translation: What is the truth?  It is the memory of the Almighty that is the stark truth;

lines.gurmukhi: kY ibdwnd kdir aU hr muSiq ^wk ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: kai bidhaanadh kadhar oo har mushath khaak | 8 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, how can a fistful of dirt or dust, the human body, appreciate His real value? (8)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq nykwx Agr bwSd nsIb
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath naekaan agar baashadh naseeba

Shabad OS N.translation: If you have the good fortune to have the company and association of the noble persons,

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId XwbI AY hbIb ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath jaaveedh yaabee ai habeeb | 9 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then my friend! You would have attained eternal wealth. (9)

lines.gurmukhi: dOlq AMdr i^dmiq mrdwin ausq
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath andhar khidhamath maradhaan ousatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This (God given) wealth is meant to be used in the service of  His creations, the people;

lines.gurmukhi: hir gdw E pwdSwh kurbwin ausq ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: har gadhaa ou paadhashaah kurabaan ousath | 10 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Every beggar and emperor is willing to sacrifice himself for it, the true wealth. (10)

lines.gurmukhi: ^Uie Swx gIr AY bRwdr ^Uie Swx
lines.transliteration_english: khooe shaan geer ai braadhar khooe shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: O brother! You should acquire the traits of those who constantly remember  the Beneficent;

lines.gurmukhi: dwXmw mI grd igrid kUie Swx ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaayamaa mee garadh giradh kooe shaan | 11 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, you should circle around the (street) locality they reside in again and again (so that you may get an opportunity to be blessed with their company.) (11)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ikh igrid kUie Swx grdId Xw&q
lines.transliteration_english: har kih giradh kooe shaan garadheedh yaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: If anyone keeps going around the streets of these noble souls,

lines.gurmukhi: dr do Awlm hm cU imhro bdr qw&q ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar dho aalam ham choo miharo badhar thaafath | 12 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He would have attained the light and radiance of the sun and the moon in both the worlds. (12)

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId bwSd bMdgI
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath jaaveedh baashadh bandhagee

Shabad OS N.translation: (We must realize) that meditation is an eternal treasure;

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI kun bMdgI kun bMdgI ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee kun bandhagee kun bandhagee | 13 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, we should engage ourselves in meditation, worship and prayers before the Almighty. (13)

lines.gurmukhi: dr ilbwis bMdgI SwhI qurwhsq
lines.transliteration_english: dhar libaas bandhagee shaahee thuraahasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The entire kingdom (of the world) is encompassed in the remembrance of (the Naam of) Waaheguru;

lines.gurmukhi: dOlqy Az mwh qw mwhI qurwhsq ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualathae az maah thaa maahee thuraahasath | 14 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it is only His realm extending from the moon to the sun. (14)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ikh Zwi&l Sud AzU nwdwx bvd
lines.transliteration_english: har kih ghaafil shudh azoo naadhaan bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who is oblivious and unmindful of (the existence of) Akaalpurakh, consider him as an idiot;

lines.gurmukhi: gr gdw bwSd vgr sulqwx bvd ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: gar gadhaa baashadh vagar sulathaan bavadh | 15 |

Shabad OS N.translation: No matter whether he is a beggar or the emperor king. (15)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik mOlw Az hmw bwlw qr Asq
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak maaualaa az hamaa baalaa thar asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The love of God is the loftiest of all the traits for us,

lines.gurmukhi: swXwie aU br sir mw A&sr Asq ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: saayaae oo bar sar maa afasar asath | 16 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And His shadow (on our heads) is like a tiara on our heads. (16)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik mOlw mwAnIey izkir ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak maaualaa maaaneeeae zikar khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: Devotion for Akaalpurakh is considered as Aremembrance of Him,

lines.gurmukhi: kwx qilsim cSm mw rw kImIAw sq ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: kaan thalisam chasham maa raa keemeeaa sath | 17 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, his enchanting glance (towards us) is like a healing medicine for all of us. (17)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik mOlw izMdgIie jwin mw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak maaualaa zindhageee jaan maa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The love of Waaheguru is the life of our heart and soul,

lines.gurmukhi: izkir aU srmwXwie eImwin mw-sq ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: zikar oo saramaayaae eemaan maa-sath | 18 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, meditation and remembrance of His Naam are the principle assets of our faith and religion. (18)

lines.gurmukhi: rUiz jumAw momnwin pwkbwz
lines.transliteration_english: rooz jumaaa momanaan paakabaaza

Shabad OS N.translation: Chaste and pious minded Muslims

lines.gurmukhi: igrd mI AwieMd Az bihir inmwz ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: giradh mee aaeindh az behir nimaaz | 19 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Get together on Friday for their religious prayers. (19)

lines.gurmukhi: hmcunwx dr mzhib mw swD sMg
lines.transliteration_english: hamachunaan dhar mazehab maa saadh sanga

Shabad OS N.translation: In the same way, God's devotees in my religion come together in congregations of pious saints,

lines.gurmukhi: kz muh?bq bw-^udw dwrMd rMg ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz muhabath baa-khudhaa dhaarandh rang | 20 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And have pleasant time getting elated in their love for Akaalpurakh. (20)

lines.gurmukhi: igrd mI AwieMd dr mwhy do bwr
lines.transliteration_english: giradh mee aaeindh dhar maahae dho baara

Shabad OS N.translation: They assemble at least twice a month

lines.gurmukhi: bihir izkir ^wswie prvrdgwr ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: behir zikar khaasaae paravaradhagaar | 21 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In special remembrance of the Almighty. (21)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx hjUim ^uS ik Az bihir ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: aan hajoom khush k az behir khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: That assembly is blessed that is held only for remembering Akaalpurakh;

lines.gurmukhi: Awx hjUim ^uS ik Az d&wie blw-sq ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: aan hajoom khush k az dhafaae balaa-sath | 22 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That assembly is blessed that is held to dispel all our mental and physical  troubles. (22)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx hjUim ^uS ik Az bihir Xwid aU-sq
lines.transliteration_english: aan hajoom khush k az behir yaadh oo-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: That congregation is fortunate that is held in commemoration of Waaheguru's (Naam);

lines.gurmukhi: Awx hjUim ^uS ik h?k buinAwid aU-sq ]23]
lines.transliteration_english: aan hajoom khush k hak buniaadh oo-sath | 23 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That congregation is blessed that has its foundations only on Truth. (23)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx hjUim bd ik SYqwnI bvd
lines.transliteration_english: aan hajoom badh k shaithaanee bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: That group of persons is evil and dissolute where Satan/Devil is playing its role;

lines.gurmukhi: Awkbq Az vY pSymwnI bvd ]24]
lines.transliteration_english: aakabath az vai pashaemaanee bavadh | 24 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Such a group is defiled that lends itself to future repentance and pennitence. (24)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx jhwno Awx jhwx A&swnw eIsq
lines.transliteration_english: een jehaano aan jehaan afasaanaa eesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The story of both the worlds, this and the next, is a fable,

lines.gurmukhi: eIno Awx Az i^rmnS X?k dwnw eIsq ]25]
lines.transliteration_english: eeno aan az khiramanash yak dhaanaa eesath | 25 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, these two are just a grain out of Akaalpurakh's total heaps of produce. (25)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx jhwno Awx jhwx &urmwin h?k
lines.transliteration_english: een jehaano aan jehaan furamaan haka

Shabad OS N.translation: These two worlds are under the (constant) command of the true Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: AOlIAw E AbIAw kurbwin h?k ]26]
lines.transliteration_english: aaualeeaa ou abeeaa kurabaan hak | 26 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the divine messengers and prophets are willing to sacrifice themselves for Him. (26)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik dr Xwid ^udw kwiem bvd
lines.transliteration_english: har k dhar yaadh khudhaa kaaeim bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Any one who become firm practitioner of meditation of (Naam of) Akaalpurakh

lines.gurmukhi: qw ^udw kwiem bvd dwiem bvd ]27]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa khudhaa kaaeim bavadh dhaaeim bavadh | 27 |

Shabad OS N.translation: As long as the Entity exists, he, too, becomes immortal. (27)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx do Awlm z?rwie Az nUir aUsq
lines.transliteration_english: een dho aalam zaraae az noor oosatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Both these worlds are just a ray of the radiance and splendor of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: imhro mwh mSAl-kiS mzdUir aUsq ]28]
lines.transliteration_english: miharo maah mashaala-kash mazadhoor oosath | 28 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The moon and the sun, both serve Him as His torch-bearers. (28)

lines.gurmukhi: hwisil duinAw hmIx drid-sr Asq
lines.transliteration_english: haasil dhuniaa hameen dharadhi-sar asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The achievements in this world are nothing but a constant and severe headache,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik gwi&l Sud iz h?k gwE ^r Asq ]29]
lines.transliteration_english: har k gaafil shudh z hak gaaou khar asath | 29 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who becomes oblivious of the Trinity is either a bull or a donkey. (29)

lines.gurmukhi: Z&lq Az vY X?k zmwx sd mrg dwx
lines.transliteration_english: ghafalath az vai yak zamaan sadh marag dhaana

Shabad OS N.translation: To be careless, negligent, sluggish and apathetic of the memory of Akaalpurakh even for a moment is equivalent to hundreds of deaths.

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI Xwd Asq inzid Awir&wx ]30]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee yaadh asath nizadh aarifaan | 30 |

Shabad OS N.translation: For those enlightened and knowledgeable ones of Waaheguru, His meditation and remembrance is indeed the real life. (30)

lines.gurmukhi: hr dmy ku ibguzrd dr Xwid aU
lines.transliteration_english: har dhamae k biguzaradh dhar yaadh oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Every moment that is spent in remembering Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: bw ^udw kwiem bvd buinXwid aU ]31]
lines.transliteration_english: baa khudhaa kaaeim bavadh buniyaadh oo | 31 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Builds permanent foundations with Him. (31)

lines.gurmukhi: hr sry kU isjdwie subhw nw krd
lines.transliteration_english: har sarae koo sijadhaae subehaa naa karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever prostrates before Waaheguru every morning

lines.gurmukhi: h?k mr aU rw swihib eImwn krd ]32]
lines.transliteration_english: hak mar oo raa saahib eemaan karadh | 32 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Waaheguru makes him firm (believer) in contentment and faith. (32)

lines.gurmukhi: sr brwie isjdw pYdw krdw AMd
lines.transliteration_english: sar baraae sijadhaa paidhaa karadhaa andha

Shabad OS N.translation: The 'head' was created only to bow before the Almighty;

lines.gurmukhi: drid hr sr rw mdwvw krdw AMd ]33]
lines.transliteration_english: dharadh har sar raa madhaavaa karadhaa andh | 33 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And this is the cure for all headaches in (of) this world. (33)

lines.gurmukhi: ps qurw bwied kunI hrdm sjUd
lines.transliteration_english: pas thuraa baaeidh kunee haradham sajoodha

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, we should always keep bowing our heads before the Beneficent;

lines.gurmukhi: Awir& Az vY X?k zmwx Zwi&l n bUd ]34]
lines.transliteration_english: aarif az vai yak zamaan ghaafil n boodh | 34 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, someone cognizant of Akaalpurakh will not be derelict even for a moment in remembering Him. (34)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik Zwi&l Sud icrw Awikl bvd
lines.transliteration_english: har k ghaafil shudh chiraa aakil bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: How can anyone who has been oblivious in remembering Him be called wise and sane?

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik Zwi&l gSq aU zwihl bvd ]35]
lines.transliteration_english: har k ghaafil gashath oo zaahil bavadh | 35 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who has been negligent of Him should be considered an idiot and uncouth. (35)

lines.gurmukhi: mrid Awir& &wirZ Az cuno icrw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: maradh aarif faarigh az chuno chiraa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: A knowledgeable and enlightened person does not get bogged down in verbal rhetorics,

lines.gurmukhi: hwisil aumrS hmIx Xwid ^udw-sq ]36]
lines.transliteration_english: haasil oumarash hameen yaadh khudhaa-sath | 36 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The achievement of his whole life is just the memory of Akaalpurakh. (36)

lines.gurmukhi: swihib eImwx hmwx bwSd hmwx
lines.transliteration_english: saahib eemaan hamaan baashadh hamaana

Shabad OS N.translation: The only person who is honest and religious-minded is the one

lines.gurmukhi: kU n bwSd Zwi&l Az vY X?k zmwx ]37]
lines.transliteration_english: koo n baashadh ghaafil az vai yak zamaan | 37 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who does not become derelict even for one moment in memorializing the Omnipotent. (37)

lines.gurmukhi: ku&r bwSd Az ^udw Zwi&l Sudn
lines.transliteration_english: kufar baashadh az khudhaa ghaafil shudhana

Shabad OS N.translation: To be non-cognizant about Akaalpurakh and getting allured and enamored by the

lines.gurmukhi: br ilbwis dunXvI mwiel Sudn ]38]
lines.transliteration_english: bar libaas dhunayavee maaeil shudhan | 38 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Worldly guises is nothing short of blasphemy and paganism. (38)

lines.gurmukhi: cIsq duinAw E ilbwis dunXvI
lines.transliteration_english: cheesath dhuniaa ou libaas dhunayavee

Shabad OS N.translation: O Maulavee! You should please tell us! How do the worldly lusts and

lines.gurmukhi: Az ^udw Zwi&l Sudn AY mOlvI ]39]
lines.transliteration_english: az khudhaa ghaafil shudhan ai maaualavee | 39 |

Shabad OS N.translation: pleasures matter if we become negligent of the memory of Waaheguru? (In fact, without Akaalpurakh, they have no value at all and are worthless) (39)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx ilbwis dunXvI &wnI bvd
lines.transliteration_english: een libaas dhunayavee faanee bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The life of lust and pleasures is inevitably perishable;

lines.gurmukhi: br ^udw vMdIS ArzwnI bvd ]40]
lines.transliteration_english: bar khudhaa vandheesh arazaanee bavadh | 40 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, a person with deep devotion and mastery of the Omnipresent is always alive. (40)

lines.gurmukhi: dIno duinAw bMdwie &rmwin aU
lines.transliteration_english: dheeno dhuniaa bandhaae faramaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Saintly and worldly people are all His own creations,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx Azwx SrimMdwie iehswin aU ]41]
lines.transliteration_english: een azaan sharamindhaae eihasaan oo | 41 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, all of them are obligated under His countless favors. (41)

lines.gurmukhi: cIsq AYhswin suhbiq mrdwin h?k
lines.transliteration_english: cheesath aihasaan suhabath maradhaan haka

Shabad OS N.translation: How great is the debt that we all owe to those devotees of Akaalpurakh

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ik mI^wnMd Az ieSkS sbk ]42]
lines.transliteration_english: aan k meekhaanandh az eishakash sabak | 42 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who continue to educate themselves and receive instructions about the true love for Him. (42)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU srmwXwie eImwx bvd
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo saramaayaae eemaan bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Remembrance of Akaalpurakh is the repository of contentment and faith;

lines.gurmukhi: hr gdw Az Xwid aU sulqwx bvd ]43]
lines.transliteration_english: har gadhaa az yaadh oo sulathaan bavadh | 43 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And even a beggar who practices to meditate on Him feels elated like a king would with his pomp and powers. (43)

lines.gurmukhi: rUzo Sb dr bMdgI bwSMd Swd
lines.transliteration_english: roozo shab dhar bandhagee baashandh shaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: They, the noble souls, are always euphoric while in His meditation day and night,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI E bMdgI E Xwdo Xwd ]44]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee ou bandhagee ou yaadho yaadh | 44 |

Shabad OS N.translation: For them, His meditation is real meditation and his remembrance a real remembrance. (44)

lines.gurmukhi: cIsq sulqwnI vw drvySI ibdwx
lines.transliteration_english: cheesath sulathaanee vaa dharavaeshee bidhaana

Shabad OS N.translation: What is kingship and mendicancy? Understand that

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid Awx jwx AwPrIin ienso jwx ]45]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh aan jaan aafareen einaso jaan | 45 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is the memory of the Creator of the human beings and souls. (45)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU gr mUnis jwnq bvd
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo gar moonas jaanath bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: If God's remembrance becomes a close friend of your life,

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm zyir &rmwnq bvd ]46]
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam zaer faramaanath bavadh | 46 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, both the worlds would fall under your command. (46)

lines.gurmukhi: bs bzurgI hsq AMdr Xwid aU
lines.transliteration_english: bas bazuragee hasath andhar yaadh oo

Shabad OS N.translation: There is a great adulation and praise in remembering Him

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU kun Xwid aU kun Xwid aU ]47]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo kun yaadh oo kun yaadh oo | 47 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, we should meditate on His Naam; in fact, we should only remember Him. (47)

lines.gurmukhi: gr bzurgI bwiedq kun bMdgI
lines.transliteration_english: gar bazuragee baaeidhath kun bandhagee

Shabad OS N.translation: If you are seeking compliments and praise, then get involved in meditation;

lines.gurmukhi: vrnw Awi^r mI-kSI SrimMdgI ]48]
lines.transliteration_english: varanaa aakhir mee-kashee sharamindhagee | 48 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Otherwise, you will, ultimately, be chagrined and humiliated. (48)

lines.gurmukhi: Srm kun hwx Srm kun hwx Srm kun
lines.transliteration_english: sharam kun haan sharam kun haan sharam kuna

Shabad OS N.translation: Be ashamed, should be somewhat abashed, you should be ashamed,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx idil cUM sMig ^ud rw nrm kun ]49]
lines.transliteration_english: een dhil choon sang khudh raa naram kun | 49 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You should make your stone-hearted hard heart a little more malleable. (49)

lines.gurmukhi: mwAnIey nrmI ZrIbI Awmdw
lines.transliteration_english: maaaneeeae naramee ghareebee aamadhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Malleability implies humility,

lines.gurmukhi: drid hr ks kw qbIbI Awmdw ]50]
lines.transliteration_english: dharadh har kas kaa thabeebee aamadhaa | 50 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And humility is the cure for everyone's  maladies. (50)

lines.gurmukhi: h?k pRsqwx ^ud-pRsqI cUM kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: hak prasathaan khudha-prasathee choon kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: How can the connoisseurs of truth get involved in self-ego?

lines.gurmukhi: sr-bulMdwx moil pRsqI cUM kunMd ]51]
lines.transliteration_english: sara-bulandhaan mol prasathee choon kunandh | 51 |

Shabad OS N.translation: How can the lofty-headed have any craving or cupidity for those lying in lower valleys (slopes)? (51)

lines.gurmukhi: ^ud-pRsqI kqrwie nwpwik qU
lines.transliteration_english: khudha-prasathee katharaae naapaak thoo

Shabad OS N.translation: This vanity is a dirty and soiled drop;

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ik jw krdw b-muSiq ^wik qU ]52]
lines.transliteration_english: aan k jaa karadhaa ba-mushath khaak thoo | 52 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That has made an abode for itself in your body of fist-full dirt. (52)

lines.gurmukhi: ^ud-pRsqI ^wswie nwdwin qU
lines.transliteration_english: khudha-prasathee khaasaae naadhaan thoo

Shabad OS N.translation: This self-ego is the trait and characteristic of your stupidity;

lines.gurmukhi: h?k pRsqI mwieAwie eImwin qU ]53]
lines.transliteration_english: hak prasathee maaeiaae eemaan thoo | 53 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, worship of truth is the asset of your faith and belief. (53)

lines.gurmukhi: ijsim qU Az bwdo ^wko AwiqS Asq
lines.transliteration_english: jisam thoo az baadho khaako aathish asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Your body is composed of wind, dust and fire;

lines.gurmukhi: kqrwie AwbI nUir zwiqS Asq ]54]
lines.transliteration_english: katharaae aabee noor zaathish asath | 54 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You are just a drop of water, and the radiance (life) in you is the bestowal of Akaalpurakh. (54)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wnwAq Az nUir h?k rOSn Sudw
lines.transliteration_english: khaanaaath az noor hak raauashan shudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Your abode-like mind has been radiant with the Divine splendor,

lines.gurmukhi: X?k guly budI knUM gulSn Sudw ]55]
lines.transliteration_english: yak gulae budhee kanoon gulashan shudhaa | 55 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You were just a flower (not long ago), now you are a full fledged garden embellished with scores and scores of flowers. (55)

lines.gurmukhi: ps drUin gulSin ^ud sYr kun
lines.transliteration_english: pas dharoon gulashan khudh sair kuna

Shabad OS N.translation: You should (enjoy) taking a walk inside this garden;

lines.gurmukhi: hmcU muriZ mku?dis dr vY qYr kun ]56]
lines.transliteration_english: hamachoo muragh makudhas dhar vai thair kun | 56 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, soar around like a chaste and innocent bird in it. (56)

lines.gurmukhi: sd hzwrwx ^uld AMdr ZoSw AS
lines.transliteration_english: sadh hazaaraan khuladh andhar ghoshaa asha

Shabad OS N.translation: There are millions of heavenly gardens in His each and every nook and corner,

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm dwnwie Az ^oSw AS ]57]
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam dhaanaae az khoshaa ash | 57 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Both these worlds are like just a grain off the ear of His corn. (57)

lines.gurmukhi: kUiq Awx muriZ muk?ds Xwid aU
lines.transliteration_english: kooth aan muragh mukadhas yaadh oo

Shabad OS N.translation: The feed of that pious bird is Akaalpurkah's remembrance,

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU hwx Xwid aU hwx Xwid aU ]58]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo haan yaadh oo haan yaadh oo | 58 |

Shabad OS N.translation: His remembrance, only His meditation, yes only His memory. (58)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy kU mwieil ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae koo maaeil khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who is (sincerely) devoted to His meditation;

lines.gurmukhi: ^wik rwhS qUiqAwie cSim mw-sq ]59]
lines.transliteration_english: khaak raahash thoothiaae chasham maa-sath | 59 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The dust of his path is like a collyrium for our eyes. (59)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qurw Xwid ^udw hwisl Svd
lines.transliteration_english: gar thuraa yaadh khudhaa haasil shavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can get attuned to the meditation of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: h?il hr muSikl qurw, AY idl Svd ]60]
lines.transliteration_english: hal har mushakil thuraa, ai dhil shavadh | 60 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then O mind of mine! You should understand that all your difficulties have been solved (solutions to all the problems have been found). (60)

lines.gurmukhi: h?il hr muSikl hmIx Xwid ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: hal har mushakil hameen yaadh khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The only solution to every predicament is remembering Akaalpurakh;

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik Xwid h?k kund zwiq ^udw-sq ]61]
lines.transliteration_english: har k yaadh hak kunadh zaath khudhaa-sath | 61 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, a rememberer of (the Naam of) Waaheguru conforms himself into the same category as the Waaheguru Himself. (61)

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq ZYr h?k mnzUr nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath ghair hak manazoor neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: In reality, nothing but the Lord Himself is the acceptable Entity;

lines.gurmukhi: kIsq AY jwn kU srwpw nUr nIsq ]62]
lines.transliteration_english: keesath ai jaan koo saraapaa noor neesath | 62 |

Shabad OS N.translation: O my mind! Who is such a person that does not reflect the radiance of Akaalpurakh from head to toes? (62)

lines.gurmukhi: kqrwie nUrI srwpw nUr bwS
lines.transliteration_english: katharaae nooree saraapaa noor baasha

Shabad OS N.translation: O human being! You are one of the rays of the Divine glow, and become engulfed in divine radiance from head to toes,

lines.gurmukhi: ibguzr Az Zm dwiemw msrUr bwS ]63]
lines.transliteration_english: biguzar az gham dhaaeimaa masaroor baash | 63 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Get rid of any worries or suspicions, and get inebriated permanently in His memory. (63)

lines.gurmukhi: qw bkY dr bMid Zm bwSI mdwm
lines.transliteration_english: thaa bakai dhar bandh gham baashee madhaama

Shabad OS N.translation: How long would you be in the never-ending captivity of anxieties?

lines.gurmukhi: ibguzr Az Zm Xwid h?k kun v-slwm ]64]
lines.transliteration_english: biguzar az gham yaadh hak kun va-salaam | 64 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Get rid of sorrows and griefs; remember the Lord and stay safe and secure for ever. (64)

lines.gurmukhi: Zm ich bwSd ZPlq Az Xwid ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: gham chih baashadh ghafalath az yaadh khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: What is distress and depression? It is the negligence of His meditation;

lines.gurmukhi: cIsq SwdI Xwid Awx by-imnqhw ]65]
lines.transliteration_english: cheesath shaadhee yaadh aan bae-minathehaa | 65 |

Shabad OS N.translation: What is pleasure and joy? It is the remembrance of the Almighty of infinite dimensions. (65)

lines.gurmukhi: mwAnIie by-imMqhw dwnI ik cIsq
lines.transliteration_english: maaaneee bae-minthehaa dhaanee k cheesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Do you know the meaning of the Illimitable?

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ik aU nwied bkYid mrgo zIsq ]66]
lines.transliteration_english: aan k oo naaeidh bakaidh marago zeesath | 66 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is the Boundless, the Akaalpurakh, who is not subjected to births and deaths. (66)

lines.gurmukhi: dr sir hr mrdo zn sOdwie aU-sq
lines.transliteration_english: dhar sar har maradho zan saauadhaae oo-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: Every man and woman in his/her head is overwhelmed with His ardor;

lines.gurmukhi: dr do Awlm SorSy ZOZwie aU-sq ]67]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar dho aalam shorashae ghaauaghaae oo-sath | 67 |

Shabad OS N.translation: All this excitement in both the worlds is His creation. (67)

lines.gurmukhi: mMzil aU br zubwin AOlIAw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: manzal oo bar zubaan aaualeeaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: It is the tongue of the saints and noble souls where He has made His abode;

lines.gurmukhi: rUzy Sb kwxdr idlS Xwid ^udw-sq ]68]
lines.transliteration_english: roozae shab kaanadhar dhilash yaadh khudhaa-sath | 68 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Or He abides in their hearts where there is constant remembrance of Him day and night. (68)

lines.gurmukhi: cSim aU br ZYr hriZz vw nw-Sud
lines.transliteration_english: chasham oo bar ghair haraghiz vaa naa-shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: The eyes of a meditator never open up to see anyone or anything else but Him;

lines.gurmukhi: kqrwie aU juz sUie dirAw nBSud ]69]
lines.transliteration_english: katharaae oo juz sooe dhariaa nabhashudh | 69 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, his drop (of water), every breath, does not flow towards any other place except towards the vast ocean (the Akaalpurakh). (69)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdwie aU swihb hr do srw
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaae oo saahib har dho saraa

Shabad OS N.translation: A man of God is the master of both the worlds;

lines.gurmukhi: kU n bInd ZYr nkiS ikbrIAw ]70]
lines.transliteration_english: koo n beenadh ghair nakash kibareeaa | 70 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, he does not see anything else other than the Great Embodiment of Truth. (70)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx jhwno Awx jhwx &wnI bvd
lines.transliteration_english: een jehaano aan jehaan faanee bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: This and the next world both are perishable;

lines.gurmukhi: ZYir XwdS jumlw nwdwnI bvd ]71]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair  yaadhash  jumalaa naadhaanee bavadh | 71 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Everything else other than His remembrance is a complete foolishness. (71)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwd kun hwx qwx qvwnI Xwd kun
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh kun haan thaan thavaanee yaadh kuna

Shabad OS N.translation: Remember Akaalpurakh: You should remember Him as much as you can;

lines.gurmukhi: ^wnw rw Az Xwid h?k Awbwd kun ]72]
lines.transliteration_english: khaanaa raa az yaadh hak aabaadh kun | 72 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, populate your home-like heart/mind with His constant remembrance. (72)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx idil qU ^wnwie h?k bUdw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: een dhil thoo khaanaae hak boodhaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Your heart/mind is nothing but the abode of God;

lines.gurmukhi: mn ikh goiem h?k cunIx &rmUdw Asq ]73]
lines.transliteration_english: man kih goeim hak chuneen faramoodhaa asath | 73 |

Shabad OS N.translation: What can I say! This is what is the edict of God Himself (73)

lines.gurmukhi: Swh bw qU hmnSIno hm zubwx
lines.transliteration_english: shaah baa thoo hamanasheeno ham zubaana

Shabad OS N.translation: Your (true) companion and constantly affirming your viewpoint is the King of the world, the Akaalpurakh;

lines.gurmukhi: qU b-sUie hr kso nwks dvwx ]74]
lines.transliteration_english: thoo ba-sooe har kaso naakas dhavaan | 74 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But, you keep running after every person for having your desires fulfilled. (74)

lines.gurmukhi: vwie qU br jwin qU Aihvwil qU
lines.transliteration_english: vaae thoo bar jaan thoo ahivaal thoo

Shabad OS N.translation: Goyaa says, I feel sorry for you, for your life and for your state of mind;

lines.gurmukhi: vwie br eIx ZPlqo A&Awil qU ]75]
lines.transliteration_english: vaae bar een ghafalatho afaaal thoo | 75 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I feel sorry for your negligence (for not remembering Him) and for the conduct of your life. (75)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy kU qwilib dIdwr Sud
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae koo thaalib dheedhaar shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who is desirous and anxious to get a glimpse of Him,

lines.gurmukhi: pyiS cSmS jumlw nkiS Xwr Sud ]76]
lines.transliteration_english: paesh chashamash jumalaa nakash yaar shudh | 76 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In his view, every visible and living thing conforms into His own image. (76)

lines.gurmukhi: drimAwin nkS n?kwS Asqo bs
lines.transliteration_english: dharamiaan nakash nakaash asatho basa

Shabad OS N.translation: It is the same Artist that sparkles Himself in every portrait,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN s^un rw dr nXwbd bUAl-hvs ]77]
lines.transliteration_english: ee sakhun raa dhar nayaabadh booala-havas | 77 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, this mystery cannot be understood by the human beings. (77)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qU mI^wnI iz ieSik h?k sbk
lines.transliteration_english: gar thoo meekhaanee z eishak hak sabaka

Shabad OS N.translation: If you want to get a lesson on devotion to Waaheguru, then

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k kun Xwid h?k kun Xwid h?k ]78]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak kun yaadh hak kun yaadh hak | 78 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You should remember Him; in fact, you should constantly keep remembering Him. (78)

lines.gurmukhi: AY brwdr Xwid h?k dwnI ik cIsq
lines.transliteration_english: ai baraadhar yaadh hak dhaanee k cheesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: O brother! Do you know how to define remembrance of Waaheguru?

lines.gurmukhi: AMdrUin jumlw idlhwie jwie kIsq ]79]
lines.transliteration_english: andharoon jumalaa dhilehaae jaae keesath | 79 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, who is it who abides in the hearts and minds of everyone ? (79)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM drUin jumlw idlhw swie aUsq
lines.transliteration_english: choon dharoon jumalaa dhilehaa saae oosatha

Shabad OS N.translation: When it is His image that prevails in the hearts of every one,

lines.gurmukhi: ^wnwie idl mMzlo mwvwie aUsq ]80]
lines.transliteration_english: khaanaae dhil manzalo maavaae oosath | 80 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That means that the home-like heart is the destination and asylum for Him.(80)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM ibdwinsqI ik dr idlhw ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: choon bidhaanisathee k dhar dhilehaa khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: When you learn that it is the Omnipotent who abides in everyone's heart and mind,

lines.gurmukhi: ps qurw Awdwib hr idl mudAw-sq ]81]
lines.transliteration_english: pas thuraa aadhaab har dhil mudhaaa-sath | 81 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, it should be your principal purpose (of life) to be respectful to everyone's heart. (81)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k eInsqo dIgr Xwd nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak eenasatho dheegar yaadh neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This is what is called the meditation of Waaheguru; there is no other remembrance,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ikrw eIx Zm nBbwSd Swd nIsq ]82]
lines.transliteration_english: har kiraa een gham nabhabaashadh shaadh neesath | 82 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever is not anxious about this fact, is not a happy soul. (82)

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI ie Awir&wx Xwid ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee e aarifaan yaadh khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: Meditation is (the chief aim of) the whole life of God-enlightened persons;

lines.gurmukhi: Az ^udw dUr Asq hr kU ^ud-numwsq ]83]
lines.transliteration_english: az khudhaa dhoor asath har koo khudha-numaasath | 83 |

Shabad OS N.translation: A person who is stuck in his self ego is driven farther and farther away from Waaheguru. (83)

lines.gurmukhi: kIsq goXw muSiq ^wik byS nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: keesath goyaa mushath khaak baesh neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: O Goyaa! What is your existence in life?  It is no more than a handful of dust;

lines.gurmukhi: Awx hm AMdr A^iqAwr ^yS nIsq ]84]
lines.transliteration_english: aan ham andhar akhathiaar khaesh neesath | 84 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, even that is not under your control; The body that we claim to own is not under our control either. (84)

lines.gurmukhi: h?k ik h&qwdo do im?lq AwPrId
lines.transliteration_english: hak k hafathaadho dho mlith aafareedha

Shabad OS N.translation: Akaalpurakh created seventy two communities,

lines.gurmukhi: i&rkwie nwjI AzIhwx br guzId ]85]
lines.transliteration_english: firakaae naajee azeehaan bar guzeedh | 85 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Out of which, He designated the Naajee community as the most elite. (85)

lines.gurmukhi: i&rkwie nwjI ibdwx by-ieSqbwh
lines.transliteration_english: firakaae naajee bidhaan bae-eishathabaaha

Shabad OS N.translation: We should consider the Naajee (who is considered above and beyond the cycles of transmigration) community, without any doubt,

lines.gurmukhi: hsq h&qwdo do im?lq rw pnwh ]86]
lines.transliteration_english: hasath hafathaadho dho mlith raa panaah | 86 |

Shabad OS N.translation: As the shelter for the seventy two clans. (86)

lines.gurmukhi: mrdmwnS hr Xky pwkIzw qr
lines.transliteration_english: maradhamaanash har yakae paakeezaa thara

Shabad OS N.translation: Every member of this Najee community is sacred;

lines.gurmukhi: ^Ub-rU E ^Ub-^U E ^uS-sIAr ]87]
lines.transliteration_english: khooba-roo ou khooba-khoo ou khusha-seear | 87 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Beautiful and handsome, well mannered with a noble disposition. (87)

lines.gurmukhi: pyiS Swx juz Xwid h?k mnzUr nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: paesh shaan juz yaadh hak manazoor neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: To these folks, nothing else but the remembrance of Akaalpurakh is acceptable;

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr hri& bMdgI dsqUr nIsq ]88]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair haraf bandhagee dhasathoor neesath | 88 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, they do not have any tradition or mannerism other than the recitation of the words of prayer. (88)

lines.gurmukhi: mIckd Az hri& Swx kMdo nbwq
lines.transliteration_english: meechakadh az haraf shaan kandho nabaath

Shabad OS N.translation: Utter sweetness oozes out of their words and conversation,

lines.gurmukhi: bwrd Az hr mUie Swx Awib hXwq ]89]
lines.transliteration_english: baaradh az har mooe shaan aab hayaath | 89 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, divine elixir is showered from every hair of theirs. (89)

lines.gurmukhi: &wirZ AMd Az buZzo kInw E iz hsd
lines.transliteration_english: faarigh andh az bughazo keenaa ou z hasadha

Shabad OS N.translation: They are above and beyond any form of jealousy, hostility or enmity;

lines.gurmukhi: br nmI-Awied Az eySwx i&Ail bd ]90]
lines.transliteration_english: bar namee-aaeidh az eaeshaan fial badh | 90 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They never commit any sinful acts. (90)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy rw ie?zqo hurmq kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae raa ezitho huramath kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They extend respect and honor to every one;

lines.gurmukhi: mu&lsy rw swihib dOlq kunMd ]91]
lines.transliteration_english: mufalasae raa saahib dhaaualath kunandh | 91 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, they help poor and needy to become rich and opulent. (91)

lines.gurmukhi: murdw rw Awib-hYvwx mIidhMd
lines.transliteration_english: muradhaa raa aabi-haivaan meedhihandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They bless the dead souls with divine nectar;

lines.gurmukhi: hr idly pzmurdw rw jwx mIidhMd ]92]
lines.transliteration_english: har dhilae pazamuradhaa raa jaan meedhihandh | 92 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They bestow new and rejuvenated life to withered and demoralized minds. (92)

lines.gurmukhi: sbz mIswzMd coib ^uSk rw
lines.transliteration_english: sabaz meesaazandh chob khushak raa

Shabad OS N.translation: They can transform dry wood into green twigs;

lines.gurmukhi: bUey mIbKSMd rMig muSk rw ]93]
lines.transliteration_english: booeae meebakhashandh rang mushak raa | 93 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They also can convert a stinking odor into scented musk. (93)

lines.gurmukhi: jumlw ASrw& AMd dr zwqo is&wq
lines.transliteration_english: jumalaa asharaaf andh dhar zaatho sifaatha

Shabad OS N.translation: All these well-intentioned persons possess noble personal qualities;

lines.gurmukhi: qwilib zwq AMd ^ud hm Awin zwq ]94]
lines.transliteration_english: thaalib zaath andh khudh ham aan zaath | 94 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They are all seekers of Waaheguru's Entity; in fact, they are just like Him (are His image). (94)

lines.gurmukhi: ^Uie Swx ielmo Adb rw muzhr Asq
lines.transliteration_english: khooe shaan eilamo adhab raa muzehar asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Learning and literature emerges (spontaneously) from their behavior;

lines.gurmukhi: rUie Swx rOSn iz imhir Anvr Asq ]95]
lines.transliteration_english: rooe shaan raauashan z mihar anavar asath | 95 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, their faces radiate like the glowing divinely sun. (95)

lines.gurmukhi: im?liq Swx kOim mskInwx bvd
lines.transliteration_english: mlith shaan kaauam masakeenaan bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Their clan consists of a group of humble, meek and gentle persons;

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm Swieik eInwx bvd ]96]
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam shaaeik eenaan bavadh | 96 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And they have devotees in both the worlds; People in both the worlds believe in them. (96)

lines.gurmukhi: kOim imskIx kOim mrdwin ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: kaauam misakeen kaauam maradhaan khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: This group of people is the community of gentle and humble souls, a community of God's men.

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hmw &wnI v aU dwiem bkwsq ]97]
lines.transliteration_english: een hamaa faanee v oo dhaaeim bakaasath | 97 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Every thing that we see is destructible, but Akaalpurakh is the only One that prevails perpetually and is Imperishable. (97)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx ^wk rw AksIr krd
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan khaak raa akaseer karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Their company and association transformed even the dust to an effective cure.

lines.gurmukhi: luqi& Swx br hr idly qwsIr krd ]98]
lines.transliteration_english: luthaf shaan bar har dhilae thaaseer karadh | 98 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Their blessings effectively impressed every heart. (98)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik b-eySwx nSInd X?k dmy
lines.transliteration_english: har k ba-eaeshaan nasheenadh yak dhamae

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who enjoys their company just once even for a moment,

lines.gurmukhi: rUiz &rdw rw kujw dwrd Zmyx ]99]
lines.transliteration_english: rooz faradhaa raa kujaa dhaaradh ghamaen | 99 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He, then, does not have to be apprehensive about the day of reckoning. (99)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ic dr sd-swlw aumrS nBXw&q
lines.transliteration_english: aan ch dhar sadha-saalaa oumarash nabhayaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: A person who could not attain much in spite of hundreds of years of life,

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx hmcU ^urSIdS ibqw^q ]100]
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan hamachoo khurasheedhash bithaakhath | 100 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Shone like a sun when he joined the company of  these people. (100)

lines.gurmukhi: mw ik Az iehswin Swx SrimMdw-eym
lines.transliteration_english: maa k az eihasaan shaan sharamindhaa-eaema

Shabad OS N.translation: We are obligated and owe them a debt of gratitude,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdwie iehswin Swx rw bMdw eym ]101]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaae eihasaan shaan raa bandhaa eaem | 101 |

Shabad OS N.translation: We are, in fact, persons/products of their favors and kindness. (101)

lines.gurmukhi: sd hzwrwx hmcU mn kurbwin Swx
lines.transliteration_english: sadh hazaaraan hamachoo man kurabaan shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: Millions like me are willing to sacrifice themselves for these nobilities;

lines.gurmukhi: hb ic goiem km bvd dr Swin Swx ]102]
lines.transliteration_english: hab ch goeim kam bavadh dhar shaan shaan | 102 |

Shabad OS N.translation: No matter how much I say in their honor and praise, it will be inadequate. (102)

lines.gurmukhi: Swin Swx bIrUM bvd Az gu&qgU
lines.transliteration_english: shaan shaan beeroon bavadh az gufathagoo

Shabad OS N.translation: Their honor and appreciation is beyond any words or expression;

lines.gurmukhi: jwmwie Swx pwk Az Susqo SU ]103]
lines.transliteration_english: jaamaae shaan paak az shusatho shoo | 103 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The style (attire) of their life is cleaner and chaste than any amount of washing or rinsing. (103)

lines.gurmukhi: dwx XkIx qw cMd eIx duinAw bvd
lines.transliteration_english: dhaan yakeen thaa chandh een dhuniaa bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Believe me ! How long is this world going to last? Only for a short time;

lines.gurmukhi: Aw^irS kwir qU bw mOlw bvd ]104]
lines.transliteration_english: aakharish kaar thoo baa maaualaa bavadh | 104 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Ultimately, we have to develop and maintain a relationship with the Almighty. (104)

lines.gurmukhi: ps z A?vl kun hdIis Swh rw
lines.transliteration_english: pas z aval kun hadhees shaah raa

Shabad OS N.translation: Now you indulge yourself in the stories and discourses of (that) King, the Waaheguru.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrvI kun hwdIey eIx rwh rw ]105]
lines.transliteration_english: pairavee kun haadheeeae een raah raa | 105 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, follow the Guide who shows you the direction (of life). (105)

lines.gurmukhi: qw qU hm XwbI murwid aumr rw
lines.transliteration_english: thaa thoo ham yaabee muraadh oumar raa

Shabad OS N.translation: So that your life's hopes and ambitions are fulfilled;

lines.gurmukhi: lzqy XwbI z SOik ikbrIAw ]106]
lines.transliteration_english: lazathae yaabee z shaauak kibareeaa | 106 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, you can have the pleasure of the savor of the devotion for Akaalpurakh.(106)

lines.gurmukhi: jwihl Awx-jw swihib-idl mISvd
lines.transliteration_english: jaahil aana-jaa saahibi-dhil meeshavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: (With His grace) even s stupid person can become an intellectual and enlightened;

lines.gurmukhi: Zrik driAwE bswihl mISvd ]107]
lines.transliteration_english: gharak dharaaiaaou basaahil meeshavadh | 107 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, a person drowning in deep waters of a river can reach the banks. (107)

lines.gurmukhi: nw iks Awx jw Awir& kwiml Svd
lines.transliteration_english: naa kis aan jaa aarif kaamil shavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: An insignificant person can become fully enlightened,

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid mOlw hr ik rw hwisl Svd ]108]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh maaualaa har k raa haasil shavadh | 108 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When he engages himself in the remembrance of Waaheguru. (108)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx Asb qwjsq br A&rwik ks
lines.transliteration_english: een asab thaajasath bar afaraak kasa

Shabad OS N.translation: A person is being adorned, as if, with a crown of learning and honor on his head,

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ik Zwi&l nIsq Az h?k X?k n&s ]109]
lines.transliteration_english: aan k ghaafil neesath az hak yak nafas | 109 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who does not become negligent even for one moment in remembering Akaalpurakh. (109)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy rw nIsq eIx dOlq nsIb
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae raa neesath een dhaaualath naseeba

Shabad OS N.translation: This treasure is not in the lot of everyone;

lines.gurmukhi: drid Swx rw nIsq ZYr Az h?k qbIb ]110]
lines.transliteration_english: dharadh shaan raa neesath ghair az hak thabeeb | 110 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The cure for their pain is no one else other than the Waaheguru, the doctor. (110)

lines.gurmukhi: dwrUie hr drd rw Xwid ^udwsq
lines.transliteration_english: dhaarooe har dharadh raa yaadh khudhaasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Remembrance of Akaalpurakh is the cure-all for every malady and pain;

lines.gurmukhi: zwx ik dr hr hwl h?k dwrd rvw-sq ]111]
lines.transliteration_english: zaan k dhar har haal hak dhaaradh ravaa-sath | 111 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In whatever condition or state He keeps us, should be acceptable. (111)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml hmw rw AwrzU
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil hamaa raa aarazoo

Shabad OS N.translation: It is the wish and desire of everyone to seek a perfect Guru;

lines.gurmukhi: ZYir murSd ks n Xwbd rih bdU ]112]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair murashadh kas n yaabadh rehi badhoo | 112 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Without such a mentor, no one can reach the Almighty. (112)

lines.gurmukhi: rwh-rvwx rw rwh ibsIAwr Awmdw
lines.transliteration_english: raaha-ravaan raa raah biseeaar aamadhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: There are several paths for the travelers to traverse;

lines.gurmukhi: kwrvwx rw rwh drkwr Awmdw ]113]
lines.transliteration_english: kaaravaan raa raah dharakaar aamadhaa | 113 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But what they need is the path of the caravan. (113)

lines.gurmukhi: dm bdm dr izkir mOlw hwzr AMd
lines.transliteration_english: dham badham dhar zikar maaualaa haazar andha

Shabad OS N.translation: They are always alert and prepared for the remembrance of Akaalpurakh;

lines.gurmukhi: ^yS mnzUro ^udw rw nwizr AMd ]114]
lines.transliteration_english: khaesh manazooro khudhaa raa naazir andh | 114 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They are acceptable to Him and they are His observers, on-lookers and spectators. (114)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml hmwx bwxSd hmwx
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil hamaan baanashadh hamaana

Shabad OS N.translation: A perfect Satguru is the one and the only one,

lines.gurmukhi: kz klwmS bUie h?k Awid AXwx ]115]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz kalaamash booe hak aadh ayaan | 115 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Whose conversation and Gurbaanee emits the Divine fragrance. (115)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik Awied pyiS eySwx z?rw vwr
lines.transliteration_english: har k aaeidh paesh eaeshaan zaraa vaara

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who comes in front of such persons (Perfect Gurus) in humility like a dust particle,

lines.gurmukhi: zUd grdd hmcU imhir nUr bwr ]116]
lines.transliteration_english: zoodh garadhadh hamachoo mihar noor baar | 116 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He, soon, becomes capable to shower radiance like that of sun. (116)

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI eInsq by cuno icrw
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee eenasath bae chuno chiraa

Shabad OS N.translation: That life is worth living that, without any delay or excuses,

lines.gurmukhi: ibguzrd eIx aumr dr Xwid ^udw ]117]
lines.transliteration_english: biguzaradh een oumar dhar yaadh khudhaa | 117 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Is spent in the memory of the Providence in this lifetime. (117)

lines.gurmukhi: ^ud-pRsqI kwir nwdwx Awmdw
lines.transliteration_english: khudha-prasathee kaar naadhaan aamadhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: To indulge in self-propaganda is the work of stupid people;

lines.gurmukhi: h?k pRsqI zwiq eImwx Awmdw ]118]
lines.transliteration_english: hak prasathee zaath eemaan aamadhaa | 118 |

Shabad OS N.translation: While to get engaged in meditation is the characteristic of the faithful. (118)

lines.gurmukhi: hr dmy ZPlq bvd mrig AzIm
lines.transliteration_english: har dhamae ghafalath bavadh marag azeema

Shabad OS N.translation: Negligence of every moment of not remembering Him is like a huge death;

lines.gurmukhi: h?k ingwh dwrd iz SYqwin rzIm ]119]
lines.transliteration_english: hak nigaah dhaaradh z shaithaan razeem | 119 |

Shabad OS N.translation: May God, with His eye, save us from the Satan of Hell. (119)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ik rUzo Sb b-XwdS mubqlw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: aan k roozo shab ba-yaadhash mubathalaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who is (constantly) imbued in remembering Him day and night,

lines.gurmukhi: eIx mqwA AMdr dukwin AOlIAw-sq ]120]
lines.transliteration_english: een mathaaa andhar dhukaan aaualeeaa-sath | 120 |

Shabad OS N.translation: (Knows very well that) This wealth, the memory of Akaalpurakh, is available only at the store (congregation) of saintly persons. (120)

lines.gurmukhi: ikhqrIin bMdwie drgwih Swx
lines.transliteration_english: kihathareen bandhaae dharagaahi shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: Even the lowest person in their court

lines.gurmukhi: ibhqr Asq Az imhqrwin eIx jhwx ]121]
lines.transliteration_english: bihathar asath az mihatharaan een jehaan | 121 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Is superior than the so called most respectable stalwarts of this world. (121)

lines.gurmukhi: bs bzurZwx kU i&dwie rwih Swx
lines.transliteration_english: bas bazuraghaan koo fidhaae raahi shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: Many wise and experienced persons are enamored and are prepared to make sacrifices on their paths,

lines.gurmukhi: surmwie cSmm iz ^wik rwih Swx ]122]
lines.transliteration_english: suramaae chashamam z khaak raahi shaan | 122 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the dust of their paths is like a collyrium for my eyes. (122)

lines.gurmukhi: hmcunIx ipMdwr ^ud rw AY AzIz
lines.transliteration_english: hamachuneen pindhaar khudh raa ai azeeza

Shabad OS N.translation: You, too, my dear youngster! Consider yourself just like this,

lines.gurmukhi: qw SvI AY jwin mn mrid qmIz ]123]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa shavee ai jaan man maradh thameez | 123 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that, my dear! You, too, can transform yourself into a pious and saintly person. (123)

lines.gurmukhi: swihbwx rw bMdw ibsAwr Awmdw
lines.transliteration_english: saahibaan raa bandhaa bisaaar aamadhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: These masters, the noble souls, have numerous followers and devotees;

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw rw bw-bMdgI kwr Awmdw ]124]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa raa baa-bandhagee kaar aamadhaa | 124 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The main task assigned to each and every one of us is only to meditate. (124)

lines.gurmukhi: ms qurw bwied ik i^dmqgwir Swx
lines.transliteration_english: mas thuraa baaeidh k khidhamathagaar shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, you should become their follower and a devotee;

lines.gurmukhi: bwSI E hrigz nBbwSI bwir Swx ]125]
lines.transliteration_english: baashee ou haragiz nabhabaashee baar shaan | 125 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But you should never be liability for them. (125)

lines.gurmukhi: grich XwrI-idh n ZYr Az swlky-sq
lines.transliteration_english: garachih yaaree-dhih n ghair az saalakae-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though, there is no one else without them to connect us to the Almighty,

lines.gurmukhi: lyk kr Zu&qn cunIx AYby bsy-sq ]126]
lines.transliteration_english: laek kar ghufathan chuneen aibae basae-sath | 126 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Still, for them to make such a claim would be a transgression. (126)

lines.gurmukhi: z?rw rw dIdm ik ^urSIid jhwx
lines.transliteration_english: zaraa raa dheedham k khurasheedh jehaana

Shabad OS N.translation: I realized that even a small particle became the sun for the whole world,

lines.gurmukhi: Sud iz &Yiz suhbiq swihb-idlwx ]127]
lines.transliteration_english: shudh z faiz suhabath saahiba-dhilaan | 127 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With the blessings of the association with the saintly persons. (127)

lines.gurmukhi: kIsq swihib-idl ik h?k ibsnwsdS
lines.transliteration_english: keesath saahibi-dhil k hak bisanaasadhasha

Shabad OS N.translation: Who is that person with a great heart who can recognize the Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: kz lkwieS SOik h?k mI-bwrdS ]128]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz lakaaeish shaauak hak mee-baaradhash | 128 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And whose face (constantly) radiates His splendor ? (128)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx SOik h?k b^Sd qurw
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan shaauak hak bakhashadh thuraa

Shabad OS N.translation: The company of such noble souls blesses you with the Devotion for the Lord,

lines.gurmukhi: Az ikqwib h?k sbk b^Sd qurw ]129]
lines.transliteration_english: az kithaab hak sabak bakhashadh thuraa | 129 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And it is their company too that gives you spiritual lessons from the holy book. (129)

lines.gurmukhi: z?rw rw ^urSIid Anvr mI-kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: zaraa raa khurasheedh anavar mee-kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They, the noble souls, can transform even a small particles into a sprightly sun;

lines.gurmukhi: ^wk rw Az h?k mun?vr mI-kunMd ]130]
lines.transliteration_english: khaak raa az hak munavar mee-kunandh | 130 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it is them who can sparkle even the common dust into the Light of Truth. (130)

lines.gurmukhi: cSim qU ^wkI v dr vY nUir h?k
lines.transliteration_english: chasham thoo khaakee v dhar vai noor haka

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though your eye is made of dust, still it has the Divine radiance,

lines.gurmukhi: AMdrUnS cwr sU v nhu qbk ]131]
lines.transliteration_english: andharoonash chaar soo v nahu thabak | 131 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It also contains all the four directions, east, west, south and north, and the nine heavens. (131)

lines.gurmukhi: i^dmiq Swx bMdgIie h?k bvd
lines.transliteration_english: khidhamath shaan bandhageee hak bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Any service performed for them, the saintly persons, is the worship of Waaheguru;

lines.gurmukhi: kwx kbUil kwdir muqilk bvd ]132]
lines.transliteration_english: kaan kabool kaadhar muthalik bavadh | 132 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because they are the ones who are acceptable to the Omnipotent. (132)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI kun jwx ik aU bwSd kbUl
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee kun jaan k oo baashadh kaboola

Shabad OS N.translation: You, too, should meditate so that you be acceptable before the Akaalpurakh.

lines.gurmukhi: kdir aU rw kY ibdwnd hr jhUl ]133]
lines.transliteration_english: kadhar oo raa kai bidhaanadh har jehool | 133 |

Shabad OS N.translation: How can any stupid person appreciate His invaluable worth. (133)

lines.gurmukhi: hsq kwir rUzo Sb dr Xwid aU
lines.transliteration_english: hasath kaar roozo shab dhar yaadh oo

Shabad OS N.translation: The only task we should be engaged day and night is to remember Him;

lines.gurmukhi: X?k n&s ^wlI nmI bwSd AzU ]134]
lines.transliteration_english: yak nafas khaalee namee baashadh azoo | 134 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Not even one moment should be spared without His meditation and prayers. (134)

lines.gurmukhi: cSim Swx rOSn iz dIdwir A?lwh
lines.transliteration_english: chasham shaan raauashan z dheedhaar alaaha

Shabad OS N.translation: Their eyes are glistened because of His Divine glimpse,

lines.gurmukhi: dr ilbws AMdr-gdw E bwdSwh ]135]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar libaas andhara-gadhaa ou baadhashaah | 135 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They may be in the guise of a mendicant, but they are the kings. (135)

lines.gurmukhi: bwdSwhI Awx ik aU dwiem bvd
lines.transliteration_english: baadhashaahee aan k oo dhaaeim bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Only that kingdom is considered a real kingdom that lasts for ever,

lines.gurmukhi: hmcU jwiq pwik h?k kwiem bvd ]136]
lines.transliteration_english: hamachoo jaath paak hak kaaeim bavadh | 136 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, like the pure and chaste Nature of God, should be eternal. (136)

lines.gurmukhi: rsim Swx AweIin drvySI bvd
lines.transliteration_english: rasam shaan aaeen dharavaeshee bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Their custom and tradition is mostly that of mendicants;

lines.gurmukhi: As ^udw E bwhmw ^ysI bvd ]137]
lines.transliteration_english: as khudhaa ou baahamaa khaesee bavadh | 137 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They are the lineage and the scions of Waaheguru, and they have intimacy and familiarity with all. (137)

lines.gurmukhi: hr gdw rw ie?zy jwhy mIidhMd
lines.transliteration_english: har gadhaa raa eziae jaahae meedhihandha

Shabad OS N.translation: The Akaalpurakh blesses every ascetic with honor and status;

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq by-ieSqbwhI mIidhMd ]138]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath bae-eishathabaahee meedhihandh | 138 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Without any doubt, He also bestows (everyone) with wealth and treasures. (138)

lines.gurmukhi: nwkswx rw Awiri& kwiml kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: naakasaan raa aarif kaamil kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They can transform trivial and paltry persons into perfectly knowledgeable ones;

lines.gurmukhi: by-idlwx rw swihib-idl mIkunMd ]139]
lines.transliteration_english: bae-dhilaan raa saahibi-dhil meekunandh | 139 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the demoralized ones into courageous persons and masters of their destiny. (139)

lines.gurmukhi: ^ud-pRsqI Az imAwx brdwSqMd
lines.transliteration_english: khudha-prasathee az miaan baradhaashathandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They eject their vanities from their inner self;

lines.gurmukhi: qu^im h?k dr ikSiq idlhw kwSqMd ]140]
lines.transliteration_english: thukham hak dhar kishath dhilehaa kaashathandh | 140 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, they sow seeds of Truth, the Lord, in the field-like hearts of the people. (140)

lines.gurmukhi: ^ySqn rw hIc mI dwnMd Swx
lines.transliteration_english: khaeshathan raa heech mee dhaanandh shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: They always consider themselves insignificant and lowlier than others;

lines.gurmukhi: hri& h?k rw rUzo Sb ^wnMd Swx ]141]
lines.transliteration_english: haraf hak raa roozo shab khaanandh shaan | 141 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, they are absorbed in the meditation of Naam of Waaheguru day and night. (141)

lines.gurmukhi: qw kujw AOswi& mrdwin ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: thaa kujaa aauasaaf maradhaan khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: How much can I praise the God's men, the saints and the Mahaatamaas?

lines.gurmukhi: Az hzwrwx gr Xky goiem rvw-sq ]142]
lines.transliteration_english: az hazaaraan gar yakae goeim ravaa-sath | 142 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It would be just wonderful if I could describe even one of their thousands of  virtues. (142)

lines.gurmukhi: hmcunIx mrdum bjU kAwx kIsqMd
lines.transliteration_english: hamachuneen maradhum bajoo kaaan keesathandha

Shabad OS N.translation: You, too, should try to find such noble persons (What kind of persons?) who are alive for ever;

lines.gurmukhi: dIgrwx murdMd eIhwx zIsqMd ]143]
lines.transliteration_english: dheegaraan muradhandh eehaan zeesathandh | 143 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The rest of them are apparently alive but are just like dead  bodies. (143)

lines.gurmukhi: zIsqn rw mwAnI dwnI ikh cIsq
lines.transliteration_english: zeesathan raa maaanee dhaanee kih cheesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Do you understand the meaning of 'being alive' ?

lines.gurmukhi: AY ^uSw aumry ik dr XwdS bzIsq ]144]
lines.transliteration_english: ai khushaa oumarae k dhar yaadhash bazeesath | 144 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Only that life is worth living that is spent in remembering the Akaalpurakh. (144)

lines.gurmukhi: mrid Awir& izMdw Az ier&win aU-sq
lines.transliteration_english: maradh aarif zindhaa az eirafaan oo-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The enlightened persons are alive only because of the knowledge of the mysteries of God's attributes;

lines.gurmukhi: inAmiq hr do jhwx dr ^wnwie aU-sq ]145]
lines.transliteration_english: niamath har dho jehaan dhar khaanaae oo-sath | 145 |

Shabad OS N.translation: (They know) that He has and can shower blessings of both of the worlds in His house. (145)

lines.gurmukhi: mwAnIey eIx izMdgI Xwid ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: maaaneeeae een zindhagee yaadh khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The main purpose of this life is to (constantly) remember Akaalpurakh;

lines.gurmukhi: kz qu&YlS izMdw jwin AOlIAw-sq ]146]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz thufailash zindhaa jaan aaualeeaa-sath | 146 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The saints and prophets live only with this motive. (146)

lines.gurmukhi: izkir aU br hr zbwin goXw Sud
lines.transliteration_english: zikar oo bar har zabaan goyaa shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: A mention of them is on every living tongue;

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm rwih h?k jUXw Sudw ]147]
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam raahi hak jooyaa shudhaa | 147 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, both the worlds are seekers of His path. (147)

lines.gurmukhi: jumlw mI-^wnMd izkir zuljlwl
lines.transliteration_english: jumalaa mee-khaanandh zikar zulajalaala

Shabad OS N.translation: Everyone meditates the awe-inspiring splendid Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy kIlo zhy &r^Mdw kwl ]148]
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae keelo zehae farakhandhaa kaal | 148 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Only then such a meditation is auspicious and such a discourse propitious. (148)

lines.gurmukhi: kIlo kwly gr brwie h?k bvd
lines.transliteration_english: keelo kaalae gar baraae hak bavadh

Shabad OS N.translation: If you want to converse and describe the Truth,

lines.gurmukhi: Az brwie kwdir muqilk bvd ]149]
lines.transliteration_english: az baraae kaadhar muthalik bavadh | 149 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is possible only to discourse the Omnipotent. (149)

lines.gurmukhi: Xw&q eIx srmwXwie aumir njIb
lines.transliteration_english: yaafath een saramaayaae oumar najeeba

Shabad OS N.translation: Such an asset and the treasure of meditation for a spiritual life

lines.gurmukhi: hsq AMdr suhbiq eySwx nsIb ]150]
lines.transliteration_english: hasath andhar suhabath eaeshaan naseeb | 150 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Was blessed through association and the company they kept with the saintly persons. (150)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx rvw bwSd idgr mnzUr nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: aan ravaa baashadh dhigar manazoor neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Any such treasure is not acceptable to them, and they do not like any thing other than the truth;

lines.gurmukhi: Zir hri& rwsqI dsqUr nIsq ]151]
lines.transliteration_english: ghar haraf raasathee dhasathoor neesath | 151 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is not their tradition to speak any words but the words of truth. (151)

lines.gurmukhi: swD sMgq nwim Swx dr ihMdvIsq
lines.transliteration_english: saadh sangath naam shaan dhar hindhaveesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: In Hindi language, they are called the 'Saadh Sangat',

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hmw qwrIi& Swx AY mOlvIsq ]152]
lines.transliteration_english: een hamaa thaareef shaan ai maaualaveesath | 152 |

Shabad OS N.translation: O Maulvee ! All this is in their praise; and all this defines them. (152)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq eySwx bvd luqi& ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath eaeshaan bavadh luthaf khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: The attainment of their company happens only with His blessings;

lines.gurmukhi: qw nsIib ks Svd eIx rU-nmw ]153]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa naseeb kas shavadh een roo-namaa | 153 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, only with His grace, such persons are revealed. (153)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy eIx dOliq jwvId Xw&q
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae een dhaaualath jaaveedh yaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who is fortunate enough to have obtained this eternal wealth,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgIey aumr rw aumId Xw&q ]154]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhageeeae oumar raa oumeedh yaafath | 154 |

Shabad OS N.translation: One may assume then that he has become full of hope for the duration of his whole life. (154)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hmw &wnI v Awx bwkI ibdwx
lines.transliteration_english: een hamaa faanee v aan baakee bidhaana

Shabad OS N.translation: All these, the wealth and the life, are perishable, but they are eternal;

lines.gurmukhi: jwim ieSk pwk rw swkI ibdwx ]155]
lines.transliteration_english: jaam eishak paak raa saakee bidhaan | 155 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Consider them as bartenders who are serving glasses full of divine devotion.  (155)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ic hsq Az suhbiq eySwx bvd
lines.transliteration_english: har ch hasath az suhabath eaeshaan bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever is seemingly apparent in this world is all because of their company;

lines.gurmukhi: kz q&YlS jumlw Awbwdw bvd ]156]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz thafailash jumalaa aabaadhaa bavadh | 156 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is their grace that we see all the habitation and prosperity here. (156)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hmw AwbwdI Az luqi& ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: een hamaa aabaadhee az luthaf khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: All these habitations (of living beings) are the result of the blessings of Waaheguru;

lines.gurmukhi: ZPlq Az vY X?k n&s mrgo j&w sq ]157]
lines.transliteration_english: ghafalath az vai yak nafas marago jafaa sath | 157 |

Shabad OS N.translation: To neglect Him even for one moment is equivalent to pain and death. (157)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx hwsil eIx izMdgIsq
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan haasal een zindhageesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: To achieve an association with them, the noble persons, is the cornerstone of this life;

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI eIx izMdgI eIx bMdgI-sq ]158]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee een zindhagee een bandhagee-sath | 158 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is life, that is indeed life which is spent in meditating His Naam. (158)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qU mI^whI ik mrid h?k SvI
lines.transliteration_english: gar thoo meekhaahee k maradh hak shavee

Shabad OS N.translation: If you wish to become Waaheguru's true devotee,

lines.gurmukhi: Awiri& aU kwiml muqilk SvI ]159]
lines.transliteration_english: aarif oo kaamil muthalik shavee | 159 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you should become knowledgeable and enlightened about the perfect Entity. (159)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx kImIAw bwSd qurw
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan keemeeaa baashadh thuraa

Shabad OS N.translation: Their company is like a cure-all for you;

lines.gurmukhi: qw ich mI^whI rvw bwSd qurw ]160]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa chih meekhaahee ravaa baashadh thuraa | 160 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, whatever you wish shall be appropriate. (160)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hmw kU swihib jwx AwmdMd
lines.transliteration_english: een hamaa koo saahib jaan aamadhandha

Shabad OS N.translation: All this breathing and living world that we see

lines.gurmukhi: Az brwie suhbiq Swx AwmdMd ]161]
lines.transliteration_english: az baraae suhabath shaan aamadhandh | 161 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Is only because of the company of the noble souls. (161)

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgIey Swx iz&Yiz shubq Asq
lines.transliteration_english: zindhageeeae shaan zifaiz sahubath asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The existing lives of those living beings is the result of the company of saintly persons;

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx Awieiq pur rihmq Asq ]162]
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan aaeith pur rehimath asath | 162 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the company of such noble persons is the proof of the kindness and compassion of Akaalpurakh. (162)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy rw suhbiq Swx bwiedS
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae raa suhabath shaan baaeidhasha

Shabad OS N.translation: Everyone, in fact, needs their company;

lines.gurmukhi: qw iz idl Akid guhr ibkuSwiedS ]163]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa z dhil akadh guhar bikushaaeidhash | 163 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that they could unravel the chain of pearls (noble aspects) from their hearts. (163)

lines.gurmukhi: swihib gMjInweI A by-^br
lines.transliteration_english: saahib ganjeenaaee a bae-khabara

Shabad OS N.translation: O naive! You are the master of priceless treasure;

lines.gurmukhi: lyk zwx gMjy qurw nBbvd ^br ]164]
lines.transliteration_english: laek zaan ganjae thuraa nabhabavadh khabar | 164 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But alas! You have no realization of that hidden treasure. (164)

lines.gurmukhi: kY Azwx gMjy b-XwbI ieqlwA
lines.transliteration_english: kai azaan ganjae ba-yaabee eithalaaa

Shabad OS N.translation: How can you find out that invaluable treasure

lines.gurmukhi: AMdrUin ku&l cUM bwSd mqwA ]165]
lines.transliteration_english: andharoon kufal choon baashadh mathaaa | 165 |

Shabad OS N.translation: As to what kind of wealth is hidden inside the vault. (165)

lines.gurmukhi: ps qurw lwizm bvd jUeI kulId
lines.transliteration_english: pas thuraa laazim bavadh jooee kuleedha

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, it is essential for you to strive to find the key to the treasure,

lines.gurmukhi: qw b-bInI gMij ^u&IAw rw pdId ]166]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa ba-beenee ganj khufeeaa raa padheedh | 166 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that you can have a clear realization of this covert, mysterious and valuable repository. (166)

lines.gurmukhi: ku&l ibkuSw Az kulIid nwim h?k
lines.transliteration_english: kufal bikushaa az kuleedh naam haka

Shabad OS N.translation: You should use the Naam of Waaheguru as the key to open this hidden wealth;

lines.gurmukhi: Az ikqwib gMj m^&I ^wx sbk ]167]
lines.transliteration_english: az kithaab ganj makhafee khaan sabak | 167 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, learn the lessons from the Book of this hidden treasure, the Granth. (167)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx kulIid nwm pyiS Swx bvd
lines.transliteration_english: een kuleedh naam paesh shaan bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: This key is found (only) with the saintly persons,

lines.gurmukhi: mrhim idlhwie rySy jwx bvd ]168]
lines.transliteration_english: mareham dhilehaae raeshae jaan bavadh | 168 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, this key serves as the ointment of lacerated hearts and lives. (168)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM ksy rw eIx kulId Awied b-dsq
lines.transliteration_english: choon kasae raa een kuleedh aaeidh ba-dhasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who can get hold of this key

lines.gurmukhi: swihib gMjInw bwSd hr ik hsq ]169]
lines.transliteration_english: saahib ganjeenaa baashadh har k hasath | 169 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He may be anyone, he can become the master of this treasure. (169)

lines.gurmukhi: gMj rw cUM Xw&qw joXwie gMj
lines.transliteration_english: ganj raa choon yaafathaa joyaae ganja

Shabad OS N.translation: When the seeker of the treasure does find his goal,

lines.gurmukhi: gSq &wirg Az hmw qSvISo rMj ]170]
lines.transliteration_english: gashath faarig az hamaa thashaveesho ranj | 170 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then consider that he has been salvaged from all worries and anxieties. (170)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx hm Az mrdwin h?k Sud AY S&Ik
lines.transliteration_english: aan ham az maradhaan hak shudh ai shafeeka

Shabad OS N.translation: O my friend ! That person has joined the group of (true) devotees of God,

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ik rwhy Xw&q dr kUie r&Ik ]171]
lines.transliteration_english: aan k raahae yaafath dhar kooe rafeek | 171 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who has discovered the direction to the streets of the Beloved Friend. (171)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx z?rw rw cUM mwh krd
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan zaraa raa choon maah karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Their association transformed an insignificant dust particle to a shining moon.

lines.gurmukhi: hr gdw rw suhbiq Swx Swh krd ]172]
lines.transliteration_english: har gadhaa raa suhabath shaan shaah karadh | 172 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Again, it was their company that transformed every beggar into a king. (172)

lines.gurmukhi: rihmiq h?k bwd br AOzwie Swx
lines.transliteration_english: rehimath hak baadh bar aauazaae shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: May Akaalpurakh bless their disposition with His grace;

lines.gurmukhi: br ipdr br mwdry iebnwie Swx ]173]
lines.transliteration_english: bar pidhar bar maadharae eibanaae shaan | 173 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, also on their parents and children. (173)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik Swx rw dId h?k rw dIdw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: har k shaan raa dheedh hak raa dheedhaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever gets a chance to see them, consider that they have seen the Almighty God;

lines.gurmukhi: ^uS gul Az bwiZ muh?bq cIdw Asq ]174]
lines.transliteration_english: khush gul az baagh muhabath cheedhaa asath | 174 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And that he has been able to get a glimpse of a beautiful flower out of the garden of love. (174)

lines.gurmukhi: gul iz bwiZ mwAr&q br-cIdn Asq
lines.transliteration_english: gul z baagh maaarafath bara-cheedhan asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The association with such noble persons is like taking a beautiful flower out of the garden of divine knowledge;

lines.gurmukhi: dIdin eySwx ^udw rw dIdn Asq ]175]
lines.transliteration_english: dheedhan eaeshaan khudhaa raa dheedhan asath | 175 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, a sight of such saints is like getting a glimpse of Akaalpurakh. (175)

lines.gurmukhi: muSikl Awmd dIdin h?k rw ibAwx
lines.transliteration_english: mushakil aamadh dheedhan hak raa biaana

Shabad OS N.translation: It is difficult to describe the 'glimpse' of Waaheguru;

lines.gurmukhi: mIidhd eIx jumlw rw kudrq inSwx ]176]
lines.transliteration_english: meedhihadh een jumalaa raa kudharath nishaan | 176 |

Shabad OS N.translation: His powers are reflected in the entire Nature that He has created. (176)

lines.gurmukhi: Az qu&Yil Swx ^udw rw dIdw-Am
lines.transliteration_english: az thufail shaan khudhaa raa dheedhaa-ama

Shabad OS N.translation: With their kindness, I have seen a glimpse of Akaalpurakh;

lines.gurmukhi: gul z bwiZ mwAr&q br cIdw-Am ]177]
lines.transliteration_english: gul z baagh maaarafath bar cheedhaa-am | 177 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, with their grace, I have selected a lively flower from the Divine Garden. (177)

lines.gurmukhi: dIdin h?k mwAnIey dwrd SrI&
lines.transliteration_english: dheedhan hak maaaneeeae dhaaradh shareefa

Shabad OS N.translation: Even to think of getting a glimpse of Akaalpurakh is indeed a sacred intention;

lines.gurmukhi: mn in-Am eIx jumlw Awx zwiq lqIP ]178]
lines.transliteration_english: man ni-am een jumalaa aan zaath latheef | 178 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Goya says, I am nothing! ll this, including the above thought, is due to His abstract and mysterious Entity. (178)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik aU dwinsq eIx hri& qmwm
lines.transliteration_english: har k oo dhaanisath een haraf thamaama

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever has understood this complete message (word),

lines.gurmukhi: Xw&q aU Awx gMij m^&I rw mkwm ]179]
lines.transliteration_english: yaafath oo aan ganj makhafee raa makaam | 179 |

Shabad OS N.translation: As if he has discovered the location of the hidden treasure. (179)

lines.gurmukhi: mwAnIey h?k sUrqy dwrd inkU-sq
lines.transliteration_english: maaaneeeae hak soorathae dhaaradh nikoo-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The reality of Waaheguru has an extremely attractive reflection;

lines.gurmukhi: suriq h?k suriq mrdwin aU-sq ]180]
lines.transliteration_english: surath hak surath maradhaan oo-sath | 180 |
