Shabad OS N.translation: The picture of Akaalpurakh is (can be seen) in His own men and women, the saintly persons. (180)

lines.gurmukhi: ^lviq eySwx bvd dr AMjumn
lines.transliteration_english: khalavath eaeshaan bavadh dhar anjumana

Shabad OS N.translation: They feel they are in seclusion even when they are in the company of groups of people, the congregations;

lines.gurmukhi: vsi& eySwx br zubwin mrdo zn ]181]
lines.transliteration_english: vasaf eaeshaan bar zubaan maradho zan | 181 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Praises of their glory are on the tongues of everyone. (181)

lines.gurmukhi: zIx ^br vwik& ksy bwSd ik aU
lines.transliteration_english: zeen khabar vaakif kasae baashadh k oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Only that person can be cognizant of this mystery,

lines.gurmukhi: dwrd Az SOik muh?bq Zu&qZU ]182]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaradh az shaauak muhabath ghufathaghoo | 182 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who talks and discusses about the devotion for Akaalpurakh with enthusiasm. (182)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik mOlw-AS igrybwx gIr Sud
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak maaualaa-ash giraebaan geer shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone whose enthusiastic devotion for Waaheguru becomes a necklace (garland) for his neck,

lines.gurmukhi: nwksy hm swihib qdbIr Sud ]183]
lines.transliteration_english: naakasae ham saahib thadhabeer shudh | 183 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though he, being a lowly person, becomes wise and sagacious. (183)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik mOlwXq cUM bwSd dsqgIr
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak maaualaayath choon baashadh dhasathageera

Shabad OS N.translation: When the enthusiasm of devotion for God becomes your supporter,

lines.gurmukhi: z?rw grdd rSik ^urSId munIr ]184]
lines.transliteration_english: zaraa garadhadh rashak khurasheedh muneer | 184 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then even a particle of dust desires to emulate (and becomes) a bright sun. (184)

lines.gurmukhi: bsik h?k mIbwrd Az Zu&qwir Swx
lines.transliteration_english: basak hak meebaaradh az ghufathaar shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: When they talk, they shower (words of) the nectar of Truth,

lines.gurmukhi: dIdwhw rOSn Sud Az dIdwir Swx ]185]
lines.transliteration_english: dheedhaahaa raauashan shudh az dheedhaar shaan | 185 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With their glimpse, the eyes become more bright and soothed. (185)

lines.gurmukhi: rUzo Sb bwSMd dr izkrS mudwm
lines.transliteration_english: roozo shab baashandh dhar zikarash mudhaama

Shabad OS N.translation: They keep meditating on the Naam of Waaheguru day and night;

lines.gurmukhi: dr ilbwis dunXvI mrid qmwm ]186]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar libaas dhunayavee maradh thamaam | 186 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Even in the worldly guise, living in this world, they become perfect human beings. (186)

lines.gurmukhi: bw hmw Az jumlw AwzwdMd Swx
lines.transliteration_english: baa hamaa az jumalaa aazaadhandh shaana

Shabad OS N.translation: With everything around them, they are independent and are immune to the effects of these material distractions;

lines.gurmukhi: dr hmw hwl Az ^udw SwdMd Swx ]187]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hamaa haal az khudhaa shaadhandh shaan | 187 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They are always satisfied and pleased under the Will of Akaalpurakh. (187)

lines.gurmukhi: dr ilbwis dunXvIx v rsim dIx
lines.transliteration_english: dhar libaas dhunayaveen v rasam dheena

Shabad OS N.translation: Even they are dressed in worldly clothes, their tradition and practice is religious.

lines.gurmukhi: hmcU eyswx swnIey dIgr mbIx ]188]
lines.transliteration_english: hamachoo eaesaan saaneeeae dheegar mabeen | 188 |

Shabad OS N.translation: There is no one like them in this world. (188)

lines.gurmukhi: hm cunwx dr Xwid h?k dwrMd dsq
lines.transliteration_english: ham chunaan dhar yaadh hak dhaarandh dhasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: They are starkly steady, firm and adept in the memory of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: h?k Snwso h?k psMdo h?k pRsq ]189]
lines.transliteration_english: hak shanaaso hak pasandho hak prasath | 189 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They appreciate and recognize Him, are dedicated to the Truth and also worship the Truth. (189)

lines.gurmukhi: dr ilbwis dunXvI sr qw kdm
lines.transliteration_english: dhar libaas dhunayavee sar thaa kadhama

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though they are seen clad in worldly guise from head to toe,

lines.gurmukhi: bInI vw Zwi&l nBbInI nIm dm ]190]
lines.transliteration_english: beenee vaa ghaafil nabhabeenee neem dham | 190 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You will never find them to be negligent of remembering Waaheguru even for half a moment. (190)

lines.gurmukhi: Awx ^udwie pwk Swx rw pwk krd
lines.transliteration_english: aan khudhaae paak shaan raa paak karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The chaste Akaalpurakh transforms them into pure and holy beings,

lines.gurmukhi: gr ich ijsim Swx iz-muSiq ^wk krd ]191]
lines.transliteration_english: gar chih jisam shaan zi-mushath khaak karadh | 191 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though their body is made up of just a fistful of dust. (191)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx vjUid ^wk pwk Az Xwid aU-sq
lines.transliteration_english: een vajoodh khaak paak az yaadh oo-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: This human body made of dust becomes sacred with His remembrance;

lines.gurmukhi: zwx ik eySwx mzhir buinAwid aU-sq ]192]
lines.transliteration_english: zaan k eaeshaan mazehar buniaadh oo-sath | 192 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because it is the manifestation of the foundation (personality) bestowed by Akaalpurakh. (192)

lines.gurmukhi: rsim Swx AweIin idldwrI bvd
lines.transliteration_english: rasam shaan aaeen dhiladhaaree bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: It is their custom to remember the Almighty;

lines.gurmukhi: dr hmw hwl Az ^udw XwrI bvd ]193]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hamaa haal az khudhaa yaaree bavadh | 193 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it is their tradition to always generate love and devotion for Him. (193)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy rw kY nsIb eIx dOlq Asq
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae raa kai naseeb een dhaaualath asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: How can every one be blessed with such a treasure?'

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId AMdr suhbq Asq ]194]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath jaaveedh andhar suhabath asath | 194 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This non-perishable wealth is available only through their company. (194)

lines.gurmukhi: eIx hmw Az suhbiq mrdwin aUsq
lines.transliteration_english: een hamaa az suhabath maradhaan oosatha

Shabad OS N.translation: All these (material goods) are the result of the blessings of their company;

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq hr do jhwx dr Swin aUsq ]195]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath har dho jehaan dhar shaan oosath | 195 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the wealth of both the worlds is in their praise and honor. (195)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Swx n&IAw ibsIAwr Awvurd
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath shaan nafeeaa biseeaar aavuradha

Shabad OS N.translation: An association with them is extremely profitable;

lines.gurmukhi: n^il ijsim ^wk h?k bwr Awvurd ]196]
lines.transliteration_english: nakhal jisam khaak hak baar aavuradh | 196 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The date-palm of the body of dust brings in the fruit of Truth. (196)

lines.gurmukhi: hmcunIx suhbq kujw bwz Awiedq
lines.transliteration_english: hamachuneen suhabath kujaa baaz aaeidhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: When would you be able to run into such (an exalted) company?

lines.gurmukhi: kz brwey mrdmI mI-Swiedq ]197]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz baraaeae maradhamee mee-shaaeidhath | 197 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Such a blessed company will bestow upon you the humaneness. (197)

lines.gurmukhi: mrdmI XwAnI b-h?k pYvsqn Asq
lines.transliteration_english: maradhamee yaaanee ba-hak paivasathan asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The purpose of human life is (ultimately) to merge with the Creator;

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr izkrS Az hmw vw irsqn Asq ]198]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair zikarash az hamaa vaa risathan asath | 198 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Absence of His description and discourse is tantamount to breaking away from every one else. (198)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM idil bMdw bizkrS rwh Xw&q
lines.transliteration_english: choon dhil bandhaa bazikarash raah yaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: When a human being gets into the tradition of remembering Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: hwisil aumro idl Awgwwh Xw&q ]199]
lines.transliteration_english: haasil oumaro dhil aagaaaah yaafath | 199 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He becomes conversant with the attainment of both life and soul. (199)

lines.gurmukhi: kwrS Az grdUin grdwN dr gUzrq
lines.transliteration_english: kaarash az garadhoon garadhaa dhar goozaratha

Shabad OS N.translation: He will be redeemed and set free from the attachments of this revolving world when someone breaks away his connections from it;

lines.gurmukhi: br sir duinAw cU mrdW dr guzrq ]200]
lines.transliteration_english: bar sar dhuniaa choo maradhaa(n) dhar guzarath | 200 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, he would become detached from the material distractions like a seeker of spiritual knowledge. (200)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN jhwno AwN jhW qihsIN kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: ee jehaano aa jehaa(n) thehisee kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: He was applauded in both the worlds,

lines.gurmukhi: AwN ik idl Az izkir h?k rMgIN kunMd ]201]
lines.transliteration_english: aa k dhil az zikar hak rangee kunandh | 201 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When anyone imbued his heart and soul with the remembrance of Akaalpurakh. (201)

lines.gurmukhi: dr vjUdS AwPqwby qw&qw
lines.transliteration_english: dhar vajoodhash aafathaabae thaafathaa

Shabad OS N.translation: The body of such a person begins to radiate like the sun,

lines.gurmukhi: nwim h?k dr suhbiq SW Xw&qw ]202]
lines.transliteration_english: naam hak dhar suhabath shaa(n) yaafathaa | 202 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When he, in the company of saintly persons, has attained the real Truth. (202)

lines.gurmukhi: nwim h?k Az bsik rUzo Sb igR&q
lines.transliteration_english: naam hak az basak roozo shab grifatha

Shabad OS N.translation: He remembered the Naam of Akaalpurakh day and night,

lines.gurmukhi: dsiq aU rw izkir mOlw br-igR&q ]203]
lines.transliteration_english: dhasath oo raa zikar maaualaa bara-grifath | 203 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then only the discourses and praises of the Lord became his support. (203)

lines.gurmukhi: izkir mOlw AwN ik XwrI dwdw Sud
lines.transliteration_english: zikar maaualaa aa k yaaree dhaadhaa shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who has received the support of Akaalpurakh due to his meditation,

lines.gurmukhi: ^wnwie vIrW iz h?k Awbwdw Sud ]204]
lines.transliteration_english: khaanaae veeraa(n) z hak aabaadhaa shudh | 204 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Will have his deserted house, with the achievement of the Truth, rehabilitated and revived again. (204)

lines.gurmukhi: izkir mOlw dOlqy bwSd AzIm
lines.transliteration_english: zikar maaualaa dhaaualathae baashadh azeema

Shabad OS N.translation: Meditation of God is one great treasure;

lines.gurmukhi: kY bdsq Awied iz gMjo mwlo sIm ]205]
lines.transliteration_english: kai badhasath aaeidh z ganjo maalo seem | 205 |

Shabad OS N.translation: How can one obtain such a magnificent treasure from the worldly riches like wealth and silver? (205)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik h?k rw Kwsq h?k aU rw b^wsq
lines.transliteration_english: har k hak raa khaasath hak oo raa bakhaasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever developed a desire for (meeting with) the Lord, the Lord liked him;

lines.gurmukhi: SOoik mOlw ibhqrIin kImIAw-sq ]206]
lines.transliteration_english: shaauok maaualaa bihathareen keemeeaa-sath | 206 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The love and devotion for Akaalpurakh is the best cure-all panacea. (206)

lines.gurmukhi: gohir mksUd qn Xwid ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: gohar makasoodh than yaadh khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The deed of the main purpose of this body is only to remember Waaheguru;

lines.gurmukhi: lykn aU AMdr zubwin AOlIAw sq ]207]
lines.transliteration_english: laekan oo andhar zubaan aaualeeaa sath | 207 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, He always abides and manifests on the tongues of the noble souls. (207)

lines.gurmukhi: pwrsweI ibh ik bihir h?k bvd
lines.transliteration_english: paarasaaee bih k behir hak bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: That saintliness is really worthwhile if it is to seek the Truth;

lines.gurmukhi: bwdSwhI NcIsq kW nwh?k bvd ]208]
lines.transliteration_english: baadhashaahee acheesath kaa(n) naahak bavadh | 208 |

Shabad OS N.translation: What is the worth of that kingdom that is useless if it is not aiming towards God. (208)

lines.gurmukhi: hr do muSqwk AMd irMdo pwrsw
lines.transliteration_english: har dho mushathaak andh rindho paarasaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the drunk and the holy person are desirous of Him;

lines.gurmukhi: qw ikrw ^whd ^udwie ikbrIAw ]209]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa kiraa khaahadh khudhaae kibareeaa | 209 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Let us see! Whom does He, the transcendent Akaalpurakh likes?  (209)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw qwN bwSd brwie bMdgIsq
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa thaa baashadh baraae bandhageesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: A human being deserves to be called a human being only if he directs himself towards meditation;

lines.gurmukhi: gYr hri& h?k hmw SrimMdgIsq ]210]
lines.transliteration_english: gair haraf hak hamaa sharamindhageesath | 210|

Shabad OS N.translation: Without a description/word of Waaheguru, it is all humiliation. (210)

lines.gurmukhi: lyk dr zwihr ksy bwSd drusq
lines.transliteration_english: laek dhar zaahir kasae baashadh dharusatha

Shabad OS N.translation: However, it is apparent that only that person is on the right path,

lines.gurmukhi: AwN ik Awrd murSid kwiml bdsq ]211]
lines.transliteration_english: aa k aaradh murashadh kaamil badhasath | 211 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who has been able to attain (or attach himself to) a perfect Guru. (211)

lines.gurmukhi: dIno duinAw hr do &rmW-dwr aU
lines.transliteration_english: dheeno dhuniaa har dho faramaa(n)-dhaar oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the Faith and the world are in complete obedience to the Almighty;

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm Swieik dIdwir aU ]212]
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam shaaeik dheedhaar oo | 212 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the worlds are equally desirous to get just one glimpse of Him. (212)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik rw aul&q iz nwim h?k bvd
lines.transliteration_english: har k raa oulafath z naam hak bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who has developed deep love for the Naam of  Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq Awri& muqilk bvd ]213]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath aaraf muthalik bavadh | 213 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He becomes a perfect seeker of the divine knowledge in real terms. (213)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k rw qwilib aU mI kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak raa thaalib oo mee kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: Seekers of Waaheguru are (actively) involved in His meditation;

lines.gurmukhi: Awiri& h?k jumlw nyko mI kunMd ]214]
lines.transliteration_english: aarif hak jumalaa naeko mee kunandh | 214 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Seekers of Waaheguru transform everyone into something very attractive. (214)

lines.gurmukhi: h?k hmW bwSd ik bwSI bMdwie
lines.transliteration_english: hak hamaa(n) baashadh k baashee bandhaaei

Shabad OS N.translation: The truth is that you should (always strive to) become a person of God,

lines.gurmukhi: by-Adb dwiem z h?k SrmiMdwie ]215]
lines.transliteration_english: bae-adhab dhaaeim z hak sharamanidhaae | 215 |

Shabad OS N.translation: A disrespectful (apostate/atheist) person is always chagrined and ashamed before Him. (215)

lines.gurmukhi: aumr AwN bwSd ik aU dr Xwd r&q
lines.transliteration_english: oumar aa baashadh k oo dhar yaadh rafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Only that life is worth living that is spent in remembering Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: aumr nw bUd AwN ik brbwd r&q ]216]
lines.transliteration_english: oumar naa boodh aa k barabaadh rafath | 216 |

Shabad OS N.translation: What use is that life that is spent needlessly and in vain. (216)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw pYdw Sud brwey bMdgI
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa paidhaa shudh baraaeae bandhagee

Shabad OS N.translation: A person is born (only) to be engaged in meditation;

lines.gurmukhi: ^uS ielwjy hsq bihir bMdgI ]217]
lines.transliteration_english: khush eilaajae hasath behir bandhagee | 217 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, religious devotion (and prayers) is a good cure to put this life in the proper perspective. (217)

lines.gurmukhi: AY ^uSw cSmy ik dIdw rUie dUsq
lines.transliteration_english: ai khushaa chashamae k dheedhaa rooe dhoosatha

Shabad OS N.translation: How fortunate is that eye that has got a glimpse of the face of the Beloved!

lines.gurmukhi: mrduim cSim do Awlm sUie aU sq ]218]
lines.transliteration_english: maradhum chasham dho aalam sooe oo sath | 218 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Eyes of the people of both the worlds are fixed towards it. (218)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN jhwno AwN jhW Az h?k pur Asq
lines.transliteration_english: ee jehaano aa jehaa(n) az hak pur asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This and the other world are satiated with the Truth;

lines.gurmukhi: lyk mrid h?k b-Awlm kmqr Asq ]219]
lines.transliteration_english: laek maradh hak ba-aalam kamathar asath | 219 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But devoted men of God are rare in this world. (219)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy kU b-^udw hmrMg Sud
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae koo ba-khudhaa hamarang shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: If some one became indistinguishable with Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: vsi& aU dr mulik rUmo zMg Sud ]220]
lines.transliteration_english: vasaf oo dhar mulak roomo zang shudh | 220 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then his glory spreads in countries like Rome and Africa. (220)

lines.gurmukhi: mwAnIey XkrMgI Awmd SOik h?k
lines.transliteration_english: maaaneeeae yakarangee aamadh shaauak haka

Shabad OS N.translation: To get assimilated in the Entity of God is, in fact, real love for Him;

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw rw Awrwm AMdr zOik h?k ]221]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa raa aaraam andhar zaauak hak | 221 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it is only with a real devotion for Him that one gets eternal bliss. (221)

lines.gurmukhi: aU brMig swihbI bw ie?zo jwh
lines.transliteration_english: oo barang saahibee baa ezio jaaha

Shabad OS N.translation: Under the influence of Akaalpurakh, (Accepting the Will of Waaheguru)  he enjoys eclat and honors;

lines.gurmukhi: mw bwrMg bMdgI AMdr pnwh ]222]
lines.transliteration_english: maa baarang bandhagee andhar panaah | 222 |

Shabad OS N.translation: We, under the influence of meditation, have sought his (His) shelter and refuge. (222)

lines.gurmukhi: aU brMig swihib &rmW rvw
lines.transliteration_english: oo barang saahib faramaa(n) ravaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Accepting Waaheguru's Will, he is the king of the world and his command prevails all over;

lines.gurmukhi: mw brMig bMdgI inzdS gdw ]223]
lines.transliteration_english: maa barang bandhagee nizadhash gadhaa | 223 |

Shabad OS N.translation: We, under the influence of meditation, are just beggars before him. (223)

lines.gurmukhi: aU brMig swihbI dwrd nzr
lines.transliteration_english: oo barang saahibee dhaaradh nazara

Shabad OS N.translation: He, while imbued in accepting Master's Will, keeps a close watch on us;

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw rw Az bMdgI bwSd ^br ]224]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa raa az bandhagee baashadh khabar | 224 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, one can get to know him only through meditation. (224)

lines.gurmukhi: aumr hw joXwie eIN dOlq SudMd
lines.transliteration_english: oumar haa joyaae ee dhaaualath shudhandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They kept looking for such a treasure for ages;

lines.gurmukhi: swlhw muSqwik eIN suhbq SudMd ]225]
lines.transliteration_english: saalehaa mushathaak ee suhabath shudhandh | 225 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They were anxiously desirous of such a company for years. (225)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy rw z?rw zW bwSd nsIb
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae raa zaraa zaa(n) baashadh naseeba

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who was fortunate enough to attain even an atomic particle of such a wealth,

lines.gurmukhi: AwN b^UbI gSq ^urSIid njIb ]226]
lines.transliteration_english: aa bakhoobee gashath khurasheedh najeeb | 226 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He became an extraordinary sun easily and spontaneously. (226)

lines.gurmukhi: gYr aU XwAnI iz h?k g&lq bvd
lines.transliteration_english: gair oo yaaanee z hak gafalath bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The underlying meaning of living without the memory of Waaheguru is complete ignorance and naivety.

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU srmwXwie dOlq bvd ]227]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo saramaayaae dhaaualath bavadh | 227 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The valuable asset of the remembrance of Akaalpurakh becomes the treasure of some fortunate beings. (227)

lines.gurmukhi: dIdin h?k qw muX?sr mI-Svd
lines.transliteration_english: dheedhan hak thaa muyasar mee-shavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: One can get a glimpse of the Omnipotent only

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdW qAsur mI-Svd ]228]
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath maradhaa(n) thaasur mee-shavadh | 228 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When one's association with noble saints become fruitful. (228)

lines.gurmukhi: hri& h?k dr idl Agr mwvw kund
lines.transliteration_english: haraf hak dhar dhil agar maavaa kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: If someone can abide even one word of Truth in his heart,

lines.gurmukhi: dr buin hr mUie aU h?k jw kund ]229]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar bun har mooe oo hak jaa kunadh | 229 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, Truth but nothing but the Truth gets assimilated to the roots of each of his hair. (229)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik ^ud rw sUie h?k mI-AwdrS
lines.transliteration_english: har k khudh raa sooe hak mee-aadharasha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who can direct himself towards the divine path of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: Az rui^ aU nUir-h?k mI-bwrdS ]230]
lines.transliteration_english: az rukh oo noori-hak mee-baaradhash | 230 |

Shabad OS N.translation: God's glory and splendor radiates from his face. (230)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN hmw &Yj Az qu&Yil suhbq Asq
lines.transliteration_english: ee hamaa faij az thufail suhabath asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: All this benevolence and benignity is because of them and their blessings,

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdwin h?k ^uS dOlq Asq ]231]
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath maradhaan hak khush dhaaualath asath | 231 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The company of saintly persons (of God) is one priceless asset. (231)

lines.gurmukhi: hIc ks Az hwil SW Awgwh nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: heech kas az haal shaa(n) aagaah neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: No one really understands or appreciates the state of mind of these noble royalties;

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik E imh rw drWjw rwh nIsq ]232]
lines.transliteration_english: har k ou mih raa dharaa(n)jaa raah neesath | 232 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Every Tom, Dick or Harry does not have the wherewithal to reach there (them). (232)

lines.gurmukhi: dr nzr AwieMd cUM zwiq A?lwh
lines.transliteration_english: dhar nazar aaeindh choon zaath alaaha

Shabad OS N.translation: In appearance, they look just like an embodiment of the specie of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq hr do Awlm Apnwh ]233]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath har dho aalam apanaah | 233 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In reality, they are the refuge for everyone in both the worlds. (233)

lines.gurmukhi: dr ksb bwSMd Awzwd Az ksb
lines.transliteration_english: dhar kasab baashandh aazaadh az kasaba

Shabad OS N.translation: While engaged in their professions or trades, they are still unattached and unduly engrossed in them;

lines.gurmukhi: aumr guzrwnMd AMdr Xwid r?b ]234]
lines.transliteration_english: oumar guzaraanandh andhar yaadh rab | 234 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They spend their lives in remembering the Provident (day and night). (234)

lines.gurmukhi: ^yS rw cUM mUr ibSnwsMd SW
lines.transliteration_english: khaesh raa choon moor bishanaasandh shaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: They, the noble souls, consider themselves (out of humility) just like an ant,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq ibhqr Az pIil dmW ]235]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath bihathar az peel dhamaa(n) | 235 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though they, in fact, might be more powerful than a ferocious and dangerous elephant. (235)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ic mI-bInI hmw hYrwin SwN
lines.transliteration_english: har ch mee-beenee hamaa hairaan shaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever you are seeing in this world is simply astonished and confounded about them;

lines.gurmukhi: Swin SW ibhqr bvd Az iemiqhW ]236]
lines.transliteration_english: shaan shaa(n) bihathar bavadh az eimathihaa(n) | 236 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Their splendor and aura is far superior than even that of the examinations. (236)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdwin h?k bwSd krm
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath maradhaan hak baashadh karama

Shabad OS N.translation: The company of the true devotees of Waaheguru is a great boon;

lines.gurmukhi: dOlqy kAwN rw nBbwSd hIc Zm ]237]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualathae kaaa raa nabhabaashadh heech gham | 237 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Such a wealth and virtuosity does not suffer from any anxiety or grief. (237)

lines.gurmukhi: ^ud bzurgo hr ksy SW inSsq
lines.transliteration_english: khudh bazurago har kasae shaa(n) nishasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: They, themselves, are elevated, mature and blessed; anyone who happens to  be bestowed with their company;

lines.gurmukhi: aU bzurgI Xw&q qW hr jw ik hsq ]238]
lines.transliteration_english: oo bazuragee yaafath thaa(n) har jaa k hasath | 238 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He, too, becomes elevated, mature and blessed, and receives laurels everywhere. (238)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy kU ^yS rw ibSnw^qw
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae koo khaesh raa bishanaakhathaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who has recognized his own reality;

lines.gurmukhi: dr qrIik bMdgI prdw^qw ]239]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar thareek bandhagee paradhaakhathaa | 239 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Consider that he has adopted the mode or the method of meditation. (239)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN zmIno AwsmW pur Az ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: ee zameeno aasamaa(n) pur az khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: This earth and the skies are saturated with (the creations of ) God,

lines.gurmukhi: Awlmy hr sU dvW kAwN Sih kujw-sq ]240]
lines.transliteration_english: aalamae har soo dhavaa(n) kaaa shehi kujaa-sath | 240 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But this world keeps wandering and straying in all directions to find out as to where He is. (240)

lines.gurmukhi: dIdw br dIdwir h?k gr mubqlw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: dheedhaa bar dheedhaar hak gar mubathalaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can aim your eyes fixedly on a glimpse of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich mI bInI bcSmq h?k-numw-sq ]241]
lines.transliteration_english: har chih mee beenee bachashamath haka-numaa-sath | 241 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, whatever you see will be a vision of the Almighty Waaheguru. (241)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik SW rw dId h?k rw dIdw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: har k shaa(n) raa dheedh hak raa dheedhaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who has seen that noble soul, consider that he has got a glimpse of the Omnipotent;

lines.gurmukhi: aU qrIik bMdgI &ihmIdw Asq ]242]
lines.transliteration_english: oo thareek bandhagee fehimeedhaa asath | 242 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, that person has perceived and realized the path of meditation. (242)

lines.gurmukhi: qriz X?k-rMgI Ajb rMg AwrdS
lines.transliteration_english: tharaz yaka-rangee ajab rang aaradhasha

Shabad OS N.translation: The focus on devotion for God brings in with it an unusual complexion of disposition,

lines.gurmukhi: kz bdn nUir ^udw mI-bwrdS ]243]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz badhan noor khudhaa mee-baaradhash | 243 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The splendor and radiance of Akaalpurakh then oozes out from each and every aspect of such a dedicated devotion. (243)

lines.gurmukhi: aU brMig swihbI eIN hsqo bUd
lines.transliteration_english: oo barang saahibee ee hasatho boodha

Shabad OS N.translation: He is the Master of all this illusion (of materialism), this is His own form;

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI dwiem b-Awdwb sjUd ]244]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee dhaaeim ba-aadhaab sajoodh | 244 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, His meditation, with respect and prostrations, always seems apt. (244)

lines.gurmukhi: aU brMig swihbI ArSwid aU
lines.transliteration_english: oo barang saahibee arashaadh oo

Shabad OS N.translation: He is the shape and form of the Master and only His command prevails;

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI qw sr kdm bubXwid aU ]245]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee thaa sar kadham bubayaadh oo | 245 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The meditation from head to toe also emerges out of (because of) Him. (245)

lines.gurmukhi: swihby bw swihbW zybd mudwm
lines.transliteration_english: saahibae baa saahibaa(n) zaebadh mudhaama

Shabad OS N.translation: A Master looks graceful and befitting only among the Masters,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw rw dr bMdgI bwSd ikAwm ]246]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa raa dhar bandhagee baashadh kiaam | 246 |

Shabad OS N.translation: A person should, therefore, continue to stay in meditation all the times. (246)

lines.gurmukhi: swihbW rw swihbI bwSd SuAwr
lines.transliteration_english: saahibaa(n) raa saahibee baashadh shuaara

Shabad OS N.translation: The character of Masters is to be master-like,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw rw dr bMdgI &sil bhwr ]247]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa raa dhar bandhagee fasal behaar | 247 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, a man has the spring season around him only when he meditates. (247)

lines.gurmukhi: swihbW rw swihbI dwiem bvd
lines.transliteration_english: saahibaa(n) raa saahibee dhaaeim bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The master-ship character, His praises, of the Master is eternal,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw hm dr bMdgI kwiem bvd ]248]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa ham dhar bandhagee kaaeim bavadh | 248 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the meditation of a human being is permanent. (248)

lines.gurmukhi: Az brwie AwN ik qU sr-gSqweI
lines.transliteration_english: az baraae aa k thoo sara-gashathaaee

Shabad OS N.translation: For this, you have turned your head away from Him, you have strayed;

lines.gurmukhi: Az pey duinAw iz h?k br-gSqweI ]249]
lines.transliteration_english: az peae dhuniaa z hak bara-gashathaaee | 249 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That you have turned your face away from Him just for the sake of this material  world. (249)

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq gIqI n bwSd pwiedwr
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath geethee n baashadh paaeidhaara

Shabad OS N.translation: The worldly riches are not going to last for ever,

lines.gurmukhi: X?k n&s ^ud rw bsUie h?k ibAwr ]250]
lines.transliteration_english: yak nafas khudh raa basooe hak biaar | 250 |

Shabad OS N.translation: (Therefore) You should turn yourself towards Waaheguru even for just one moment. (250)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM idil qU mwieil Xwid ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: choon dhil thoo maaeil yaadh khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: When your heart and soul becomes inclined towards remembering Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: AwN ^udwie pwk kY Az qU judw-sq ]251]
lines.transliteration_english: aa khudhaae paak kai az thoo judhaa-sath | 251 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, how and when would that pious and chaste Waaheguru be separated from you? (251)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qU Zwi&l-bwSI Az i&kir bulMd
lines.transliteration_english: gar thoo ghaafila-baashee az fikar bulandha

Shabad OS N.translation: If you remain negligent about paying close attention to the remembrance of lofty Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: qU kujw E aU kujw AY hoSmMd ]252]
lines.transliteration_english: thoo kujaa ou oo kujaa ai hoshamandh | 252 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you mentally alert person! How can there be a meeting between you and Him (You are here and He is somewhere else)? (252)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU drid do Awlm rw dvw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo dharadh dho aalam raa dhavaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: Memory of Waaheguru is the cure-all for all pains and agonies of both the worlds;

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU hr gum-Sudw rw rwhnumw sq ]253]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo har guma-shudhaa raa raahanumaa sath | 253 |

Shabad OS N.translation: His memory also directs all lost and strayed ones to the correct path. (253)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU eIN jumlw rw lwzm bvd
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo ee jumalaa raa laazam bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: His remembrance is absolutely imperative for everyone,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik Zwi&l Sud Azo mulzm Svd ]254]
lines.transliteration_english: har k ghaafil shudh azo mulazam shavadh | 254 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, anyone who becomes negligent and forgets Him is indeed guilty. (254)

lines.gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI bMdw rw qO&Ik idh
lines.transliteration_english: yaa eilaahee bandhaa raa thaauafeek dhiha

Shabad OS N.translation: O Akaalpurakh ! Kindly bless me with such a courage and strength,

lines.gurmukhi: qw b-Xwdq ibguzrd eIN aumr ibh ]255]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa ba-yaadhath biguzaradh ee oumar bih | 255 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that this life of mine is spent in a worthwhile manner in remembering You. (255)

lines.gurmukhi: aumr AwN bwSd ik dr Xwid ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: oumar aa baashadh k dhar yaadh khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: That life is worth living that is spent in remembering Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: ibguzrd dIgr nBbwSd mudAw ]256]
lines.transliteration_english: biguzaradh dheegar nabhabaashadh mudhaaa | 256 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Any part of it spent without His memory, is simply a waste and useless. (256)

lines.gurmukhi: mudAw ibhqr juz Xwd nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: mudhaaa bihathar juz yaadh neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: There is no purpose (of life) better than the remembrance of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr XwdS eIN idil mw Swd nIsq ]257]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair yaadhash ee dhil maa shaadh neesath | 257 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, our hearts and minds can never be pleased without remembering Him. (257)

lines.gurmukhi: SwdIie dwiem bvd Xwid ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: shaadheee dhaaeim bavadh yaadh khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: The nostalgia about Waaheguru bestows upon us an eternal elation;

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy dOlq ik bwSd rwhnumw ]258]
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae dhaaualath k baashadh raahanumaa | 258 |

Shabad OS N.translation: How fortunate we are that it shows us the direction (in our lives)!(258)

lines.gurmukhi: gr ic h?k dr jumlwie idlhw bvd
lines.transliteration_english: gar ch hak dhar jumalaae dhilehaa bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though Akaalpurakh abides in the hearts of everyone,

lines.gurmukhi: lyk Awir& swihib eImW bvd ]259]
lines.transliteration_english: laek aarif saahib eemaa(n) bavadh | 259 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Still, only an enlightened persons can be called 'a man of faith and religion'. (259)

lines.gurmukhi: cSim Awir& kwbil dIdwr hsq
lines.transliteration_english: chasham aarif kaabal dheedhaar hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Only the eye of an enlightened person deserves a glimpse of the Almighty;

lines.gurmukhi: mrid AwirP vwiki& Asrwr hsq ]260]
lines.transliteration_english: maradh aarif vaakif asaraar hasath | 260 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it is only the heart of a knowledgeable person who is familiar with His mysteries. (260)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq mrdwin h?k rw dUsq dwr
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath maradhaan hak raa dhoosath dhaara

Shabad OS N.translation: You should develop friendship with the noble souls and should keep their company;

lines.gurmukhi: qw qU hm grdI iz XmnS rusqgwr ]261]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa thoo ham garadhee z yamanash rusathagaar | 261 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that, with the Providential blessings, you may be redeemed from the cycles of transmigration. (261)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich hsq Az suhbiq eISW bvd
lines.transliteration_english: har chih hasath az suhabath eeshaa(n) bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever is visible in this world is all due to company of saintly persons;

lines.gurmukhi: zW ik ijsmo jw srwpw jW bvd ]262]
lines.transliteration_english: zaa(n) k jisamo jaa saraapaa jaa(n) bavadh | 262 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because our bodies and souls are, in fact, the soul of the Provident. (262)

lines.gurmukhi: murdumwin dIdw roSn Sud Azo
lines.transliteration_english: muradhumaan dheedhaa roshan shudh azo

Shabad OS N.translation: The pupils of my eyes are fully lighted only because of their company;

lines.gurmukhi: ^wik ijsmm jumlw gulSn Sud Azo ]263]
lines.transliteration_english: khaak jisamam jumalaa gulashan shudh azo | 263 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the dirt of my body, for the same reason, is transformed into a lush garden. (263)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy shubq ik ^wk AksIr krd
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae sahubath k khaak akaseer karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Blessed is that association that has transformed a dirt into a cure-all;

lines.gurmukhi: nwksy rw swihib qdbIr krd ]264]
lines.transliteration_english: naakasae raa saahib thadhabeer karadh | 264 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, converted every lowly uniformed person into knowledgeable and intelligent. (264)

lines.gurmukhi: gohro lwlo jvwhr pyiS SW
lines.transliteration_english: goharo laalo javaahar paesh shaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: I present myself in the form of pearls, rubies and gems to my Beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: hr dmy kU ibguzrd dr Xwid AW ]265]
lines.transliteration_english: har dhamae koo biguzaradh dhar yaadh aaa(n) | 265 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When I spend every moment of my life in His memory. (265)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN jvwhr-hw hmw &wnI bvd
lines.transliteration_english: ee javaahara-haa hamaa faanee bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: All these worldly diamonds and pearls are perishable;

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k br bMdw ArzwnI bvd ]266]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak bar bandhaa arazaanee bavadh | 266 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The remembrance of Waaheguru, however, is extremely valuable for a human being. (266)

lines.gurmukhi: rsim mrdwin ^udw dwnI ik cIsq
lines.transliteration_english: rasam maradhaan khudhaa dhaanee k cheesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Do you know what is the custom and tradition of the devotees of Omnipotent?

lines.gurmukhi: &wirZ AMd Az kYdhwie mrjo zIsq ]267]
lines.transliteration_english: faarigh andh az kaidhehaae marajo zeesath | 267 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They are redeemed and are free from the imprisonment of the cycles of births and deaths for ever. (267)

lines.gurmukhi: X?k n&s by Xwid h?k nBguzwSqMd
lines.transliteration_english: yak nafas bae yaadh hak nabhaguzaashathandha

Shabad OS N.translation: They do not spend even one moment without remembering Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: ^uS Awlm br nhu qbk APrwSqMd ]268]
lines.transliteration_english: khush aalam bar nahu thabak afaraashathandh | 268 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They unfurl their beautiful flag (of meditation) over all the nine skies. (268)

lines.gurmukhi: ^Yr^wih julgI pYdwieS AMd
lines.transliteration_english: khairakhaahi julagee paidhaaeish andha

Shabad OS N.translation: They wish and pray for the well-being of the entire created world,

lines.gurmukhi: zyb b^iS eIN hmw AwrwieS AMd ]269]
lines.transliteration_english: zaeb bakhash ee hamaa aaraaeish andh | 269 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is them who bless all these creations and natural beauties with grace and elegance. (269)

lines.gurmukhi: nwim h?k mrdwin h?k rw zyvr Asq
lines.transliteration_english: naam hak maradhaan hak raa zaevar asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The Naam of Waaheguru is an ornament for His noble and saintly devotees,

lines.gurmukhi: cSim SW Az nUir h?k pur gOhr Asq ]270]
lines.transliteration_english: chasham shaa(n) az noor hak pur gaauehar asath | 270 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the eye of these nobilities is always full of pearls and gems because of the refulgent glow of the Almighty. (270)

lines.gurmukhi: hri& SW qwAlIim aumir jwivdW
lines.transliteration_english: haraf shaa(n) thaaaleem oumar jaavidhaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Their words are a lessons for a permanent life,

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k dwrMd dwiem br zubW ]271]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak dhaarandh dhaaeim bar zubaa(n) | 271 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the memory of Akaalpurakh abides on their lips/tongue for ever. (271)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich mIgoieMd ArSwdsqo bs
lines.transliteration_english: har chih meegoeindh arashaadhasatho basa

Shabad OS N.translation: Their utterances have the status of the words of Divine,

lines.gurmukhi: br nmI AwrMd ZYr Az h?k n&s ]272]
lines.transliteration_english: bar namee aarandh ghair az hak nafas | 272 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, not even one breath of theirs is spent without remembering Him. (272)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN hmw muSqwik dIdwir ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: ee hamaa mushathaak dheedhaar khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: All these saintly persons are really seekers of a Divine glimpse,

lines.gurmukhi: bosqwin dihr gulzwir ^udw-sq ]273]
lines.transliteration_english: bosathaan dhehir gulazaar khudhaa-sath | 273 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, this delightful worldly spread is, in fact, a heavenly flower bed. (273)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik bw-mrdwin h?k Sud AwSnw
lines.transliteration_english: har k baa-maradhaan hak shudh aashanaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever developed a friendship with the devotees of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: swieAwie aU ibhqr Az bwil humw ]274]
lines.transliteration_english: saaeiaae oo bihathar az baal humaa | 274 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Take it that his shadow (on them) will be many times more blessed than the shadow of the feathers of  the Humaa bird (It is said that a shadow of Humaa bird can bestow the kingdom of the world). (274)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k XwAnI iz ^ud ibZuzSqn Asq
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak yaaanee z khudh bighuzashathan asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: We should take it that getting absorbed in Waaheguru's meditation is to give up self-ego,

lines.gurmukhi: Az i^Awil ZYir h?k vwrusqn Asq ]275]
lines.transliteration_english: az khiaal ghair hak vaarusathan asath | 275 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, not thinking about Him would get us stuck in every other worldly attraction. (275)

lines.gurmukhi: rsqgI Az ^ySqn vwrsqgI-sq
lines.transliteration_english: rasathagee az khaeshathan vaarasathagee-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: To redeem ourselves from our egos is the real emancipation,

lines.gurmukhi: bw ^udwie ^ySqn idl-bsqgI-sq ]276]
lines.transliteration_english: baa khudhaae khaeshathan dhila-basathagee-sath | 276 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, to tie up our minds with Waaheguru's devotion is also real deliverance. (276)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ks kU bw ^udw idl bsqw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: har kas koo baa khudhaa dhil basathaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever has linked and attached his mind to the Almighty,

lines.gurmukhi: aU z cri^ nhu qbk br-jsqw Asq ]277]
lines.transliteration_english: oo z charakh nahu thabak bara-jasathaa asath | 277 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Take it that he has easily leaped over a sky equipped even with nine locks. (277)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq idl-bsqgwin bw ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath dhila-basathagaan baa khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: The company of such God-attached devotees,

lines.gurmukhi: kY muX?sr Awiedq eIN kImIAw ]278]
lines.transliteration_english: kai muyasar aaeidhath ee keemeeaa | 278 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Take it that it is the cure-all; however, how can we be fortunate enough to obtain it? (278)

lines.gurmukhi: dIno duinAw hr do hYrW mWdw AMd
lines.transliteration_english: dheeno dhuniaa har dho hairaa(n) maa(n)dhaa andha

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the faith and the religion are amazed,

lines.gurmukhi: bs z hYrwnI pRISW mWdw AMd ]279]
lines.transliteration_english: bas z hairaanee preeshaa(n) maa(n)dhaa andh | 279 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And in this amazement beyond limits they are perplexed. (279)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ikh rw eIN AwrzUey pwk hsq
lines.transliteration_english: har kih raa ee aarazooeae paak hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever imbibes such a chaste and divine desire,

lines.gurmukhi: murSid aU swihib Adrwk hsq ]280]
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh oo saahib adharaak hasath | 280 |

Shabad OS N.translation: His Guru (teacher) is the master of innate and intrinsic knowledge. (280)

lines.gurmukhi: vwislwin-h?k qurw vwisl kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: vaasilaani-hak thuraa vaasil kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: God connected noble saints can make your connection with Him,

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId rw hwisl kunMd ]281]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath jaaveedh raa haasil kunandh | 281 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They can also help you to obtain the eternal treasure, the Naam. (281)

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId pyiS Awir& Asq
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath jaaveedh paesh aarif asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This is an immortal achievement for an enlightened person,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN s^un mShUr bs muqAwir& Asq ]282]
lines.transliteration_english: ee sakhun mashehoor bas muthaaarif asath | 282 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This adage is commonly well known, and everyone is well acquainted with it. (282)

lines.gurmukhi: Awir&wno kwimlwno vwislW
lines.transliteration_english: aarifaano kaamilaano vaasilaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: The enlightened, perfect and submerged into the love of God devotees;

lines.gurmukhi: nwim aU dwrd dwiem br zubW ]283]
lines.transliteration_english: naam oo dhaaradh dhaaeim bar zubaa(n) | 283 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They always have His Naam on their tongues and lips in meditation. (283)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgIie SW bvd izkir ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: bandhageee shaa(n) bavadh zikar khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: To continually meditate on His Naam is their worship;

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId bwSd h?k-numw ]284]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath jaaveedh baashadh haka-numaa | 284 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the eternal treasure blessed by Akaalpurakh directs one towards His path. (284)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM numwied dOliq jwvId rU
lines.transliteration_english: choon numaaeidh dhaaualath jaaveedh roo

Shabad OS N.translation: When the divine eternal treasure shows Its face,

lines.gurmukhi: qU z h?k bwSI vw h?k bwSd z qU ]285]
lines.transliteration_english: thoo z hak baashee vaa hak baashadh z thoo | 285 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You would then belong to Waaheguru and He would belong to you. (285)

lines.gurmukhi: br idlq gr prqvy h?k br&gMd
lines.transliteration_english: bar dhilath gar parathavae hak barafagandha

Shabad OS N.translation: If the shadow of Akaalpurakh falls on someone's heart and soul,

lines.gurmukhi: ^wir ihjrq rw z pwie idl kunMd ]286]
lines.transliteration_english: khaar hijarath raa z paae dhil kunandh | 286 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then take it that the painful thorn of separation has been extracted out of the foot (depth) of our mind. (286)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wir ihjr Az pwie idl cUM dUr Sud
lines.transliteration_english: khaar hijar az paae dhil choon dhoor shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: When the thorn of separation has been removed from the feet of the heart,

lines.gurmukhi: ^wnwie idl Az ^udw mwmUr Sud ]287]
lines.transliteration_english: khaanaae dhil az khudhaa maamoor shudh | 287 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Take it then that the Akaalpurakh has made the temple of our heart as His abode. (287)

lines.gurmukhi: hmcU kqrw kU bdirAw dr &qwd
lines.transliteration_english: hamachoo katharaa koo badhariaa dhar fathaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Like that drop of water that fell into a river or ocean, giving up its own identity (showing humility),

lines.gurmukhi: AYn dirAw gSqo vslS dsqdwd ]288]
lines.transliteration_english: ain dhariaa gashatho vasalash dhasathadhaadh | 288 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It itself became the river and the ocean; (thus falling on the feet of Aakaalpurakh), and convergence with Him took place. (288)

lines.gurmukhi: kqrw cUM Sud bdirAw AwSnw
lines.transliteration_english: katharaa choon shudh badhariaa aashanaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Once the drop merges into the ocean,

lines.gurmukhi: bwAd AzW q&rIk nqvW Sud z jw ]289]
lines.transliteration_english: baaadh azaa(n) thafareek nathavaa(n) shudh z jaa | 289 |

Shabad OS N.translation: After that, it cannot be separated from the ocean. (289)

lines.gurmukhi: kqrw cUM jwinib dirAw Sqw&q
lines.transliteration_english: katharaa choon jaanib dhariaa shathaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: When the drop started to rush in the direction of the ocean,

lines.gurmukhi: Az rih q&rIk ^ud rw kqrw Xw&q ]290]
lines.transliteration_english: az rehi thafareek khudh raa katharaa yaafath | 290 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It, then, realized the significance of being just a drop of water. (290)

lines.gurmukhi: kqrw rw eIN dOliq cUM dsqdwd
lines.transliteration_english: katharaa raa ee dhaaualath choon dhasathadhaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: When the drop was bestowed with this eternal meeting,

lines.gurmukhi: kqrw Sud AMdr hkIkq bw-murwd ]291]
lines.transliteration_english: katharaa shudh andhar hakeekath baa-muraadh | 291 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The reality dawned on it, and its long-cherished desire was fulfilled. (291)

lines.gurmukhi: gu&q mn X?k kqrw AwbI bUdw Am
lines.transliteration_english: gufath man yak katharaa aabee boodhaa ama

Shabad OS N.translation: The droplet said, Even though I am a small drop of water,

lines.gurmukhi: pYhin dirAw rw cunW pYmUdw Am ]292]
lines.transliteration_english: paihan dhariaa raa chunaa(n) paimoodhaa am | 292 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I have been able to measure the expanse of this huge ocean. (292)

lines.gurmukhi: gr mrw dr bwz rwih luqi& ^yS
lines.transliteration_english: gar maraa dhar baaz raahi luthaf khaesha

Shabad OS N.translation: If the ocean, out of its extreme kindness, would agree to take me in,

lines.gurmukhi: vwisl ^ud krd Az AMdwzw byS ]293]
lines.transliteration_english: vaasil khudh karadh az andhaazaa baesh | 293 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it agreed to merge me into itself even beyond its capacity; (293)

lines.gurmukhi: hmcU mOj Az pYhin dirAw rU nmUd
lines.transliteration_english: hamachoo maauaj az paihan dhariaa roo namoodha

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it rose like a tidal wave out of the span of the ocean,

lines.gurmukhi: mOj gSq vw krd dirAw rw sjUd ]294]
lines.transliteration_english: maauaj gashath vaa karadh dhariaa raa sajoodh | 294 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It became another wave, and then bowed in reverence to the ocean. (294)

lines.gurmukhi: hm cunW hr bMdw ku vwisl Asq
lines.transliteration_english: ham chunaa(n) har bandhaa k vaasil asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: In the same manner, every such person who had a confluence with the Almighty,

lines.gurmukhi: dr qrIik bMdgI bs kwiml Asq ]295]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar thareek bandhagee bas kaamil asath | 295 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Became complete and perfect on the path of meditation. (295)

lines.gurmukhi: mOjO dirAw gr ic dr mwAnI Xkysq
lines.transliteration_english: maauajaau dhariaa gar ch dhar maaanee yakaesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: In reality, a wave and the ocean are one and the same,

lines.gurmukhi: lyk AMdr eIno AwN &rky bsysq ]296]
lines.transliteration_english: laek andhar eeno aa farakae basaesath | 296 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But still there is a vast difference between them. (296)

lines.gurmukhi: mn Xky mOjm qU bihir bykrW
lines.transliteration_english: man yakae maauajam thoo behir baekaraa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: I am just a simple wave, while you are an enormously large ocean,

lines.gurmukhi: &rk bwSd Az zmIno AwsmW ]297]
lines.transliteration_english: farak baashadh az zameeno aasamaa(n) | 297 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Thus, there is a big difference between you and me like that between the earth and the sky. (297)

lines.gurmukhi: mn nIA?m eIN jumlw Az Alqwi& qU
lines.transliteration_english: man neeam ee jumalaa az alathaaf thoo

Shabad OS N.translation: I am nothing; all this (that I am) is only because of your blessings,

lines.gurmukhi: mn X?k mOjm z qbAwie swi& qU ]298]
lines.transliteration_english: man yak maauajam z thabaaae saaf thoo | 298 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I am, too, one wave in Your vast manifest world. (298)

lines.gurmukhi: bw bzurgW suhbqy mI bwiedq
lines.transliteration_english: baa bazuragaa(n) suhabathae mee baaeidhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: You would need the association with the noble persons,

lines.gurmukhi: Az humw A?vl hmIN mI bwiedq ]299]
lines.transliteration_english: az humaa aval hamee mee baaeidhath | 299 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This will be the first and the foremost thing that you will need. (299)

lines.gurmukhi: kwdir muqilk bkudrq zwihr Asq
lines.transliteration_english: kaadhar muthalik bakudharath zaahir asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: That perfect and complete Creator is visible through His own creations,

lines.gurmukhi: drimAwin kudriq ^ud kwdr Asq ]300]
lines.transliteration_english: dharamiaan kudharath khudh kaadhar asath | 300 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The Creator, in fact, abides amidst His own Nature and manifestations. (300)

lines.gurmukhi: kwdro kudrq bhm Awmy^qMd
lines.transliteration_english: kaadharo kudharath beham aamaekhathandha

Shabad OS N.translation: The Creator and His creations are one and the same,

lines.gurmukhi: AwN mqwie ZYr h?k rw ry^qMd ]301]
lines.transliteration_english: aa mathaae ghair hak raa raekhathandh | 301 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They, the noble persons, renounce all material distractions except the Provident. (301)

lines.gurmukhi: ps qurw hm bwied AY Xwir AzIz
lines.transliteration_english: pas thuraa ham baaeidh ai yaar azeeza

Shabad OS N.translation: O my dear friend! Then you should also make a judgement and conclude,

lines.gurmukhi: h?k kudwm vw qU kudwmI kun qmIz ]302]
lines.transliteration_english: hak kudhaam vaa thoo kudhaamee kun thameez | 302 |

Shabad OS N.translation: As to who is God, and who you are, and how to distinguish between the two. (302)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qU vwisl gSqweI dr zwiq aU
lines.transliteration_english: gar thoo vaasil gashathaaee dhar zaath oo

Shabad OS N.translation: If, in your pursuits, you happen to have a meeting with the Akaalpurakh.

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr hri& bMdgI dIgr mgU ]303]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair haraf bandhagee dheegar magoo | 303 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then you should not utter any other word except the word of worship and meditation. (303)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN hmw Az dOliq eIN bMdgIsq
lines.transliteration_english: ee hamaa az dhaaualath ee bandhageesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: All this tangible and non-tangible boons are because of the meditation,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI by-bMdgI SrimMdgisq ]304]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee bae-bandhagee sharamindhagasith | 304 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Without meditation, this life of ours is only mortification and humiliation. (304)

lines.gurmukhi: h?k qwAlw bMdgI &rmUdw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: hak thaaalaa bandhagee faramoodhaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The Almighty God has also said,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy kU bMdw Sud AwsUdw Asq ]305]
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae koo bandhaa shudh aasoodhaa asath | 305 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who transformed himself into a man of God is redeemed. (305)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM AnAlh?k br zubW iezhwr krd
lines.transliteration_english: choon anaalehak bar zubaa(n) eizehaar karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who proclaimed through his own mouth that he was God,

lines.gurmukhi: SrAw AwN mnsUr rw br-dwr krd ]306]
lines.transliteration_english: sharaaa aa manasoor raa bara-dhaar karadh | 306 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The Islamic religious law crucified him just like Mansoor. (306)

lines.gurmukhi: msqIey h?k mwAnIie huiSAwrI Asq
lines.transliteration_english: masatheeeae hak maaaneee hushiaaree asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Inebriated with God is, in fact, to be always in a state of alertness,

lines.gurmukhi: Awir&W rw ^wb hm bydwrI Asq ]307]
lines.transliteration_english: aarifaa(n) raa khaab ham baedhaaree asath | 307 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Even dreaming while asleep for the knowledgeable is indeed like staying awake. (307)

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq by-Adb Xwbd szw
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath bae-adhab yaabadh sazaa

Shabad OS N.translation: In reality, a disrespectful faces the consequences (reaps the fruits) of his own actions,

lines.gurmukhi: cUM Awdb Amd hmw rw rhwnumw ]308]
lines.transliteration_english: choon aadhab amadh hamaa raa rehaanumaa | 308 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, it is the 'respect' and 'civility' that is capable of showing all the direction of the right path. (308)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qU sr qw pw hmw h?k gSqweI
lines.transliteration_english: gar thoo sar thaa paa hamaa hak gashathaaee

Shabad OS N.translation: If you have transformed yourself from head to toe into Akaalpurakh's form,

lines.gurmukhi: vwisil by-cUin muqilk gSqweI ]309]
lines.transliteration_english: vaasil bae-choon muthalik gashathaaee | 309 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, If you have merged into that unparalleled and matchless Waaheguru, (309)

lines.gurmukhi: bwz rwih bMdgI dr pyS gIr
lines.transliteration_english: baaz raahi bandhagee dhar paesh geera

Shabad OS N.translation: Then you should adopt the path of meditation,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdwie aU bwS vw rwih KyS gIr ]310]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaae oo baash vaa raahi khaesh geer | 310 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, become His (favorite) person by holding on to the divine spiritual  passage  of meditation. (310)

lines.gurmukhi: dr hmw hwlq ^udw hwzr bbIN
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hamaa haalath khudhaa haazar babee

Shabad OS N.translation: One should assume His presence under all circumstances,

lines.gurmukhi: hwizro nwizr hmwN nwizr bbIN ]311]
lines.transliteration_english: haaziro naazir hamaa naazir babee | 311 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Considering Him Omnipresent and Immanent, and also take it that He is capable of seeing everything everywhere. (311)

lines.gurmukhi: dr rwih h?k juz Adb qwAlIm nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: dhar raahi hak juz adhab thaaaleem neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: There is no education except that of respect and civility in the path of God,

lines.gurmukhi: qwilib aU rw bjuz qslIm nIsq ]312]
lines.transliteration_english: thaalib oo raa bajuz thasaleem neesath | 312 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is not prudent for His seeker-devotee to accept anything but His Order. (312)

lines.gurmukhi: qwilbwin h?k hmySw bw Adb
lines.transliteration_english: thaalibaan hak hamaeshaa baa adhaba

Shabad OS N.translation: The seekers of the Divine Spirit are always respectful,

lines.gurmukhi: bw Adb bwSMd AMdr Xwid r?b ]313]
lines.transliteration_english: baa adhab baashandh andhar yaadh rab | 313 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They are also satiated with reverence while remembering Him. (313)

lines.gurmukhi: byAdb rw kY iz rwih SW ^br
lines.transliteration_english: baeadhab raa kai z raahi shaa(n) khabara

Shabad OS N.translation: What does an apostate know about the tradition of those noble persons?

lines.gurmukhi: byAdb Az h?k hmySW by-Asr ]314]
lines.transliteration_english: baeadhab az hak hamaeshaa(n) bae-asar | 314 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The efforts of an atheist to get a glimpse of Akaalpurakh will always be ineffective. (314)

lines.gurmukhi: byAdb hrigz b-h?k rwih nXw&q
lines.transliteration_english: baeadhab haragiz ba-hak raahi nayaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: A disrespectful can never find the path leading towards the Divine Spirit;

lines.gurmukhi: rwih h?k rw rIc gumrwhy nXw&q ]315]
lines.transliteration_english: raahi hak raa reech gumaraahae nayaafath | 315 |

Shabad OS N.translation: No strayed person has ever been able to find the path of God and much less to reach Him. (315)

lines.gurmukhi: hwdIey rwih ^udw Awmd Adb
lines.transliteration_english: haadheeeae raahi khudhaa aamadh adhaba

Shabad OS N.translation: It is reverence that is the guide to the path of Waaheguru;

lines.gurmukhi: by-Adb ^wlI-sq Az Alqwi& r?b ]316]
lines.transliteration_english: bae-adhab khaalee-sath az alathaaf rab | 316 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, an atheist remains blank from receiving His blessings. (316)

lines.gurmukhi: by-Adb rwih ^udw kY dwndS
lines.transliteration_english: bae-adhab raahi khudhaa kai dhaanadhasha

Shabad OS N.translation: How can an atheist find the way to the Almighty,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ikrw kihir ^udw mIrwndS ]317]
lines.transliteration_english: har kiraa kehir khudhaa meeraanadhash | 317 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Who has been condemned due to the anger of Waaheguru?(317)

lines.gurmukhi: dr pnwih swieAwie mrdwin h?k
lines.transliteration_english: dhar panaahi saaeiaae maradhaan haka

Shabad OS N.translation: If you care to seek the shelter (and agree to function in their shadow) of the noble souls of God,

lines.gurmukhi: gr rvI AwN jw Adb XwbI sbk ]318]
lines.transliteration_english: gar ravee aa jaa adhab yaabee sabak | 318 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You will receive teachings and instructions about respectability there. (318)

lines.gurmukhi: by Adb eINjw Adb Awmoz Sud
lines.transliteration_english: bae adhab eejaa adhab aamoz shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: Coming to this place (of noble persons), even the apostates become capable to teach lessons of reverence,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN crwiZ gul jhW A&roz Sud ]319]
lines.transliteration_english: ee charaagh gul jehaa(n) afaroz shudh | 319 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Here, even extinguished lamps begin to spread light throughout the world. (319)

lines.gurmukhi: AY ^udw hr by Adb rw idh Adb
lines.transliteration_english: ai khudhaa har bae adhab raa dhih adhaba

Shabad OS N.translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly bestow reverence even on the irreverent,

lines.gurmukhi: qw guzwrd aumr rw dr Xwid r?b ]320]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa guzaaradh oumar raa dhar yaadh rab | 320 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that they can spend their lives in Your remembrance. (320)

lines.gurmukhi: gr bXwbI l?zqy Az Xwid aU
lines.transliteration_english: gar bayaabee lazathae az yaadh oo

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can relish the savor (sweet taste) of Waaheguru's remembrance,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdw bwSI dwiemw AY nyk-KU ]321]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhaa baashee dhaaeimaa ai naeka-khoo | 321 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then O good man! You can become immortal. (321)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN vjUid ^wk rw kwiem bdW
lines.transliteration_english: ee vajoodh khaak raa kaaeim badhaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Consider this body of dirt as permanent for this reason

lines.gurmukhi: kwiem Awmd SOik aU dr ihriz jW ]322]
lines.transliteration_english: kaaeim aamadh shaauak oo dhar hiraz jaa(n) | 322 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because the devotion for Him have established permanently in the fortress of your heart. (322)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik mOlw izMdgIey jW bvd
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak maaualaa zindhageeeae jaa(n) bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The love and elation for Akaalpurakh are the life-line of the soul,

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU srmwAwie eImW bvd ]323]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo saramaaaae eemaa(n) bavadh | 323 |

Shabad OS N.translation: There is a wealth of faith and religion in His memory. (323)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik aU dr hr idly kY jw kund
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak oo dhar har dhilae kai jaa kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: How can the euphoria and elation for Waaheguru abide in every heart,

lines.gurmukhi: dr vjUid ^wk kY mwvw kund ]324]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar vajoodh khaak kai maavaa kunadh | 324 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, how can He take refuge in the body made up of dirt. (324)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik mOlw mr qurw cUM dsqdwd
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak maaualaa mar thuraa choon dhasathadhaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: When your fondness for Akaalpurakh supported you,

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq dwiem bdsqq dr-&qwd ]325]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath dhaaeim badhasathath dhara-fathaadh | 325 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, take it for granted that you will obtain control and have the divine eternal wealth. (325)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wik rwhS surmwie sr Asq
lines.transliteration_english: khaak raahash suramaae sar asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The dust of His path is like a collyrium for our eyes and head,

lines.gurmukhi: Awir&W rw ibh z qwzo A&sr Asq ]326]
lines.transliteration_english: aarifaa(n) raa bih z thaazo afasar asath | 326 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This dust is much more valuable than the crown and the thrones for the enlightened. (326)

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq duinAw nBbwSd pwiedwr
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath dhuniaa nabhabaashadh paaeidhaara

Shabad OS N.translation: This worldly wealth is not ever lasting,

lines.gurmukhi: dr qrIik Awir&win h?k guzwr ]327]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar thareek aarifaan hak guzaar | 327 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You should accept this according to the verdict of the true devotees of God. (327)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid aU lwizm bvd dwiem qurw
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh oo laazim bavadh dhaaeim thuraa

Shabad OS N.translation: Meditation of Waaheguru is always absolutely essential for you,

lines.gurmukhi: izkir aU kwiem kund kwiem qurw ]328]
lines.transliteration_english: zikar oo kaaeim kunadh kaaeim thuraa | 328 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the discourse about Him makes you steady and immovable forever. (328)

lines.gurmukhi: Awir&W dwrMd bw ier&win ^yS
lines.transliteration_english: aarifaa(n) dhaarandh baa eirafaan khaesha

Shabad OS N.translation: The devotees of Akaalpurakh are intimately connected to the divine knowledge,

lines.gurmukhi: hwsil ier&W drUin jwin ^yS ]329]
lines.transliteration_english: haasal eirafaa(n) dharoon jaan khaesh | 329 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the achievement of divine knowledge is completely absorbed inside their souls. (329)

lines.gurmukhi: msnid SOik ielwhI by-zvwl
lines.transliteration_english: masanadh shaauak eilaahee bae-zavaala

Shabad OS N.translation: The throne of devotion for Akaalpurakh is permanent and indestructible,

lines.gurmukhi: vrnw bInI pur zvwly hr kmwl ]330]
lines.transliteration_english: varanaa beenee pur zavaalae har kamaal | 330 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Although every peak has a trough. (330)

lines.gurmukhi: by-zvwl Awmd kmwil zOik h?k
lines.transliteration_english: bae-zavaal aamadh kamaal zaauak haka

Shabad OS N.translation: The marvel of the zest for God's love is eternal and non-destructible,

lines.gurmukhi: qw ik Xwbd z?rw Az SOik h?k ]331]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa k yaabadh zaraa az shaauak hak | 331 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Wish were it that we can get just one particle of His devotion. (331)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ksy kU Xw&q aU jwvId Sud
lines.transliteration_english: har kasae koo yaafath oo jaaveedh shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever is lucky enough to obtain such a particle, he becomes immortal,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq swihib aumId Sud ]332]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath saahib oumeedh shudh | 332 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In reality, his desire (to meet with Akaalpurakh) is fulfilled. (332)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM aumIdS sUriq hwsl igR&q
lines.transliteration_english: choon oumeedhash soorath haasal grifatha

Shabad OS N.translation: When he reached the stage of fulfillment,

lines.gurmukhi: z?rw Az SOk jw dr idl igR&q ]333]
lines.transliteration_english: zaraa az shaauak jaa dhar dhil grifath | 333 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That particle of the strong desire for His devotion gets seeded into his heart. (333)

lines.gurmukhi: Awib hYvW mIckd Az mUie aU
lines.transliteration_english: aab haivaa(n) meechakadh az mooe oo

Shabad OS N.translation: The divine nectar oozes out of his every hair,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdw mIgrdd jhW Az bUie aU ]334]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhaa meegaradhadh jehaa(n) az booe oo | 334 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And the whole world, with his aroma, becomes alive and rises up. (334)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy iemswn ik h?k rw Xw&qw
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae eimasaan k hak raa yaafathaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Fortunate is that person who has attained the Provident;

lines.gurmukhi: rU z Xwid gYir h?k br-qw&qw ]335]
lines.transliteration_english: roo z yaadh gair hak bara-thaafathaa | 335 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, who has turned himself away (detached) from every worldly items except the memory of God. (335)

lines.gurmukhi: dr ilbwis duinXvI &wirZ AzW
lines.transliteration_english: dhar libaas dhuniyavee faarigh azaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Even while living in worldly guise, he is detached from every materialistic thing,

lines.gurmukhi: hmcU zwiqS AwiSkW rw aU inhW ]336]
lines.transliteration_english: hamachoo zaathish aashikaa(n) raa oo nihaa(n) | 336 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Like the Entity of God, he maintains a hidden profile. (336)

lines.gurmukhi: zwihirS dr kYid muSiq ^wk hsq
lines.transliteration_english: zaahirish dhar kaidh mushath khaak hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Outwardly he might be appearing to be in the grip of a fistful of dust,

lines.gurmukhi: bwqin aU bw ^udwie pwk hsq ]337]
lines.transliteration_english: baathan oo baa khudhaae paak hasath | 337 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Inwardly, he is always engaged in talking about the chaste Akaalpurakh and abides with Him. (337)

lines.gurmukhi: zwihr AMdr mwieil PrzMdo zn
lines.transliteration_english: zaahir andhar maaeil farazandho zana

Shabad OS N.translation: Outwardly, he might appear to be immersed in love for his child and wife,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq bw ^udwie ^ySqn ]338]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath baa khudhaae khaeshathan | 338 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In reality, he always abides (in thought and action) with his God. (338)

lines.gurmukhi: zwihr AMdr mwieil ihrso hvw
lines.transliteration_english: zaahir andhar maaeil hiraso havaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Outwardly, he might seem to be inclined towards 'desires and greed',

lines.gurmukhi: bwqin aU pwk Az Xwid ^udw ]339]
lines.transliteration_english: baathan oo paak az yaadh khudhaa | 339 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But inwardly, he remains chaste and sacred in the memory of Waaheguru. (339)

lines.gurmukhi: zwihr AMdr mwieil Aspo Suqr
lines.transliteration_english: zaahir andhar maaeil asapo shuthara

Shabad OS N.translation: Outwardly, he might appear to be paying attention to horses and camels,

lines.gurmukhi: bwqnS &wirZ z kYid Soro Sr ]340]
lines.transliteration_english: baathanash faarigh z kaidh shoro shar | 340 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But inwardly, he remains detached from the worldly hub-hub and noises. (340)

lines.gurmukhi: zwihr AMdr mwieil sImo zr Asq
lines.transliteration_english: zaahir andhar maaeil seemo zar asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: He might appear to be involved in gold and silver outwardly,

lines.gurmukhi: bwqn AMdr swihib bihro br Asq ]341]
lines.transliteration_english: baathan andhar saahib behiro bar asath | 341 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But he is, in fact, master of land and water inwardly. (341)

lines.gurmukhi: r&qw r&qw bwqnS zwihr Sudw
lines.transliteration_english: rafathaa rafathaa baathanash zaahir shudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: His intrinsic worth gets revealed slowly and gradually,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq iqblwie AMbr Sudw ]342]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath thibalaae anbar shudhaa | 342 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, he becomes a casket of fragrance. (342)

lines.gurmukhi: zwihro bwqn Sudw Xkswin aU
lines.transliteration_english: zaahiro baathan shudhaa yakasaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: His internal and external selves become one and the same,

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm bMdwie &rmwin aU ]343]
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam bandhaae faramaan oo | 343 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the worlds become followers of his command. (343)

lines.gurmukhi: hm bidl Xwid ^udw vw rw zubW
lines.transliteration_english: ham badhil yaadh khudhaa vaa raa zubaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: His heart and tongue are completely immersed in Akaalpurkh's remembrance at all times and  for ever,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN zubwnS idl Sudw idl Sud zubW ]344]
lines.transliteration_english: ee zubaanash dhil shudhaa dhil shudh zubaa(n) | 344 |

Shabad OS N.translation: His tongue becomes his heart, and his heart his tongue. (344)

lines.gurmukhi: vwislwin h?k cunIN &rmUdw AMd
lines.transliteration_english: vaasilaan hak chunee faramoodhaa andha

Shabad OS N.translation: Those saintly  souls who have converged with God have said clearly,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw hw dr bMdgI AwsUdw AMd ]345]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa haa dhar bandhagee aasoodhaa andh | 345 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That persons of God remain comfortable and happy while they are in meditation. (345)

lines.gurmukhi: swihbI bwSd mus?lm Swh rw
lines.transliteration_english: saahibee baashadh musalam shaah raa

Shabad OS N.translation: The mastery and splendor of our True King, the Waaheguru, is well known,

lines.gurmukhi: kurniS mn swilik eIN rwh rw ]346]
lines.transliteration_english: kuranash man saalik ee raah raa | 346 |

Shabad OS N.translation: I bow before the pedestrian who is walking on this path. (346)

lines.gurmukhi: swlwik eIN rwh bmMzl rwh Xw&q
lines.transliteration_english: saalaak ee raah bamanzal raah yaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The traveler on this path arrived at his destination,

lines.gurmukhi: hwisil aumir idl Awgwh Xw&q ]347]
lines.transliteration_english: haasil oumar dhil aagaah yaafath | 347 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, his heart became familiar with the real purpose and attainment of life. (347)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw hw rw bMdgI drkwr hsq
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa haa raa bandhagee dharakaar hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Persons of God really need only His meditation,

lines.gurmukhi: jwim SOik bMdgI srSwr hsq ]348]
lines.transliteration_english: jaam shaauak bandhagee sarashaar hasath | 348 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the cup of the pleasure and elation of meditation continues to overflow for ever. (348)

lines.gurmukhi: swihbI zybd ^udwie pwk rw
lines.transliteration_english: saahibee zaebadh khudhaae paak raa

Shabad OS N.translation: The Mastery (of all creations in this world) is befitting and looks elegant only for the true and the chaste Master, the Akaalpurakh;

lines.gurmukhi: AwN ik zInq dwd muSiq ^wk rw ]349]
lines.transliteration_english: aa k zeenath dhaadh mushath khaak raa | 349 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it is Him alone who has blessed this fistful of dust the gaiety and prosperity. (349)

lines.gurmukhi: SOk Az Xwid h?kS mumqwz krd
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak az yaadh hakash mumathaaz karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The fondness to remember the Waaheguru blessed him with prominence,

lines.gurmukhi: sr &rwzo swihib hr rwz krd ]350]
lines.transliteration_english: sar faraazo saahib har raaz karadh | 350 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, this tendency also blessed him with honor and eminence and made him familiar with His mysteries. (350)

lines.gurmukhi: muSiq ^wk Az Xwid h?k rOxk igR&q
lines.transliteration_english: mushath khaak az yaadh hak raauanak grifatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This fistful of dust, with the remembrance of Akaalpurakh, became bright and shiny,

lines.gurmukhi: bsik dr idl SOik Xwid h?k igR&q ]351]
lines.transliteration_english: basak dhar dhil shaauak yaadh hak grifath | 351 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the fondness to remember Him began to surge like a storm in his heart. (351)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy kwdr ik Az X?k kqrw Awb
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae kaadhar k az yak katharaa aaba

Shabad OS N.translation: May we express our deep devotion for the Omnipotent who from just one drop of water

lines.gurmukhi: ^wk rW rOSn kund cUM Aw&qwb ]352]
lines.transliteration_english: khaak raa(n) raauashan kunadh choon aafathaab | 352 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Gave this lowly fistful of dust the brightness and shine of the sun. (352)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy ^wky ik nUr-A&roz Sud
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae khaakae k noora-afaroz shudha

Shabad OS N.translation: May we sacrifice ourselves for that dust that became enlightened and radiant,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN sAwdq hw nsIb AMdoz Sud ]353]
lines.transliteration_english: ee saaadhath haa naseeb andhoz shudh | 353 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, which was fortunate enough to deserve such boons and blessings. (353)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy kudrq ik h?k bwr Awvurd
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae kudharath k hak baar aavuradha

Shabad OS N.translation: Wonderful is the Nature that brings in the fruits of truth,

lines.gurmukhi: muSiq ^wkI rw bgu&qwr Awvurd ]354]
lines.transliteration_english: mushath khaakee raa bagufathaar aavuradh | 354 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, which blesses the humble fistful of dust the power to speak. (354)

lines.gurmukhi: hwsil eIN izMdgI Xwid ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: haasal ee zindhagee yaadh khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: It is the meditation of Waaheguru that is the achievement of this life;

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy cSmy ik br h?k mubqlw-sq ]355]
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae chashamae k bar hak mubathalaa-sath | 355 |

Shabad OS N.translation: May we sacrifice ourselves for the eye that becomes overawed and gets obsessed with the Truth (God). (355)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy idl ik AMdrS SOkS bvd
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae dhil k andharash shaauakash bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: How blessed is the heart that has an innocent eagerness for the love of God!

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq swihib zOkS bvd ]356]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath saahib zaauakash bavadh | 356 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, he becomes a fervent and fascinated devotee for His love. (356)

lines.gurmukhi: AwN zhy sr kU brwihS dr sjUd
lines.transliteration_english: aa zehae sar koo baraahish dhar sajoodha

Shabad OS N.translation: Blessed is the head that bows to the real path of Truth, the God;

lines.gurmukhi: hm cUM cOgW guey SOkS dr rbUd ]357]
lines.transliteration_english: ham choon chaauagaa(n) gueae shaauakash dhar raboodh | 357 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, who like the crooked stick with a grip, ran away with the ball of elation. (357)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy dsqy ik vs&S aU nivSq
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae dhasathae k vasafash oo navishatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Wonderful are those hands that have written His praises and lauds;

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy pwey kU dr kUieS guzSq ]358]
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae paaeae koo dhar kooeish guzashath | 358 |
