Shabad OS N.translation: Blessed are those feet that have passed through His street. (358)

lines.gurmukhi: AwN zbwny ibh ik izkir aU kund
lines.transliteration_english: aa zabaanae bih k zikar oo kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Noble is the tongue that meditates on His Naam;

lines.gurmukhi: ^wqry AwN ibh ik i&kir aU kund ]359]
lines.transliteration_english: khaatharae aa bih k fikar oo kunadh | 359 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, virtuous is the mind that concentrates its thoughts on Waaheguru. (359)

lines.gurmukhi: dr hmw auzvy ik aU AMdr qnsq
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hamaa ouzavae k oo andhar thanasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Akaalpurakh abides in every limb of our bodies,

lines.gurmukhi: SOik aU AMdr sir mrdo zn Asq ]360]
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak oo andhar sar maradho zan asath | 360 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the zeal and ardor for His love is assimilated in the heads of all men and women. (360)

lines.gurmukhi: AwrzUey jumlw SUie aU bvd
lines.transliteration_english: aarazooeae jumalaa shooe oo bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: All desires and wishes are concentrated in His direction,

lines.gurmukhi: SOik aU AwguSqw dr hr mU bvd ]361]
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak oo aagushathaa dhar har moo bavadh | 361 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, fondness for Him is absorbed in every hair of our bodies. (361)

lines.gurmukhi: gr qU ^whI swihib ier&W SvI
lines.transliteration_english: gar thoo khaahee saahib eirafaa(n) shavee

Shabad OS N.translation: If you want that you become master of divine thought,

lines.gurmukhi: jW b-jwnW idh ik qw jwnW NSvI ]362]
lines.transliteration_english: jaa(n) ba-jaanaa(n) dhih k thaa jaanaa(n) ashavee | 362 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you should sacrifice your life for your Beloved Waaheguru, so that you will acquire the same shape and form that He has. (362)

lines.gurmukhi: hric dwrI kun hmw kurbwin aU
lines.transliteration_english: harach dhaaree kun hamaa kurabaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: You should sacrifice all that you have for your true Beloved,

lines.gurmukhi: ryzw-cInI kun dmy Az ^win aU ]363]
lines.transliteration_english: raezaa-cheenee kun dhamae az khaan oo | 363 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, pick up scraps of food from His dining table just for a moment. (363)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik ier&wnS Agr kwiml bvd
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak eirafaanash agar kaamil bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: If you become completely desirous of His true knowledge and enlightenment,

lines.gurmukhi: gOhir mksUd qU hwisl Svd ]364]
lines.transliteration_english: gaauehar makasoodh thoo haasil shavadh | 364 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you will, inevitably, achieve your purpose. (364)

lines.gurmukhi: qU hm Az eIN aumr XwbI bihrwie
lines.transliteration_english: thoo ham az ee oumar yaabee behiraae

Shabad OS N.translation: You will receive your life's fruits,

lines.gurmukhi: imhir ier&wnS cU b^Sd z?rwie ]365]
lines.transliteration_english: mihar eirafaanash choo bakhashadh zaraae | 365 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When the sun of divine knowledge would bless you with just one ray of its radiance. (365)

lines.gurmukhi: nwim qU AMdr jhW grdd bulMd
lines.transliteration_english: naam thoo andhar jehaa(n) garadhadh bulandha

Shabad OS N.translation: Your name would become famous and illuminated;

lines.gurmukhi: SOik ier&wnq kund bs ArzmMd ]366]
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak eirafaanath kunadh bas arazamandh | 366 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, your ardor for divine knowledge would make you extremely popular in this world. (366)

lines.gurmukhi: SOik ier&winS ksy rw dsqbwd
lines.transliteration_english: shaauak eirafaanish kasae raa dhasathabaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever developed special affection and fondness for divine love,

lines.gurmukhi: kz kulIdS ku&il idlhw rw kuSwd ]367]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz kuleedhash kufal dhilehaa raa kushaadh | 367 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With his key, all locks of the hearts got opened up (realities became known). (367)

lines.gurmukhi: ku&l rw ibkuSw vw mwil bykrW
lines.transliteration_english: kufal raa bikushaa vaa maal baekaraa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: You should, too, open up the lock of your heart, and from the hidden

lines.gurmukhi: dr ki& ^ud Awr Az gMij inhW ]368]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar kaf khudh aar az ganj nihaa(n) | 368 |

Shabad OS N.translation: treasure, should derive unlimited pleasure and elation. (368)

lines.gurmukhi: kMdrW lwlo guhr ibsIAwr hsq
lines.transliteration_english: kandharaa(n) laalo guhar biseeaar hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: In the nooks of your heart, numerous gems and diamonds are lying hidden;

lines.gurmukhi: Az mqwie lulUey Sihvwr hsq ]369]
lines.transliteration_english: az mathaae lulooeae shehivaar hasath | 369 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, your treasure and wealth contain many royal pearls. (369)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich mI^whI iz gMij bySumwr
lines.transliteration_english: har chih meekhaahee z ganj baeshumaara

Shabad OS N.translation: Then whatever you would desire to obtain from this infinite treasure,

lines.gurmukhi: Awiedq dr dsq AY AwwlI qbwr ]370]
lines.transliteration_english: aaeidhath dhar dhasath ai aaaalee thabaar | 370 |

Shabad OS N.translation: O person of high status! You would be able to get. (370)

lines.gurmukhi: ps b^wnI swihbwin SOk rw
lines.transliteration_english: pas bakhaanee saahibaan shaauak raa

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore you should call upon the faithful devotees of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: qw iz hwisl kunIN eIN zOk rw ]371]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa z haasil kunee ee zaauak raa | 371 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that you would be able to inculcate such an ardor and zeal for Him. (371)

lines.gurmukhi: zOik SOik h?k gr bwSd qurw
lines.transliteration_english: zaauak shaauak hak gar baashadh thuraa

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can acquire the strong desire for the love of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: &Yiz eIN suhbq Asr b^Sd qurw ]372]
lines.transliteration_english: faiz ee suhabath asar bakhashadh thuraa | 372 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, the blessing of their company is bound to influence you and your personality. (372)

lines.gurmukhi: gr ich bwSd idlhw nBbwSd juz ^udw
lines.transliteration_english: gar chih baashadh dhilehaa nabhabaashadh juz khudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though, there is nothing else but the Almighty abides in the hearts of every one,

lines.gurmukhi: Awir&W rw mMzly bwSd aUlw ]373]
lines.transliteration_english: aarifaa(n) raa manzalae baashadh oolaa | 373 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Still, the true and sincere enlightened persons have a high status and elevated destination. (373)

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr Awir& vwiki& eIN hwl nIsq
lines.transliteration_english: ghair aarif vaakif ee haal neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: No one other than the knowledgeable is aware of the condition(s) of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: Awir&W rw ZYr izkrS kwl nIsq ]374]
lines.transliteration_english: aarifaa(n) raa ghair zikarash kaal neesath | 374 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The enlightened do not speak any words other than the discourses and meditation of the Naam of Waaheguru. (374)

lines.gurmukhi: bwdSwhW slqnq ib-guzwSqd
lines.transliteration_english: baadhashaahaa(n) salathanath bi-guzaashathadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The kings abdicated their thrones, luxurious living and royal powers,

lines.gurmukhi: cU gdwXW kU bkU ibSqw&qMd ]375]
lines.transliteration_english: choo gadhaayaa(n) koo bakoo bishathaafathandh | 375 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And they kept roaming around from street to street like beggars. (375)

lines.gurmukhi: Az brwie AwN ik Xwid kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: az baraae aa k yaadh kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: For all of them, it is essential to continue to get engaged in the true memory of the Omnipotent;

lines.gurmukhi: Az mkw&wiq do Awlm vw rhMd ]376]
lines.transliteration_english: az makaafaath dho aalam vaa rehandh | 376 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, thus, get redemption from the cycles of births and deaths in both the worlds. (376)

lines.gurmukhi: vwki& eIN rwh Agr dsq Awmdy
lines.transliteration_english: vaakaf ee raah agar dhasath aamadhae

Shabad OS N.translation: If ever one can come across some one who is familiar with this path and tradition,

lines.gurmukhi: mksdS dr slqnq dsq Awmdy ]377]
lines.transliteration_english: makasadhash dhar salathanath dhasath aamadhae | 377 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, all aims and objectives of government administration would be fulfilled. (377)

lines.gurmukhi: jumlw lSkr qwilbwin h?k Sudy
lines.transliteration_english: jumalaa lashakar thaalibaan hak shudhae

Shabad OS N.translation: If all forces of the army were to becomes seekers of Divine Power,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq Awwri& muqilk Sudy ]378]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath aaaaraf muthalik shudhae | 378 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, in fact, they all can become enlightened persons indeed. (378)

lines.gurmukhi: swilik eIN rwh Agr drXw&qy
lines.transliteration_english: saalik ee raah agar dharayaafathae

Shabad OS N.translation: If we can run into a fellow traveler of this path, and ask him about its true  tradition;

lines.gurmukhi: idl AzIN SwhI kujw brqw&qy ]379]
lines.transliteration_english: dhil azee shaahee kujaa barathaafathae | 379 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, how can his mind turn away from this royal kingdom? (379)

lines.gurmukhi: qu^im h?k dr mzrwie idl kwSqy
lines.transliteration_english: thukham hak dhar mazaraae dhil kaashathae

Shabad OS N.translation: If the seed of Truth can be cultivated in the fields of mind,

lines.gurmukhi: qw Zubwir idl iz idl brdwSqy ]380]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa ghubaar dhil z dhil baradhaashathae | 380 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, all suspicions and illusions of our mind will be eliminated. (380)

lines.gurmukhi: br sir q^iq ngIn kwiem budy
lines.transliteration_english: bar sar thakhath nageen kaaeim budhae

Shabad OS N.translation: They can sit on a diamond studded throne for good

lines.gurmukhi: izkir mOlw gr bidl kwiem Sudy ]381]
lines.transliteration_english: zikar maaualaa gar badhil kaaeim shudhae | 381 |

Shabad OS N.translation: If they can inculcate the meditation of Akaalpurakh in their minds, (381)

lines.gurmukhi: bUie h?k mIAwied Az hr muie SW
lines.transliteration_english: booe hak meeaaeidh az har mue shaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Fragrance of Truth is emitting from their each and every hair,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdw mI Sud hr ksy Az bUie SW ]382]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhaa mee shudh har kasae az booe shaa(n) | 382 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, every one is becoming alive and getting invigorated with the aroma of  the company of such people. (382)

lines.gurmukhi: nwim h?k bIrUM n bUd Az ijsim SW
lines.transliteration_english: naam hak beeroon n boodh az jisam shaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Waaheguru's Naam would not have been outside their bodies,

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml Agr dwdy inSW ]383]
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil agar dhaadhae nishaa(n) | 383 |

Shabad OS N.translation: If the perfect Guru had indicated to them with the information about His whereabouts and location. (In stead of looking outside, they could have attained His convergence from within their own hearts.)(383)

lines.gurmukhi: Awib hYvW AMdrUin ^wnw hsq
lines.transliteration_english: aab haivaa(n) andharoon khaanaa hasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The elixir of life is, in fact, inside the heart's so called abode,

lines.gurmukhi: lyk by-hwdI jhW byZwnW hsq ]384]
lines.transliteration_english: laek bae-haadhee jehaa(n) baeghaanaa(n) hasath | 384 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But the world would not know about this fact without a perfect Guru. (384)

lines.gurmukhi: cUM z SihrZ hsq Swh nzdIk qr
lines.transliteration_english: choon z shehiragh hasath shaah nazadheek thara

Shabad OS N.translation: When the True Master is nearer than even your main artery,

lines.gurmukhi: cUM bsihrw mIrvI AY by-^br ]385]
lines.transliteration_english: choon basehiraa meeravee ai bae-khabar | 385 |

Shabad OS N.translation: O ignorant and amateur person! Then why are you roaming around jungles and wilderness. (385)

lines.gurmukhi: vwki& eIN rwh cU grdd rwhnumw
lines.transliteration_english: vaakaf ee raah choo garadhadh raahanumaa

Shabad OS N.translation: When someone familair and well conversant with this path becomes your guide,

lines.gurmukhi: ^lvqy dr AMjumn bwSd qurw ]386]
lines.transliteration_english: khalavathae dhar anjuman baashadh thuraa | 386 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You will be able to achieve solitude within the company of noble persons. (386)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ic SW AMdr i^lw&q dwSqMd
lines.transliteration_english: har ch shaa(n) andhar khilaafath dhaashathandha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever worldly possessions they have,

lines.gurmukhi: jmlw rw X?k bwrogI ibguzwSqMd ]387]
lines.transliteration_english: jamalaa raa yak baarogee biguzaashathandh | 387 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They are willing to relinquish them in one instalment instantly. (387)

lines.gurmukhi: Az brwie AwN ik h?k hwisl kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: az baraae aa k hak haasil kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: So that they could achieve the Ultimate Entity,

lines.gurmukhi: pYrvIie Awiri& kwiml kunMd ]388]
lines.transliteration_english: pairaveee aarif kaamil kunandh | 388 |

Shabad OS N.translation: For this reason, they follow completely the perfectly enlightened persons. (388)

lines.gurmukhi: Awiri& kwiml qurw kwiml kunMd
lines.transliteration_english: aarif kaamil thuraa kaamil kunandha

Shabad OS N.translation: Perfect saints can transform you also into perfect saints;

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich mI^whI qurw hwisl kunMd ]389]
lines.transliteration_english: har chih meekhaahee thuraa haasil kunandh | 389 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, they can fulfill all your desires and wishes. (389)

lines.gurmukhi: rwsqI eInsq rwih h?k bgIr
lines.transliteration_english: raasathee eenasath raahi hak bageera

Shabad OS N.translation: The truth in it is that you should adopt the path leading towards the Lord,

lines.gurmukhi: qw qU hm grdI cU ^urSIid munIr ]390]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa thoo ham garadhee choo khurasheedh muneer | 390 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that you, too, can shine like the brilliance of the sun. (390)

lines.gurmukhi: h?k drUin idl ik idldwrI kund
lines.transliteration_english: hak dharoon dhil k dhiladhaaree kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The true Akaalpurakh, abiding in your heart, extends His love to you;

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml qurw XwrI kund ]391]
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil thuraa yaaree kunadh | 391 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the perfect and complete Guru like a true friend assists you in this process. (391)

lines.gurmukhi: vwki& eIN rwh Agr AwrI bdsq
lines.transliteration_english: vaakaf ee raah agar aaree badhasatha

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can run into someone who is familiar with this (divine) path,

lines.gurmukhi: AMdrUM XwbI mqwie hr ic hsq ]392]
lines.transliteration_english: andharoon yaabee mathaae har ch hasath | 392 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you will discover all types of material and non-material wealth and treasures inside you. (392)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml ksy rw dsq dwd
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil kasae raa dhasath dhaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever has come across a true Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: qwij ier&W rw b&rik aU inhwd ]393]
lines.transliteration_english: thaaj eirafaa(n) raa bafarak oo nihaadh | 393 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The true Guru will put on the crown of true divine knowledge on his head. (393)

lines.gurmukhi: mihrim h?k murSid kwiml kund
lines.transliteration_english: mehiram hak murashadh kaamil kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The true and perfect Guru can make one conversant with the mysteries and love of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: dOliq jwvId rw hwisl kund ]394]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath jaaveedh raa haasil kunadh | 394 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, helps in achieving the eternal divine wealth. (394)

lines.gurmukhi: hr do Awlm bMdwie &rmwin aU
lines.transliteration_english: har dho aalam bandhaae faramaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Persons from both the worlds obey his (the Guru's) command spontaneously,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN jhwno AwN jhW kurbwin aU ]395]
lines.transliteration_english: ee jehaano aa jehaa(n) kurabaan oo | 395 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, both the worlds are willing to lay their lives for him. (395)

lines.gurmukhi: mwAnIiey iehswn ier&win ^udw-sq
lines.transliteration_english: maaaneeeiae eihasaan eirafaan khudhaa-satha

Shabad OS N.translation: The real gratitude for Akaalpurakh is the (achievement of) true divine knowledge,

lines.gurmukhi: Awir&W rw dOliq ^uS rU numw sq ]396]
lines.transliteration_english: aarifaa(n) raa dhaaualath khush roo numaa sath | 396 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the immortal wealth emerges showing its face to the enlightened persons. (396)

lines.gurmukhi: qw ^udwie ^ySqn ibSnw^qS
lines.transliteration_english: thaa khudhaae khaeshathan bishanaakhathasha

Shabad OS N.translation: When, by abiding the All-powerful in his heart, recognized His Entity,

lines.gurmukhi: nkid aumir jwivdW drXw&qS ]397]
lines.transliteration_english: nakadh oumar jaavidhaa(n) dharayaafathash | 397 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Take it that he achieved the treasure of eternal life. (397)

lines.gurmukhi: aU drUin idl qU bIrUM mI-rvI
lines.transliteration_english: oo dharoon dhil thoo beeroon mee-ravee

Shabad OS N.translation: He, the Almighty Lord, abides inside your heart, but you keep running around outside,

lines.gurmukhi: aU b^wnw qU bh?j cUM mI-rvI ]398]
lines.transliteration_english: oo bakhaanaa thoo behaj choon mee-ravee | 398 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He is right inside your home, but you keep going (outside) for Hadj in search of Him. (398)

lines.gurmukhi: aU sq Az hr mUie qU cUM AwSkwr
lines.transliteration_english: oo sath az har mooe thoo choon aashakaara

Shabad OS N.translation: When He manifests Himself from each and every hair of your body,

lines.gurmukhi: qU kujw bIrUM rvI bihir iSkwr ]399]
lines.transliteration_english: thoo kujaa beeroon ravee behir shikaar | 399 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Where do you stray outside to track Him out (to hunt for Him). (399)

lines.gurmukhi: AMdrUin ^wnw-Aq nUir A?lwh
lines.transliteration_english: andharoon khaanaa-ath noor alaaha

Shabad OS N.translation: The splendor of Akaalpurakh radiates in your home-like-heart in such a way,

lines.gurmukhi: qw&q cUM br AwsmW r^iSMdw mwh ]400]
lines.transliteration_english: thaafath choon bar aasamaa(n) rakhashindhaa maah | 400 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Just like the bright moon shines (during moonlit nights) in the sky. (400)

lines.gurmukhi: AMdrUin cSim qr bInw Sudw
lines.transliteration_english: andharoon chasham thar beenaa shudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: It is the Provident who enables you to see through your tearful eyes,

lines.gurmukhi: br zbwnq hukim h?k goXw Sudw ]401]
lines.transliteration_english: bar zabaanath hukam hak goyaa shudhaa | 401 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, it is His command that speaks from your tongue. (401)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN vjUdq rOSn Az nUir h?k Asq
lines.transliteration_english: ee vajoodhath raauashan az noor hak asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This body of yours is radiant because of the splendor of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: rOSn Az nUir ^udwie muqilk Asq ]402]
lines.transliteration_english: raauashan az noor khudhaae muthalik asath | 402 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This entire world is shining with His refulgence. (402)

lines.gurmukhi: lyk vwik& nIsqI Az hwil ^yS
lines.transliteration_english: laek vaakif neesathee az haal khaesha

Shabad OS N.translation: But you are not aware of your inside situation and condition,

lines.gurmukhi: rUzo Sb hYrwnI Az A&Awil ^yS ]403]
lines.transliteration_english: roozo shab hairaanee az afaaal khaesh | 403 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You are distraught day and night because of your own actions and deeds. (403)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml qurw mihrm kund
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil thuraa mehiram kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The perfect true Guru makes you Waaheguru's confidant,

lines.gurmukhi: drid ryiS ihzr rw mrhm kund ]404]
lines.transliteration_english: dharadh raesh hizar raa mareham kunadh | 404 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He provides ointment and dressing for the pain of the wounds of separation. (404)

lines.gurmukhi: qw qU hm Az vwislwin aU SvI
lines.transliteration_english: thaa thoo ham az vaasilaan oo shavee

Shabad OS N.translation: So that you can also become one of Waaheguru's close companions,

lines.gurmukhi: swihib idl grdI vw ^uSbU SvI ]405]
lines.transliteration_english: saahib dhil garadhee vaa khushaboo shavee | 405 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, you could become the master of your heart with a noble character. (405)

lines.gurmukhi: Az brwie AwN ik sr-grdW SvI
lines.transliteration_english: az baraae aa k sara-garadhaa(n) shavee

Shabad OS N.translation: You have ever been perplexed and confused about the Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: aumr hw AMdr qlb hYrW SvI ]406]
lines.transliteration_english: oumar haa andhar thalab hairaa(n) shavee | 406 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, you have been troubled for ages searching for Him. (406)

lines.gurmukhi: qU ich bwSI Awlmy hYrwin aU
lines.transliteration_english: thoo chih baashee aalamae hairaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: What to speak of you alone! The whole world is perplexed indeed for Him,

lines.gurmukhi: ArSo kursI jumlw sr-grdwin aU ]407]
lines.transliteration_english: arasho kurasee jumalaa sara-garadhaan oo | 407 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This sky and the fourth firmament are all distressed about Him. (407)

lines.gurmukhi: cr^ mI grdd bigrid AwN ik aU
lines.transliteration_english: charakh mee garadhadh bagiradh aa k oo

Shabad OS N.translation: This sky revolves around Him for the reason

lines.gurmukhi: dwrd Az SOik ^udw &r^Mdw ^U ]408]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaradh az shaauak khudhaa farakhandhaa khoo | 408 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That it, too, can adopt noble virtues because of its fondness for Him. (408)

lines.gurmukhi: jumlw hYrwnMd sr-grdwin aU
lines.transliteration_english: jumalaa hairaanandh sara-garadhaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: The people of the whole world are amazed and confused about Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: cUM gdw joied aU rw kU b-kU ]409]
lines.transliteration_english: choon gadhaa joeidh oo raa koo ba-koo | 409 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Just like the beggars are looking for Him from street to street. (409)

lines.gurmukhi: bwdSwih hr do Awlm dr idl Asq
lines.transliteration_english: baadhashaahi har dho aalam dhar dhil asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The king of both the worlds is abiding inside the heart,

lines.gurmukhi: lYkn eIN AwiZSqwie Awbo ig?l Asq ]410]
lines.transliteration_english: laikan ee aaghishathaae aabo gl asath | 410 |

Shabad OS N.translation: But this body of our is mired in water and mud. (410)

lines.gurmukhi: dr idil qU nkiS h?k cUM nkS bsq
lines.transliteration_english: dhar dhil thoo nakash hak choon nakash basatha

Shabad OS N.translation: When the True Image of Waaheguru definitely made a stern image and abode  in your heart.

lines.gurmukhi: jumlw n&is SOk Sud AY h?k-pRsq ]411]
lines.transliteration_english: jumalaa nafas shaauak shudh ai haka-prasath | 411 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then O devotee of True Akaalpurakh! Your entire family, out of elation and euphoria, will be transformed itself into His image. (411)

lines.gurmukhi: nkiS h?k XwAnI inSwin nwim h?k
lines.transliteration_english: nakash hak yaaanee nishaan naam haka

Shabad OS N.translation: The form of Akaalpurakh is really the symbol of His Naam,

lines.gurmukhi: Awib hYvW rw bnoS Az jwim h?k ]412]
lines.transliteration_english: aab haivaa(n) raa banosh az jaam hak | 412 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, you should drink the nectar from the cup of Truth. (412)

lines.gurmukhi: AwN ik aU rw jusqm Az hr ^wnwie
lines.transliteration_english: aa k oo raa jusatham az har khaanaaei

Shabad OS N.translation: The Lord that I have been looking for from home to home,

lines.gurmukhi: Xw&qm nwgwh dr kwSwnwie ]413]
lines.transliteration_english: yaafatham naagaah dhar kaashaanaae | 413 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Suddenly, I discovered Him inside my own home (body). (413)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN qu&Yil murSid kwiml bvd
lines.transliteration_english: ee thufail murashadh kaamil bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: This blessing is from the true and perfect Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich mI ^whI Azo hwisl Svd ]414]
lines.transliteration_english: har chih mee khaahee azo haasil shavadh | 414 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever I wanted or needed, I could get that from Him. (414)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN murwid idl ksy by AwN n Xw&q
lines.transliteration_english: ee muraadh dhil kasae bae aa n yaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: No one else can fulfill his heart's desire,

lines.gurmukhi: hr gdwie dOliq sulqW n Xw&q ]415]
lines.transliteration_english: har gadhaae dhaaualath sulathaa(n) n yaafath | 415 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, every beggar is not able to acquire royal riches. (415)

lines.gurmukhi: nwm by murSd imAw vr br zubW
lines.transliteration_english: naam bae murashadh miaa var bar zubaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Do not bring any name other than that of the Guru on your tongue,

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml idhd Az h?k inSW ]416]
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil dhihadh az hak nishaa(n) | 416 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, a perfect Guru alone can give us the correct whereabouts of Akaalpurakh. (416)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid hr cIz mI bwSd bsy
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh har cheez mee baashadh basae

Shabad OS N.translation: There may be numerous teachers and instructors for every item (in this world),

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml kujw Xwbd ksy ]417]
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil kujaa yaabadh kasae | 417 |

Shabad OS N.translation: However, when can one meet a perfect Guru? (417)

lines.gurmukhi: AW ^udwie pwk idl rw kwm dwd
lines.transliteration_english: aaa(n) khudhaae paak dhil raa kaam dhaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The chaste Waaheguru fulfilled the keen desire of my heart,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN idil ibSksqw rw Awrwm dwd ]418]
lines.transliteration_english: ee dhil bishakasathaa raa aaraam dhaadh | 418 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And provided succor to the heart-broken. (418)

lines.gurmukhi: hwisil h?k murSid kwiml bvd
lines.transliteration_english: haasil hak murashadh kaamil bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: To meet a perfect Guru is the real attainment of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: zW ik aU Awrwim jwno idl bvd ]419]
lines.transliteration_english: zaa(n) k oo aaraam jaano dhil bavadh | 419 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Because it is him (Him) who can bestow tranquility to the mind and the soul. (419)

lines.gurmukhi: A?vln AY idl &nwie ^yS SO
lines.transliteration_english: avalan ai dhil fanaae khaesh shaaua

Shabad OS N.translation: O my heart! Firstly, you must get rid of your vanity and ego,

lines.gurmukhi: qw bXwbI rwih h?k dr kUie E ]420]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa bayaabee raahi hak dhar kooe ou | 420 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that you could get the correct direction from His street to the path of Truth. (420)

lines.gurmukhi: vwik& Ar Az murSid kwiml SvI
lines.transliteration_english: vaakif ar az murashadh kaamil shavee

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can get to know the perfect and complete true Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: by qk?l& swihib eIN idl SvI ]421]
lines.transliteration_english: bae thakalaf saahib ee dhil shavee | 421 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you can be the master of this heart without any (ritual) problems. (421)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik aU ^ud &nwie aU n krd
lines.transliteration_english: har k oo khudh fanaae oo n karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever has not been able to eradicate his self ego,

lines.gurmukhi: h?k mr aU rw swihib ier&W n krd ]422]
lines.transliteration_english: hak mar oo raa saahib eirafaa(n) n karadh | 422 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The Akaalpurakh does not divulge His mysteries to him. (422)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich hsq AW AMdrUin ^wnw Asq
lines.transliteration_english: har chih hasath aaa(n) andharoon khaanaa asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever is there, is inside the house, the human body,

lines.gurmukhi: sYr kun dr ikSiq idl eIN dwnw hsq ]423]
lines.transliteration_english: sair kun dhar kishath dhil ee dhaanaa hasath | 423 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You should walk around your heart's field of crops; the grain of enlightenment is there only inside it. (423)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml cU bwSd rwhnumw
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil choo baashadh raahanumaa

Shabad OS N.translation: When the complete and perfect true Guru becomes your guide and mentor,

lines.gurmukhi: bw ^udwie ^yS grdI AwSnw ]424]
lines.transliteration_english: baa khudhaae khaesh garadhee aashanaa | 424 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You would then become very well informed and conversant about your Waaheguru. (424)

lines.gurmukhi: gr idil qU jwnib h?k Awrdq
lines.transliteration_english: gar dhil thoo jaanab hak aaradhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: If your heart can be motivated and inspired towards the Omnipotent,

lines.transliteration_english: az bun har mooe hak mee baaradhath | 425 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, there would be a pouring showers of His Naam in every hair of your body. (425)

lines.gurmukhi: hm drIN duinAw b-XwbI kwm rw
lines.transliteration_english: ham dharee dhuniaa ba-yaabee kaam raa

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, all your desires in this world would be fulfilled,

lines.gurmukhi: ^wk br sr kun Zim A?Xwm rw ]426]
lines.transliteration_english: khaak bar sar kun gham ayaam raa | 426 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, you will bury all the worries and apprehensions of the time. (426)

lines.transliteration_english: beeroon az jisam thoo nabhabavadh heech cheeza

Shabad OS N.translation: Nothing exists in this world outside your body,

lines.gurmukhi: X?k dmy hm ^ySqn qw kun qmIz ]427]
lines.transliteration_english: yak dhamae ham khaeshathan thaa kun thameez | 427 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You should introspect just for a moment to realize your own self. (427)

Shabad OS N.translation: You will be bestowed with the Waaheguru's true boon for ever,

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can appreciate (the stark distinction) as to who you are and who God is? (428)

lines.transliteration_english: man chih zaraa mushathae az khaak ghareeba

Shabad OS N.translation: Who am I? I am just one particle of one fistful of dust of top-layer,

lines.transliteration_english: ee hamaa dhaaualath z murashadh shudh naseeb | 429 |

Shabad OS N.translation: All this blessing, due to my good fortune, was bestowed upon me by my true Guru. (429)

lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh k naam paak raa

Shabad OS N.translation: Great is the true Guru who has blessed me with Akaalpurakh's sacred Naam,

lines.gurmukhi: Az krm b^SId muSiq ^wk rw ]430]
lines.transliteration_english: az karam bakhasheedh mushath khaak raa | 430 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With his enormous kindness and compassion to this fistful of dust. (430)

lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh choo maa theeraa dhilaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Great is the true Guru who has, blind minds like mine,

lines.transliteration_english: karadh raauashan dhar zameeno aasamaa(n) | 431 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Made them refulgent on both the earth and the sky. (431)

lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh k dhil raa shaauak dhaadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Great is the true Guru who has blessed my heart with a keen desire and fondness,

lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh k bandh dhil kushaadh | 432 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Blessed is the true Guru who has broken all the limitations and shackles of my heart. (432)

lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh k baa hak aashanaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Great is the true Guru, Guru Gobind Singh, who introduced me to the Lord,

lines.transliteration_english: karadh faarigh az gham ranjo balaa | 433 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, got me redeemed from worldly worries and griefs. (433)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy murSd ik aumir jwivdW
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh k oumar jaavidhaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Great is the true Guru who has blessed persons like me the eternal life only

lines.gurmukhi: b^Sd Az nwim ^udwie by-inSW ]434]
lines.transliteration_english: bakhashadh az naam khudhaae bae-nishaa(n) | 434 |

Shabad OS N.translation: because of the Naam of the Untraceable Akaalpurakh. (434)

lines.gurmukhi: AY zhy murSd ik aU Az kqrw Awb
lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh k oo az katharaa aaba

Shabad OS N.translation: Great is the perfect and true Guru, who has

lines.gurmukhi: krd rOSn hmcU mwho Aw&qwb ]435]
lines.transliteration_english: karadh raauashan hamachoo maaho aafathaab | 435 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Illuminated just a drop of water like the brightness of moon and the sun. (435)

lines.transliteration_english: ai zehae murashadh zehae eihasaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Blessed is that true Guru and blessed are his numerous boons and bestowals,

lines.transliteration_english: sadh hazaaraa(n) hamachoo man kurabaan oo | 436 |

Shabad OS N.translation: For whom millions of people like me are willing to sacrifice themselves. (436)

lines.gurmukhi: dr zmIno AwsmW nwmS bvd
lines.transliteration_english: dhar zameeno aasamaa(n) naamash bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: His Naam pervades and is prevalent over the earth and the sky,

lines.gurmukhi: hr murIdy swihib kwmS bvd ]437]
lines.transliteration_english: har mureedhae saahib kaamash bavadh | 437 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is Him who fulfills all the strong desires of His disciples. (437)

lines.transliteration_english: har k khush baashadh z gufatho gooe oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever is elated and satisfied on hearing His conversation,

Shabad OS N.translation: Take it that he will be face to face with the Almighty for ever. (438)

lines.gurmukhi: h?k hmySW bwSd aU rw dr hzUr
lines.transliteration_english: hak hamaeshaa(n) baashadh oo raa dhar hazoora

Shabad OS N.translation: The Akaalpurakh is always present before him,

lines.gurmukhi: izkir aU bwSd mr aU rw dr sdUr ]439]
lines.transliteration_english: zikar oo baashadh mar oo raa dhar sadhoor | 439 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the meditation and remembrance of Waaheguru always abides in his heart. (439)

lines.gurmukhi: gr hzUrI bw ^udw bwied b-qO
lines.transliteration_english: gar hazooree baa khudhaa baaeidh ba-thaaua

Shabad OS N.translation: If you have the yearning to be face to face to the Omnipotent,

lines.transliteration_english: dhar hazoor murashadh kaamil biraau | 440 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you should try to be face to face to the perfect and complete Guru. (440)

lines.gurmukhi: sUriq h?k murSid kwiml bvd
lines.transliteration_english: soorath hak murashadh kaamil bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: A perfect Guru is, in fact, the image of the Omnipresent,

lines.gurmukhi: dIdnS Awrwim jwno idl bvd ]441]
lines.transliteration_english: dheedhanash aaraam jaano dhil bavadh | 441 |

Shabad OS N.translation: A glimpse of such a perfect Guru provides succor and serenity to the heart and soul. (441)

lines.gurmukhi: suriq h?k mwAnI Az murSd bvd
lines.transliteration_english: surath hak maaanee az murashadh bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The perfect and true Guru is, indeed, an image of Akaalpurakh,

lines.transliteration_english: har k bara-garadhadh azaa(n) murathadh bavadh | 442 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who has turned himself away from him, was discarded and thrown away like a trash. (442)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml bZYr Az h?k nBgu&q
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil baghair az hak nabhagufatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The perfect and the true Guru does not utter anything but the truth,

lines.gurmukhi: du?ir eIN mwAnI bgYr Az AW n gu&q ]443]
lines.transliteration_english: dhur ee maaanee bagair az aaa(n) n gufath | 443 |

Shabad OS N.translation: No one else but him has been able to pierce the pearl of this spiritual idea. (443)

lines.transliteration_english: thaa kujaa shukarae z eihasaanash kunama

Shabad OS N.translation: How far and how much can I thank Him for His bestowals ?

lines.gurmukhi: hr ich Awied br zubW eIN muZqnm ]444]
lines.transliteration_english: har chih aaeidh bar zubaa(n) ee mughathanam | 444 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever comes on my lips and tongue, I would consider that as a boon. (444)

lines.gurmukhi: Az iZlwziq idl ^udw cUM pwk krd
lines.transliteration_english: az ghilaazath dhil khudhaa choon paak karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: When Akaalpurakh cleansed the heart from filth, profanity and muck

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml b-eIN iedrwk krd ]445]
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil ba-ee eidharaak karadh | 445 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The complete and perfect Guru bestowed the good sense to it. (445)

lines.transliteration_english: varanaa ee raahi khudhaa kai jaanadhae

Shabad OS N.translation: Otherwise, how could we find out the true path of God ?

lines.gurmukhi: Az ikqwib h?k sbk kY ^wndy ]446]
lines.transliteration_english: az kithaab hak sabak kai khaanadhae | 446 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, when and how could we learn a lesson from the book of Truth? (446)

lines.transliteration_english: har kih murashadh raa naa-dhaanadh murathadh asath | 447 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, those who do not know or appreciate the Guru, are, indeed, apostates. (447)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml ielwij idl kund
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil eilaaj dhil kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The perfect and true Guru removes the maladies of the heart,

lines.gurmukhi: kwim idl AMdr idlq hwisl kund ]448]
lines.transliteration_english: kaam dhil andhar dhilath haasil kunadh | 448 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, all your cravings are fulfilled within your heart itself (448)

lines.gurmukhi: nbiz idl cUM murSid kwiml Snw^q
lines.transliteration_english: nabaz dhil choon murashadh kaamil shanaakhath

Shabad OS N.translation: When the perfect Guru correctly diagnosed the pulse of the heart,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgIie aumr rw hwisl Snw^q ]449]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhageee oumar raa haasil shanaakhath | 449 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then the life attained the purpose of its existence. (449)

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgIie aumr hwisl mI Svd
lines.transliteration_english: zindhageee oumar haasil mee shavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Because of the perfect and true Guru, the human being gets an eternal life,

lines.gurmukhi: Az qu&YlS swihib idl mI Svd ]450]
lines.transliteration_english: az thufailash saahib dhil mee shavadh | 450 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With his grace and kindness, one attains the mastery and control of the heart. (450)

lines.gurmukhi: Az brwie AwN ik eIN pYdw Sudw
lines.transliteration_english: az baraae aa k ee paidhaa shudhaa

Shabad OS N.translation: This human being came into this world only to attain the Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: dr i&rwkS vwlw E SYdw Sudw ]451]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar firaakash vaalaa ou shaidhaa shudhaa | 451 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, keeps wandering in His separation as a lunatic. (451)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN mqwA AMdr dukwin h?k bvd

Shabad OS N.translation: This true deal is available only at the shop of Truth,

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml inSwin h?k bvd ]452]
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil nishaan hak bavadh | 452 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The complete and perfect Guru is the symbolic image of Akaalpurakh Himself. (452)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml idhd pwkI qurw
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil dhihadh paakee thuraa

Shabad OS N.translation: The perfect Guru, reference here is to Guru Gobind Singh Ji, bestows chastity and holiness upon you;

lines.gurmukhi: mI kSd Az cwih ZmnwkI qurw ]453]
lines.transliteration_english: mee kashadh az chaahi ghamanaakee thuraa | 453 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, drags you out of the well (depths) of grief and sorrow. (453)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml ielwij idl kund
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil eilaaj dhil kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The perfect and true Guru removes the maladies of the heart,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN murwid idl bidl hwisl kund ]454]
lines.transliteration_english: ee muraadh dhil badhil haasil kunadh | 454 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With which, all the heart's desires are achieved (fulfilled) within the heart itself. (454)

lines.gurmukhi: suhbiq Awir& Ajb dOlq bvd
lines.transliteration_english: suhabath aarif ajab dhaaualath bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The company of noble souls is, by itself, an extraordinary wealth,

lines.transliteration_english: ee hamaa maauakoof bar suhabath bavadh | 455 |

Shabad OS N.translation: All this (these) is attained only through the support of the noble persons' company. (455)

lines.gurmukhi: AY AzIiz mn iSnO Az mn s^un
lines.transliteration_english: ai azeez man shinaau az man sakhuna

Shabad OS N.translation: O my dear ! Please listen to what I have to say,

lines.gurmukhi: qw bXwbI rwh AMdr jwno qn ]456]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa bayaabee raah andhar jaano than | 456 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that you can realize the secret and mystery of life and the body. (456)

lines.transliteration_english: thaalib maradhaan hak raa dhoosathadhaara

Shabad OS N.translation: You should become friendly to the seekers of the Waaheguru's devotees,

Shabad OS N.translation: And should not bring any word other than the meditation of the Naam of Akaalpurakh on your tongue and lips. (457)

lines.transliteration_english: khaak shaau maradhaan hak raa khaak baasha

Shabad OS N.translation: You should become and act like dust, i.e., be humble, and become the dust of the passage of the holy men,

lines.transliteration_english: nae peae dhuneeaae dhoon ghamanaak baash | 458 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, do not worry about this frivolous and undignified world. (458)

Shabad OS N.translation: If you can read the book of glory of romance,

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, you could become the address and headline of the book of love. (459)

Shabad OS N.translation: Love for Waaheguru transforms you into the very image of Waaheguru Himself,

Shabad OS N.translation: And, makes you lofty and famous in both the worlds. (460)

lines.gurmukhi: lzqy Az SOik ^wso zOk idh ]461]
lines.transliteration_english: lazathae az shaauak khaaso zaauak dhih | 461 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, also bestow upon me the savor of the euphoria of Your love. (461)

Shabad OS N.translation: And, You bless me with redemption from the shackles of worries and griefs of this world. (462)

lines.transliteration_english: suhabathae aa dhih k baashadh ghamaghusaar | 463 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Also bless me with the company (of such persons) that can dispel all my worries and griefs. (463)

lines.gurmukhi: ihMmqy AwN idh ik bwSd jW inswr ]464]
lines.transliteration_english: hinmathae aa dhih k baashadh jaa(n) nisaar | 464 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Kindly bless me with such a courage and fortitude that I should be prepared to sacrifice my life to venture to go on the road to God. (464)

lines.transliteration_english: jaano dhil kurabaa(n) rehi subehaa(n) kunadh | 465 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Should also be prepared to sacrifice both the life and the soul on the path of Akaalpurakh. (465)

Shabad OS N.translation: Bless my eyes with the sweet taste of Your glimpse,

lines.gurmukhi: sInw-Am rw m^zin Asrwr b^S ]466]
lines.transliteration_english: seenaa-am raa makhazan asaraar bakhash | 466 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, bless my heart with the treasures of Your mysteries and secrets. (466)

lines.gurmukhi: dr Zuleym bMdgI rw qOk idh ]467]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar ghuleaem bandhagee raa thaauak dhih | 467 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, bless us with a strap (dog-collar) of meditation in our necks. (467)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN i^zwin ijsim mw rw &jl b^S ]468]
lines.transliteration_english: ee khizaan jisam maa raa fajal bakhash | 468 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, bestow Your beneficence on the autumn-like-state of our bodies. (468)

Shabad OS N.translation: Kindly transform, with your Benefaction, each hair on my body into a tongue,

lines.gurmukhi: qw bgoeym vsi& h?k rw dm bdm ]469]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa bagoeaem vasaf hak raa dham badham | 469 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that I could keep uttering and singing Your kudos in my every breath after breath. (469)

lines.transliteration_english: vasaf hak beeran bavadh az gufathagoo

Shabad OS N.translation: The eclat and glories of Akaalpurakh are beyond any words or conversation,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN hdIis Swh bwSd kU b kY ]470]
lines.transliteration_english: ee hadhees shaah baashadh koo b kai | 470 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This discourse and tale of the true King can be heard in every street after street. (470)

lines.gurmukhi: mwAnIie eIN kU b-kU dwnI ik cIsq
lines.transliteration_english: maaaneee ee koo ba-koo dhaanee k cheesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Do you know as to what is the essence of this street?

lines.gurmukhi: hmd go dIgr mgo eInsq zIsq ]471]
lines.transliteration_english: hamadh go dheegar mago eenasath zeesath | 471 |

Shabad OS N.translation: You should utter only His approbations and nothing else. This is life. (471)

lines.transliteration_english: zeesathan dhar bandhagee oolaa bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: It is superb to live with His constant meditation,

lines.gurmukhi: gr ich sr qw pw hmw mUlw bvd ]472]
lines.transliteration_english: gar chih sar thaa paa hamaa moolaa bavadh | 472 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though we may be the masters of the body from head to toes. (472)

lines.gurmukhi: gr idhd qO&Ik &jil zuljlwl
lines.transliteration_english: gar dhihadh thaauafeek fajal zulajalaala

Shabad OS N.translation: If the all Truth Akaalpurakh blesses someone with courage and capability,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw rw Az bMdgI bwSd kmwl ]473]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa raa az bandhagee baashadh kamaal | 473 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then that person can earn laurels because of meditation. (473)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI bwSd kmwil bMdgI
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee baashadh kamaal bandhagee

Shabad OS N.translation: Meditation is the marvel and cornerstone of being a human being,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI bwSd inSwin izMdgI ]474]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee baashadh nishaan zindhagee | 474 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, meditation is the real sign of being alive. (474)

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgIie bMdw rw eIN bMdgIsq
lines.transliteration_english: zindhageee bandhaa raa ee bandhageesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The (purpose of) life of a human being is indeed the meditation of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgIie h?k ik AYn izMdgIsq ]475]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhageee hak k ain zindhageesath | 475 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The remembrance of Waaheguru is the real (purpose of) life. (475)

lines.gurmukhi: gr inSwin izMdgI mI-bwiedq
lines.transliteration_english: gar nishaan zindhagee mee-baaeidhatha

Shabad OS N.translation: If you are looking for some signs and symbols of life for yourself,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgIie h?k qurw mI-Swiedq ]476]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhageee hak thuraa mee-shaaeidhath | 476 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, it is absolutely appropriate for you to keep on meditating(on the Naam of Akaalpurakh). (476)

lines.gurmukhi: qw qvwnI bMdw SO swihb mbwS
lines.transliteration_english: thaa thavaanee bandhaa shaau saahib mabaasha

Shabad OS N.translation: As far as possible, you should become an humble person like a servant, and not an arrogant master,

lines.gurmukhi: bMdw rw juz bMdgI nbvd qlwS ]477]
lines.transliteration_english: bandhaa raa juz bandhagee nabavadh thalaash | 477 |

Shabad OS N.translation: A person should not be looking for anything in this world except meditation of the Almighty. (477)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN vjUid ^wk pwk Az bMdgIsq
lines.transliteration_english: ee vajoodh khaak paak az bandhageesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: This body of dust becomes sacred only due to the remembrance of the Provident,

lines.gurmukhi: gu&qgUhwie idgr SrimMdgIsq ]478]
lines.transliteration_english: gufathagoohaae dhigar sharamindhageesath | 478 |

Shabad OS N.translation: To get involved in any conversation other than the meditation will be nothing but an utter shame. (478)

lines.gurmukhi: bMdgI kun zW ik aU bwSd kbUl
lines.transliteration_english: bandhagee kun zaa(n) k oo baashadh kaboola

Shabad OS N.translation: You should meditate so that you become acceptable in His court,

lines.gurmukhi: ibguzr Az ^ud-bInI E qriz zhUl ]479]
lines.transliteration_english: biguzar az khudha-beenee ou tharaz zehool | 479 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, give up the pattern of self ego and the way of life of that of an apostate. (479)

lines.gurmukhi: dr idil swihib-idlW Awied psMd
lines.transliteration_english: dhar dhil saahibi-dhilaa(n) aaeidh pasandh

Shabad OS N.translation: The meditation is extremely pleasing to the heart of the Master of all hearts,

lines.gurmukhi: ruqbw-Aq grdd AzW hrdm bulMd ]480]
lines.transliteration_english: ruthabaa-ath garadhadh azaa(n) haradham bulandh | 480 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Your status in this world remains high at all times only because of meditation. (480)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml ik aU ArSwd krd
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil k oo arashaadh karadha

Shabad OS N.translation: The perfect and true Guru said like this,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN idlq Az Xwid h?k Awbwd krd ]481]
lines.transliteration_english: ee dhilath az yaadh hak aabaadh karadh | 481 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He has inhabited you desolate heart with the remembrance of Waaheguru. (481)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN hmw ArSwd dr idl nkS-bMd
lines.transliteration_english: ee hamaa arashaadh dhar dhil nakasha-bandha

Shabad OS N.translation: You should etch this command of the perfectly true Guru in your heart,

lines.gurmukhi: qw SvI dr hr do Awlm sr bulMd ]482]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa shavee dhar har dho aalam sar bulandh | 482 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that you can have your head high in both the worlds. (482)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN vjUid ims qurw swzd iqlw
lines.transliteration_english: ee vajoodh mis thuraa saazadh thilaa

Shabad OS N.translation: This command of the perfect and true Guru transforms your body of copper into that of gold,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN iqlw mwAlUm Az Xwid ^udw ]483]
lines.transliteration_english: ee thilaa maaaloom az yaadh khudhaa | 483 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, this gold is realized only through the memory of Akaalpurakh. (483)

lines.gurmukhi: AW iqlw &wnI vw sd mOiz blw
lines.transliteration_english: aaa(n) thilaa faanee vaa sadh maauaz balaa

Shabad OS N.translation: This materialistic gold is destructible and is the root cause and whirlpool of  numerous problems and conflicts,

lines.gurmukhi: eIN iqlw bwkI cU zwiq ikbrIAw ]484]
lines.transliteration_english: ee thilaa baakee choo zaath kibareeaa | 484 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The gold of meditation, however, like the Entity of Omnipresent and True Waaheguru is permanent. (484)

lines.gurmukhi: dOlq AMdr ^wik pwie mukblW
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualath andhar khaak paae mukabalaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: The (true) wealth is in the dust of the feet of the noble and accepted souls,

lines.gurmukhi: dOlqy kW rw nmI AwXd izAwN ]485]
lines.transliteration_english: dhaaualathae kaa(n) raa namee aayadh ziaa | 485 |

Shabad OS N.translation: It is such a true wealth that it is above and beyond any damage or loss. (485)

lines.gurmukhi: Awkbq dIdI i^zW Awvurd bhwr
lines.transliteration_english: aakabath dheedhee khizaa(n) aavuradh behaara

Shabad OS N.translation: You must have noticed that every spring brings in the autumn,

lines.gurmukhi: vrnw dr duinAw hmw &sil bhwr ]486]
lines.transliteration_english: varanaa dhar dhuniaa hamaa fasal behaar | 486 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Although the spring keeps coming into this world again and again. (486)

lines.gurmukhi: eIN bhwir qwzw bwSd qw Abd
lines.transliteration_english: ee behaar thaazaa baashadh thaa abadha

Shabad OS N.translation: However, this meditational form of spring remains fresh and new till the doomsday,

lines.gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI dUr dwr Az NcSim bd ]487]
lines.transliteration_english: yaa eilaahee dhoor dhaar az achasham badh | 487 |

Shabad OS N.translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly keep the influence of the evil eye far away from this spring . (487)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik ^wik pwie SW rw surmw Xw&q
lines.transliteration_english: har k khaak paae shaa(n) raa suramaa yaafatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Anyone who happens to obtain the collyrium of the dust of the feet of the holy persons,

lines.gurmukhi: br ru^S qihkIk nUir imhr qw&q ]488]
lines.transliteration_english: bar rukhash thehikeek noor mihar thaafath | 488 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Rest assured that his face will shine like the brilliance and radiance of the divine sun. (488)

lines.gurmukhi: Awiri& A?lwh dr dunIAwN bvd
lines.transliteration_english: aarif alaah dhar dhuneeaa bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though spiritually enlightened person lives in this world,

lines.gurmukhi: dr hkIkq qwilib mOlw bvd ]489]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar hakeekath thaalib maaualaa bavadh | 489 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He, in fact, is always a seeker-devotee of the Waaheguru. (489)

lines.gurmukhi: izkir mOlw dm b-dm dr jwin aU
lines.transliteration_english: zikar maaualaa dham ba-dham dhar jaan oo

Shabad OS N.translation: He meditates and describes His virtues every breath of his life,

lines.gurmukhi: Awieiq nwim ^udw dr Swin aU ]490]
lines.transliteration_english: aaeith naam khudhaa dhar shaan oo | 490 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, he recites verses of His Naam every moment in His honor. (490)

lines.gurmukhi: hr n&s dwrMd idl rw sUie h?k
lines.transliteration_english: har nafas dhaarandh dhil raa sooe haka

Shabad OS N.translation: They keep directing their hearts and concentrating towards thoughts about Him,

lines.gurmukhi: Sud muA?qr mZiz SW Az bUie h?k ]491]
lines.transliteration_english: shudh muathar maghaz shaa(n) az booe hak | 491 |

Shabad OS N.translation: They make their intellect fragrant with the aroma of the memory of Akaalpurakhb in every breath. (491)

lines.gurmukhi: hr dmy kU bw ^udw vwisl bvd
lines.transliteration_english: har dhamae koo baa khudhaa vaasil bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: He always concentrates and is united with the Almighty at all times,

lines.gurmukhi: hwisil eIN aumr rw hwisl bvd ]492]
lines.transliteration_english: haasil ee oumar raa haasil bavadh | 492 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, he has been able to achieve the real fruits of this life. (492)

lines.gurmukhi: hwisil eIN aumr pyiS muriSd Asq
lines.transliteration_english: haasil ee oumar paesh murashidh asatha

Shabad OS N.translation: The real fruits of this life lies with the Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: nwim h?k cUM br zubwnS vwird Asq ]493]
lines.transliteration_english: naam hak choon bar zubaanash vaaridh asath | 493 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, silent repetition and meditation of His Naam is always on his tongue and the lips. (493)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid kwiml bvd dIdwir h?k
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh kaamil bavadh dheedhaar haka

Shabad OS N.translation: The true Guru is the apparent glimpse of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: kz zubwinS ibSnvI Asrwir h?k ]494]
lines.transliteration_english: kaz zubaanish bishanavee asaraar hak | 494 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Therefore, you should listen to His mysteries from his tongue. (494)

lines.gurmukhi: sUriq h?k murSid kwiml bvd
lines.transliteration_english: soorath hak murashadh kaamil bavadha

Shabad OS N.translation: A true Guru is indeed a perfect personification of the image of God,

lines.gurmukhi: nkiS aU dwiem drUin idl bvd ]495]
lines.transliteration_english: nakash oo dhaaeim dharoon dhil bavadh | 495 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the image of Akaalpurakh always abides in his heart. (495)

lines.gurmukhi: nkiS aU dr idil ks jw kund
lines.transliteration_english: nakash oo dhar dhil kas jaa kunadha

Shabad OS N.translation: When His image resides permanently in someone's heart,

lines.gurmukhi: hri& h?k AMdr idlS mwvw kund ]496]
lines.transliteration_english: haraf hak andhar dhilash maavaa kunadh | 496 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then, just one word of Akaalpurakh settles down in the depths of his heart. (496)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wsqm qrqIib eIN du?r dwnw rw
lines.transliteration_english: khaasatham tharatheeb ee dhur dhaanaa raa

Shabad OS N.translation: I have threaded these grains of pearls into a necklace,

lines.gurmukhi: ik AwSnw swzd idil bygwnw rw ]497]
lines.transliteration_english: k aashanaa saazadh dhil baegaanaa raa | 497 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that this arrangement may make the ignorant hearts aware of the secrets of Waaheguru. (497)

lines.gurmukhi: Awib hYvW pur Sudw cU jwim aU
lines.transliteration_english: aab haivaa(n) pur shudhaa choo jaam oo

Shabad OS N.translation: (This compilation) Like a cup is filled to the brim with the divine elixir,

lines.gurmukhi: izMdgI nwmw Sudw zW nwim aU ]498]
lines.transliteration_english: zindhagee naamaa shudhaa zaa(n) naam oo | 498 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is why, it has been given the name 'Zindagee Naamaa'. (498)

lines.gurmukhi: kz qk?lum bUie ier&W AwiedS
lines.transliteration_english: kaz thakalum booe eirafaa(n) aaeidhasha

Shabad OS N.translation: From his speeches emerges the fragrance of divine knowledge,

lines.gurmukhi: vz idil Awlm igrwh ibkuSwiedS ]499]
lines.transliteration_english: vaz dhil aalam giraah bikushaaeidhash | 499 |

Shabad OS N.translation: With it, the knot (mysteries and suspicions) of the heart of the world is untangled. (499)

lines.gurmukhi: hr ik ^wnd Az rih luq&o krm
lines.transliteration_english: har k khaanadh az rehi luthafo karama

Shabad OS N.translation: Whosoever recites this with the grace and compassion of Waaheguru,

lines.gurmukhi: grddS dr rwih ier&W muhqirm ]500]
lines.transliteration_english: garadhadhash dhar raahi eirafaa(n) muhatharim | 500 |

Shabad OS N.translation: He receives laurels among the enlightened persons. (500)

lines.gurmukhi: hsq izkir Awir&win pwk rw
lines.transliteration_english: hasath zikar aarifaan paak raa

Shabad OS N.translation: This volume contains description and delineation of sacred and divine men;

lines.gurmukhi: AwN ik aU rOSn kund iedrwk rw ]501]
lines.transliteration_english: aa k oo raauashan kunadh eidharaak raa | 501 |

Shabad OS N.translation: This description lightens up the intelligence and the wisdom. (501)

lines.gurmukhi: nIsq dr vY muMdrj AY bw-^br
lines.transliteration_english: neesath dhar vai mundharaj ai baa-khabara

Shabad OS N.translation: O informed person! In this volume,

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr hri& bMdgI hri& idgr ]502]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair haraf bandhagee haraf dhigar | 502 |

Shabad OS N.translation: there is no other word or expression except the words or expressions of remembrance and meditation of  Akaalpuralkh. (502)

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k srmwXw-ie rOSn idlIsq
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak saramaayaa-e raauashan dhileesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: Remembrance of Waaheguru is the treasure of the enlightened minds,

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr Xwid h?k hmw by-hwslIAq ]503]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair yaadh hak hamaa bae-haasaleeath | 503 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Everything else other than the meditation of Waaheguru is (absolutely) useless. (503)

lines.gurmukhi: hri& dIgr nIsq ZYr Az Xwid h?k
lines.transliteration_english: haraf dheegar neesath ghair az yaadh haka

Shabad OS N.translation: Do not read or even look at any word or expression except the ones about meditation of the Omnipotent,

lines.gurmukhi: Xwid h?k hW Xwid h?k hW Xwid h?k ]504]
lines.transliteration_english: yaadh hak haa(n) yaadh hak haa(n) yaadh hak | 504 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Remembrance of God, yes remembrance of God, and only remembrance of God. (504)

lines.gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI hr idil pzmurdw rw
lines.transliteration_english: yaa eilaahee har dhil pazamuradhaa raa

Shabad OS N.translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly make every withered and disheartened mind green and confident again,

lines.gurmukhi: sbz kun hr ^wiqir A&surdw rw ]505]
lines.transliteration_english: sabaz kun har khaathir afasuradhaa raa | 505 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, refresh and rejuvenate every wilted and languishing mind. (505)

lines.gurmukhi: Xw ielwhI XwvrI kun bMdw rw
lines.transliteration_english: yaa eilaahee yaavaree kun bandhaa raa

Shabad OS N.translation: O Waaheguru! Kindly help this person, yours truly,

lines.gurmukhi: sur^urU kun hr idil SrimMdw rw ]506]
lines.transliteration_english: surakhuroo kun har dhil sharamindhaa raa | 506 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, make every ashamed and timid person successful and triumphant. (506)

lines.gurmukhi: dr idil goXw hvwie SOk b^S
lines.transliteration_english: dhar dhil goyaa havaae shaauak bakhasha

Shabad OS N.translation: O Akaalpurakh! (Kindly) bless the heart of Goyaa with the yearning of love (for You),

lines.gurmukhi: br zubwnS z?rw-ie Az zOk b^S ]507]
lines.transliteration_english: bar zubaanash zaraa-e az zaauak bakhash | 507 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, bestow upon the tongue of Goyaa just one particle of the fondness for Your love. (507)

lines.gurmukhi: qwN n bwSd ivrid AW juz Xwid h?k
lines.transliteration_english: thaa n baashadh viradh aaa(n) juz yaadh haka

Shabad OS N.translation: So that he would not meditate or remember anyone other than the Lord,

lines.gurmukhi: qW n ^wnd ZYr h?k dIgr sb?k ]508]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa(n) n khaanadh ghair hak dheegar sabak | 508 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, so that he would not learn or recite any other lesson except that of the love and devotion for Waaheguru. (508)

lines.gurmukhi: qw n gIrd ZYr nwim izkir h?k
lines.transliteration_english: thaa n geeradh ghair naam zikar haka

Shabad OS N.translation: So that he would not speak any other word except the meditation and remembrance of Akaalpurakh,

lines.gurmukhi: qw n goied hri& ZYr Az i&kir h?k ]509]
lines.transliteration_english: thaa n goeidh haraf ghair az fikar hak | 509 |

Shabad OS N.translation: So that he would not recite or read any other word or expression except that the one(s) on the concentration of spiritual thought. (509)

lines.gurmukhi: dIdw Az dIdwir-h?k pur-nUr kun
lines.transliteration_english: dheedhaa az dheedhaari-hak pura-noor kuna

Shabad OS N.translation: (O Akaalpurakh!) Kindly make my eyes refulgent with glow by blessing  me with a glimpse of the Almighty,

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr h?k Az ^wqir idil dUr kun ]510]
lines.transliteration_english: ghair hak az khaathar dhil dhoor kun | 510 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Kindly remove everything from my heart except the entity of God. (510)

lines.gurmukhi: gMj nwmw
lines.transliteration_english: ganj naamaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Ganj Nama

lines.gurmukhi: idlo jwnm b-hr sbwho msw
lines.transliteration_english: dhilo jaanam ba-har sabaaho masaa

Shabad OS N.translation: Every morning and evening, my heart and soul,

lines.gurmukhi: sro &rkm iz rUie isdko s&w ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: saro farakam z rooe sidhako safaa | 1 |

Shabad OS N.translation: My head and forehead with faith and clarity (1)

lines.gurmukhi: bwd br murSd qrIik inswr
lines.transliteration_english: baadh bar murashadh thareek nisaara

Shabad OS N.translation: Shall sacrifice for my Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: Az sir iemz sd hzwrW bwr ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: az sar eimaz sadh hazaaraa(n) baar | 2 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And sacrifice with humility by bowing my head millions of times. (2)

lines.gurmukhi: ik iz iensW milk nmUdsq aU
lines.transliteration_english: k z einasaa(n) malik namoodhasath oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Because, he created angels out of ordinary human beings,

lines.gurmukhi: ieziq ^wkIAwN &zUdsq aU ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: eizath khaakeeaa fazoodhasath oo | 3 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, he elevated the status and honor of the earthly beings. (3)

lines.gurmukhi: ^wsgwN jumlw ^wik pwie aU
lines.transliteration_english: khaasagaa jumalaa khaak paae oo

Shabad OS N.translation: All those honored by Him are, in fact, the dust of His feet,

lines.gurmukhi: hmw mlkUqIAwN i&dwie aU ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: hamaa malakootheeaa fidhaae oo | 4 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, all gods and goddesses are willing to sacrifice themselves for Him. (4)

lines.gurmukhi: gr i&rozd hzwr imhro mwh
lines.transliteration_english: gar firozadh hazaar miharo maaha

Shabad OS N.translation: Even though, thousands of moons and suns might be shinig,

lines.gurmukhi: Awlmy dW juz aU qmwm isAwh ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: aalamae dhaa(n) juz oo thamaam siaah | 5 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Still the whole world will be in pitch darkness without Him. (5)

lines.gurmukhi: murSid pwk nUir h?k Awmd
lines.transliteration_english: murashadh paak noor hak aamadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Holy and chaste Guru is the image of Akaalpurakh Himself,

lines.gurmukhi: zW sb?b dr idlm sbk Awmd ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: zaa(n) sabab dhar dhilam sabak aamadh | 6 |

Shabad OS N.translation: That is the reason that I have settled Him inside my heart. (6)

lines.gurmukhi: AW kswny ik zo n Xwd AwrMd
lines.transliteration_english: aaa(n) kasaanae k zo n yaadh aarandha

Shabad OS N.translation: Those persons who do not contemplate Him,

lines.gurmukhi: smrw-ey jwno idl bbwd AwrMd ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: samaraa-eae jaano dhil babaadh aarandh | 7 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Take it that they have wasted the fruit of their heart and soul for nothing. (7)

lines.gurmukhi: mzrw-ie pur smr b-ArzwnI
lines.transliteration_english: mazaraa-e pur samar ba-arazaanee

Shabad OS N.translation: This field loaded with cheap fruits,

lines.gurmukhi: cUM m-bInd iz dUr syrwnI ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: choon ma-beenadh z dhoor saeraanee | 8 |

Shabad OS N.translation: When he looks at them to his heart's content, (8)

lines.gurmukhi: ieMbswq AwiedS AzW dIdn
lines.transliteration_english: einbasaath aaeidhash azaa(n) dheedhana

Shabad OS N.translation: Then he gets a special kind of pleasure to look at them,

lines.gurmukhi: br Sqwbd iz bihir brcIdn ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: bar shathaabadh z behir baracheedhan | 9 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, he runs towards them to pluck them. (9)

lines.gurmukhi: lyk hwisl inAwrd Az vY bwr
lines.transliteration_english: laek haasil niaaradh az vai baara

Shabad OS N.translation: However, he does not get any results from his fields,

lines.gurmukhi: bwz grdd gursnw ^uAwro nzwr ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: baaz garadhadh gurasanaa khuaaro nazaar | 10 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, returns disappointed hungry, thirsty and debilitated. (10)

lines.gurmukhi: ZYr siqgur hmw b-dW mwnd
lines.transliteration_english: ghair sathigur hamaa ba-dhaa(n) maanadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Without Satguru, you should consider everything to be like as if

lines.gurmukhi: kW cunW zrie bwr-vr dwnd ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: kaa(n) chunaa(n) zarae baara-var dhaanadh | 11 |

Shabad OS N.translation: The field is ripe and grown but full of weeds and thorns. (11)

lines.gurmukhi: pihlI pwqSwhI (gurU nwnk dyv jI)
lines.transliteration_english: pehilee paathashaahee aguroo naanak dhaev jee

Shabad OS N.translation: Pehlee Paatshaahee (Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji)

lines.gurmukhi: pihlI pwqSwhI aus s?cy Aqy smr?Q dy nUr nUM cmkwaux vwlI, Aqy r?b qy Brosy dy igAwn nUM roSn krn vwlI hY [

Shabad OS N.translation: The first Sikh Guru, Guur Nanak Dev Ji, was the one who glistened the true and all-powerful refulgence of the Almighty and to highlight the significance of knowledge of complete faith in Him.

lines.gurmukhi: aus sdIvI jwxkwrI dw JMfw au?cN krn vwlI Aqy igAwn dy AMnHyry nUM dUr krn vwlI, pwqwl qoN lYky AnMq qk aus r?b dy Prmwn dw plwnw Awpxy moFy qy r?KI bY

Shabad OS N.translation: He was the one who elevated the flag of eternal spirituality and eliminated the darkness of ignorance of divine enlightenment and who took upon his own shoulders the responsibility of propagating the message of Akaalpurakh.

lines.gurmukhi: lwhUUq qoN lYky ies jhwn q?k sB aus dy dr dI Kwk hn [
lines.transliteration_english: laahooooth tho laikae eis jehaan thak sabh ous dhae dhar dhee khaak han |a

Shabad OS N.translation: Beginning from the earliest time to the present world, everyone considers himself to be the dust at his door;

lines.gurmukhi: aus dw j?s gwiex krx vwlw Awp v?fy mrqby vwlw r?b hY Aqy aus dw qwlb Awp r?b dI AibnwsI zwq hY [

Shabad OS N.translation: The highest-ranked, the Lord, Himself sings his praises; and his disciple-student is the divine lineage of Waaheguru Himself.

lines.gurmukhi: hr cOQy Aqy CyvyN PirSqy dw klwm vI ausy dI isPq swlwh krx qoN Asmr?Q hY Aqy aus dw nUr nwl BirAw JMfw dohW jhwnW qy Juldw hY [
lines.transliteration_english: har chaauathae athae shaevae farishathae dhaa kalaam vee ousae dhee sifath saalaah karan tho asamarath hai athae ous dhaa noor naal bhariaa jhanddaa dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) thae jhuladhaa hai |

Shabad OS N.translation: Every fourth and sixth angel is unable to describe Guru's eclat in their expressions; and his radiance filled flag is flying over both the worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: aus dy hukm dI imswl r?b dIAwN nUrwnI ikrnW hn Aqy ausdy swhmxy l?KW cMn sUrj AMnHyry dy smuMdr ivc fub jWdy hn [
lines.transliteration_english: ous dhae hukam dhee misaal rab dheeaa nooraanee kiranaa(n) han athae ousadhae saahamanae lakhaa(n) chann sooraj annaaerae dhae samundhar vich ddub jaa(n)dhae han |

Shabad OS N.translation: Examples of his command are the brilliant rays emanating from the Provident and when compared to him, millions of suns and moons get drowned in the oceans of darkness.

lines.gurmukhi: aus dy bcn Aqy AwigAw dunIAwN dy lokW leI srvoqm hn, Aqy aus dI sPwrS dohW jhwnW leI pihlw drjw rKdI hY [
lines.transliteration_english: ous dhae bachan athae aagiaa dhuneeaa dhae lokaa(n) lee saravotham hana, athae ous dhee safaarash dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) lee pehilaa dharajaa rakhadhee hai |

Shabad OS N.translation: His words, messages and orders are the supreme for the people of the world and his recommendations rank absolutely first in both the worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: aus dy s?cy iKqwb dohW jhwnW dy murSd hn Aqy aus dI s?cI zwq gunwhgwrW leI rihmq hY [
lines.transliteration_english: ous dhae sachae khithaab dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) dhae murashadh han athae ous dhee sachee zaath gunaahagaaraa(n) lee rehimath hai |

Shabad OS N.translation: His true titles are the guide for both the worlds; and his true disposition is the compassion for the sinful.

lines.gurmukhi: r?b dI drgwh dy dyvqy aus murSd dy crnW dI DUV nUM cuMmdy hn Aqy aucyry drbwr dy piv?qR PriSqy aus murSd dy goly Aqy gulwm hn [
lines.transliteration_english: rab dhee dharagaah dhae dhaevathae ous murashadh dhae charanaa(n) dhee dhoorr noon chunmadhae han athae ouchaerae dharabaar dhae pavthr farashithae ous murashadh dhae golae athae gulaam han |

Shabad OS N.translation: The gods in the court of Waaheguru consider it a privilege to kiss the dust of his lotus feet and the angles of the higher court are slaves and servitors of this mentor.

lines.gurmukhi: aus dy piv?qR nwm dy dovyN nUMn inAwmqW bKSx vwly Aqy shweI hox vwly hn [ ivckwrlw AilP AkwlpurK dw lKwiek hY, AKIrlw kw& AMqm mhWpurK dw sUck hY [
lines.transliteration_english: ous dhae pavthr naam dhae dhovae noonn niaamathaa(n) bakhashan vaalae athae sehaaee hon vaalae han | vichakaaralaa alif akaalapurakh dhaa lakhaaeik hai, akheeralaa kaaf antham mehaa(n)purakh dhaa sooc

Shabad OS N.translation: Both the ens (N's) in his name depict nurturer, nourisher ans neighborly (boons, support and benefactions); the middle A represents the Akaalpurakh, and the last K represents the Ultimate great prophet.

lines.gurmukhi: aus dI PkIrI kwml Pkr dw isr au?cw krn vwlI hY Aqy aus dI sKwvq dohW jhwnW ivc BrpUr hY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: ous dhee fakeeree kaamal fakar dhaa sir ouchaa karan vaalee hai athae ous dhee sakhaavath dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) vich bharapoor hai | 12 |

Shabad OS N.translation: His mendicancy raises the bar of detachment from the worldly distractions to the highest level and his generosity and benevolence prevails all over both the worlds. (12)

lines.gurmukhi: vwihgurU jIau sq
lines.transliteration_english: vaahiguroo jeeo sath

Shabad OS N.translation: Waaheguru is the Truth,

lines.gurmukhi: vwihgurU jIau hwzr nwzr hY
lines.transliteration_english: vaahiguroo jeeo haazar naazar hai

Shabad OS N.translation: Waaheguru is Omnipresent

lines.gurmukhi: aus dw nwm nwnk pwqSwh hY qy auh s?cy Drm vwlw hY [
lines.transliteration_english: ous dhaa naam naanak paathashaah hai thae ouh sachae dharam vaalaa hai |a

Shabad OS N.translation: His name is Nanak, the emperor and his religion is the truth,

lines.gurmukhi: Aqy aus ijhw hor koeI drvyS sMswr ivc nhIN AwieAw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: athae ous jihaa hor koee dharavaesh sansaar vich nehee aaeiaa | 13 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And that, there has not been another prophet like him who emanated in this world. (13)

lines.gurmukhi: &ukry aU &kr rw sr-&rwzI
lines.transliteration_english: fukarae oo fakar raa sara-faraazee

Shabad OS N.translation: His mendicancy (by precept and practice) lifts the head of saintly living to lofty heights,

lines.gurmukhi: pyiS aU kwir jumlw jwnbwzI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: paesh oo kaar jumalaa jaanabaazee | 14 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, in his view, everyone should be prepared to venture his life for the principles of truth and noble deeds. (14)

lines.gurmukhi: qwilby ^wik aU ich ^wso ich Awm
lines.transliteration_english: thaalibae khaak oo chih khaaso chih aama

Shabad OS N.translation: Whether special person of high status or ordinary people, whether angels or

lines.gurmukhi: ich mlwiek ich hwzrwin qmwm ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: chih malaaeik chih haazaraan thamaam | 15 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Whether onlookers of the heavenly court, all of them are desirous-petitioners of the dust of his lotus feet. (15)

lines.gurmukhi: h?k cU ^u?d vwis&S icgoiem mn
lines.transliteration_english: hak choo khudh vaasifash chigoeim mana

Shabad OS N.translation: When God Himself is showering praises on him, what can I add to that?

lines.gurmukhi: dr rwih vsi& aU ic poiem mn ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: dhar raahi vasaf oo ch poeim man | 16 |

Shabad OS N.translation: In fact, how should I travel on the path of approbations? (16)

lines.transliteration_english: sadh hazaaraa(n) mureedhash az malakootha

Shabad OS N.translation: Millions from the world of souls, the angels, are his devotees,

lines.gurmukhi: sd hzwrW murIdS Az nwsUq ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: sadh hazaaraa(n) mureedhash az naasooth | 17 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, millions of people from this world are also his disciples. (17)

lines.transliteration_english: hamaa jabarootheeaa fidhaae oo

Shabad OS N.translation: Gods of the metaphysical world are all willing to sacrifice themselves for him,

lines.transliteration_english: hamaa laahootheeaa bapaae oo | 18 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, even all the angels of the spiritual world are also prepared to follow suit. (18)

lines.gurmukhi: hmw nwsUqIAwN mlwieik aU
lines.transliteration_english: hamaa naasootheeaa malaaeik oo

Shabad OS N.translation: People of this world are all his creations as angels,

lines.transliteration_english: jalavaa-ash dhaa(n) thehitho faauak nikoo | 19 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, his glimpse is clearly manifested on the lips of everyone. (19)

lines.gurmukhi: jw-nSInwin aU Az aU lwiek
lines.transliteration_english: jaa-nasheenaan oo az oo laaeika

Shabad OS N.translation: All his associates enjoying his company become knowledgeable (of spiritualism)

lines.gurmukhi: izkir qOsIi& zwq rw lwiek ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: zikar thaauaseef zaath raa laaeik | 20 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, they begin to describe the glories of Waaheguru in their speeches. (20)

lines.gurmukhi: Abd Awbwd kdro jwho inSW
lines.transliteration_english: abadh aabaadh kadharo jaaho nishaa(n)

Shabad OS N.translation: Their honor and esteem, status and rank and name and imprints stay in this world forever;

lines.gurmukhi: br A&rwzd iz X?k idgr subhW ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: bar afaraazadh z yak dhigar subehaa(n) | 21 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, the chaste Creator bestows upon them a higher rank than others. (21)

lines.gurmukhi: murSdul-AwlmIN Suds cU i^qwb
lines.transliteration_english: murashadhula-aalamee shudhas choo khithaaba

Shabad OS N.translation: When the prophet of both the world addressed

lines.gurmukhi: Az AnwXwiq hzriq vhwb ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: az anaayaath hazarath vehaab | 22 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Through his benefaction, the all-powerful Waaheguru, he said (22)

lines.transliteration_english: gufath man bandhaa ou ghulaam thoo ama

Shabad OS N.translation: Then he said, I am Your servitor, and I am Your slave,

lines.transliteration_english: khaak akadhaam khaaso aam thoo am | 23 |

Shabad OS N.translation: And, I am the dust of the feet of all of Your ordinary and special people. (23)

lines.transliteration_english: baaz choon hamachunee khithaab aamadha

Shabad OS N.translation: Thus when he addressed Him like this (in stark humility)

lines.gurmukhi: mqvwqr cunIN jvwb Awmd ]24]
lines.transliteration_english: mathavaathar chunee javaab aamadh | 24 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Then he got the same response again and again. (24)

lines.transliteration_english: k manam dhar thoo ghair thoo kas neesatha

Shabad OS N.translation: That I, the Akaalpurkh, abide in you and I do not recognize anyone other than you,

lines.transliteration_english: har chih khaaham kunam hamaa adhaleesath | 25 |

Shabad OS N.translation: Whatever I, the Waheeguru, desire, I do; and I do only the justice. (25)
